Title: Analytics Engineer
Description:
About us

In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.

We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for a Analytics Engineer to help on the journey ahead!





About the team

The Business Intelligence team has 2 main roles in play, Analytics Engineer and Data Analyst. We have developed a comprehensive way of working for ourselves and our stakeholders and build our solutions on the modern data stack using FiveTran, Python, DBT and Snowflake for data ingestion, storage and modeling with Tableau as our primary data visualization product.





What you will be doing

Within the Business Intelligence team, you will get the opportunity to shape how Instabee builds its analytical data layers which serve everyone in our organization and enable us to make better decisions. The data warehouse is a key asset that we use for multiple data processing purposes; while traditional BI is one use case we deploy, we also service data science investigations and create endpoints for our technology teams to use in our products and services.

Why an Analytics Engineer

The intersection of data analysis and engineering has seen the emergence of the Analytics Engineer where data ingestion is a solved problem thanks to SaaS products and easier programmatic integration patterns, and the value focus is on data modeling in SQL and building actionable data models for multiple use cases.

As an Analytics Engineer, you will cover:




Design and build data models that support business processes, where governance and trust in data are critical

Be an expert in data transformation techniques using SQL and here at Instabee we use DBT to automate this as well as Python

Work on analytical projects to help answer a hypothesis or solve an idea a stakeholder might have

Demonstrate an appetite to try new approaches, staying up to date with market trends and advances in data processing

Be comfortable promoting your work both internally and externally


We think you are a person who...




Will have experience from a Data Analyst, Data Engineering or Data Scientist role

A university degree in an analytical field (e.g. Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics)

Has strong knowledge of SQL and command of analytical functions

Understands data modeling techniques and their value in delivering end user self-service

Has good programming skills (Python, Go)

Is able to use a data visualization and methodical approach to communicate your analytical findings

Understands the value of modern cloud computing and SaaS tools we have in play at Instabee (FiveTran, Snowflake, DBT, Tableau, Python)



What we offer

The chance to be part of something truly amazing and revolutionizing the logistics industry with new product offerings and exemplary service is what excites every employee working here today and we are still just getting started!

If you’ve read this far there is clearly nothing stopping you from clicking the apply button.

We look forward to meeting you.



Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:

🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
🍸 Rooftop Fridays: Chill out at our Friday rooftop bar with the best views in town
🥐 Wednesdays Tech Breakfasts: Fuel your midweek with tech talks and tasty bites.
👾 Tech Demos: Dive into the latest innovations with our regular tech showcases.
💻 Modern Tech Stack: Work with cutting-edge technology every day.
🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care
and love to your little one.
🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!


Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.

This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee (Instabox/Budbee) in Sweden.

About us

In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.

We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for a Analytics Engineer to help on the journey ahead!



About the team

The Business Intelligence team has 2 main roles in play, Analytics Engineer and Data Analyst. We have developed a comprehensive way of working for ourselves and our stakeholders and build our solutions on the modern data stack using FiveTran, Python, DBT and Snowflake for data ingestion, storage and modeling with Tableau as our primary data visualization product.

Title: Analytics Consultant
Description:
Vill du skapa förutsättningar för bättre datadrivet beslutsfattande? Då har du kommit rätt! Vi söker dig som vill utveckla morgondagens analysplattformar för att hjälpa organisationer att jobba mer datadrivet.




Om rollen som konsult inom Data & Analytics

Som konsult inom Data & Analytics hos Zington blir du en nyckelspelare i att hjälpa våra kunder att realisera sina ambitioner mot bättre datadrivet beslutsfattande. Ditt uppdrag är att omsätta affärsbehov till moderna och effektiva analyslösningar, oftast baserat på Microsofts molnplattform Azure. Med djup förståelse för kundens affär och processer hjälper du kunden att agera utifrån deras data, vilket skapar möjligheter att optimera verksamheten framåt. Vi bygger molnbaserade data warehouse-lösningar med hjälp av Microsoft Azure och Databricks som främsta verktyg. Vi utvecklar och implementerar lösningar från start till mål och kan även diskutera arkitektur samt för- och nackdelar med olika koncept.




Rollerna det talas mest om inom analysområdet just nu är Data Analysts, Data Engineers och Data Scientists, och vi ser behov hos våra kunder inom alla dessa kompetenser. I dessa roller kombineras teknisk skicklighet med strategisk insikt, helst arbetandes sida vid sida med dina kollegor på Zington. Vill du ta din karriär till nästa nivå? Välkommen att ansöka!




Dina kompetenser och egenskaper

Utbildning som ingenjör, ekonom eller arbetslivserfarenheter som demonstrerar en stark förmåga att sätta sig in i och lösa problem.
Tidigare erfarenhet av Microsofts produkter inom Data & Analytics, gärna inom moln och gärna i rollen som konsult.
+4 års erfarenhet.
Förstår vikten av göra det lilla extra när det behövs men kan samtidigt ge sig själv (och andra) en paus när det behövs.
Trivs i att verka i en föränderlig miljö och inser att flexibilitet är en superkraft.
Talar och skriver obehindrat på svenska såväl som engelska.
Vågar ta hjälp och även hjälpa andra.
Nyfiken.




Mer om rollen

Vi rekryterar löpande och ser gärna att du kan börja så snart som möjligt men månar om att hitta rätt person. Därför värderar vi dina personliga egenskaper och att vi trivs ihop högt.




Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta rekryterande chefer Andreas Åkerblad, andreas.akerblad@zingtongroup.com alternativt Elin Hellström, elin.hellstrom@zingtongroup.com




Om Zington

Zington är ett konsultföretag med expertis inom Management, IT och Design. Vår resa började redan 2008 men idag är vi 250 medarbetare i Stockholm och fler än 4000 kollegor globalt inom VASS koncernen. Vi stöttar kunder som ex. Atrium Ljungberg, Axfood, Apollo och Fora i digital transformation genom att skapa tjänster, bygga lösningar och utforma strategier som driver affären framåt. På Zington ligger vår styrka i våra medarbetare. Oavsett om du är en specialist eller generalist kan vi som konsultföretag erbjuda dig en plats att växa och trivas på. Vi strävar efter att vara en plats där vi stöttar varandra, delar med oss av vår kunskap och utvecklas tillsammans. Vår framgång bygger på engagerade människor – när du växer, växer företag.

Show more

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.

With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.

Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories


Job Description

Day-to-day life 

Design, develop, and deploy data solutions (think databases, pipelines, and warehouses) – tailor-made for clients
Work with team members and Google experts to guide customers to new solutions and through complex data challenges
help junior colleagues become data masters and foster a culture of continuous learning
Work with the latest developments in Google Cloud Platform and continue to develop your expertise
Manage presentations and direct communication with clients, bridging the gap between customers and technical solutions



Want to know more? Check out our people stories on Youtube


Qualifications

We're looking for a data virtuoso with five years of proven experience in designing, developing, and deploying databases, data pipelines, and data warehouses. You'll be a cloud champion who understands data warehousing concepts, setups, and design patterns within the Google Cloud Platform. As a coding mastermind, you'll possess strong SQL and Python or Java skills and a passion for exploring new technologies. 



Excellent communication is key – you'll build relationships with clients, translate their needs into actionable solutions, and present complex topics with clarity and confidence. Finally, you're a team player at heart, thriving in collaborative environments where you can share knowledge, mentor others, and foster a culture of open communication and support.


Additional Information

Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?

Own the AI revolution: Dive into the exciting world of Generative AI and ML, playing a pivotal role in shaping projects around Google's groundbreaking Gemini foundation model.
Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.



"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." — Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.

We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don’t lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn



Benefits

Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
A human-centric and value-based company culture.
Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
A modern office in central Stockholm.
Full provision of work tools.
A variety of social events.



Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.

 

Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check our Instagram page



Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Lead Data Engineer position and become part of something exceptional!



Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page

Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.

 

Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check our Instagram page



Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Lead Data Engineer position and become part of something exceptional!



Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page

Title: Informationsarkitekt - Data & Analytics
Description:
Arbetsuppgifter


Utveckla begreppsmodeller, informationsmodeller och datamodeller
Ansvara för masterdata på Data & Analytics och processer relaterade till masterdata
Driva avdelningens arbete med Data governance


Saknar du fart, fläkt och förändring på jobbet? Bra! Det behöver du inte oroa dig för hos oss.

På SBAB vill alla framåt och vi motiveras av att ständigt förbättra för våra kunder. Även om tempot ibland är snabbt så kompromissar vi aldrig på att vara en hållbar arbetsplats där medarbetarnas utveckling står i fokus. Det hänger också ihop. Tempo, medarbetarfokus och utveckling. När du tar initiativ, vågar utmana, prova nytt och utveckla vår verksamhet kommer du också att utvecklas. Det händer att våra medarbetare växer ur sin roll och kliver in i en annan. På så sätt blir din drivkraft utvecklingsmöjligheter både för dig och för oss. Låter det bra? Välkommen!

Att jobba som Informationsarkitekt

Som Informationsarkitekt hos Data & Analytics kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att bygga och förädla den grund som vår data- och informationshantering vilar på. Du kommer att vara med och forma hur vi organiserar och strukturerar vår information, vilket är avgörande för vår förmåga att fatta datadrivna beslut och skapa värde för våra kunder. Genom att utveckla avancerade begrepps-, informations- och datamodeller, samt leda workshops och analyser, kommer du att säkerställa att vi har en tydlig och effektiv informationsstruktur. Ditt arbete med att skapa och underhålla dokumentation samt ansvara för masterdata och relaterade processer kommer att vara centralt för vår Data & analytics-avdelning. Dessutom kommer du att spela en aktiv roll i vårt arkitekturstyrningsarbete och fungera som en drivande kraft i implementeringen av vår Data governance-strategi.

Om detta låter intressant, då är det dags att bli en del av vårt team! SBAB välkomnar dig till en växande Data & analytics-avdelning. Du kommer att ha möjligheten att samarbeta med erfarna kollegor och bidra till vår gemensamma framgång.

Vi ser gärna att du:


Har en högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom ett relevant område, eller har en bakgrund inom IT-arkitektur och verksamhetsarkitektur genom arbetslivserfarenhet.
Besitter flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet inom informationsarkitektur, och är van vid att arbeta med etablerade arkitekturmetoder, verktyg och processer.
Har erfarenhet av 3NF, Data vault och Inmon- eller Kimbalmodellering.
Har utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter, både i tal och skrift, på svenska och engelska.
Har erfarenhet av Data governance och masterdataplattformar.


Vår arbetsplatsstrategi är en hybridlösning mellan att jobba hemma och arbeta från vårt ljusa och luftiga kontor i Solna Business Park med härlig atmosfär, där vi bland annat har fräscha träningslokaler, cykelparkering inomhus och det bästa: vår egen barista.

Har du check på allt?


Analytisk
Helhetsperspektiv
Initiativtagande
Kommunikativ
Strukturerad


Annars då?

Gillar du oss, och tror att du kan bidra, är vårt tips att inte vänta för länge med att skicka in CV eller LinkedIn-profil. Har du andra idéer på hur du kan visa vem du är? Spännande! Hur du än ansöker så ser vi fram emot att lära känna dig mer.
Show more

  • Ansvara för masterdata på Data & Analytics och processer relaterade till masterdata
  • Driva avdelningens arbete med Data governance

Saknar du fart, fläkt och förändring på jobbet? Bra! Det behöver du inte oroa dig för hos oss.

Vi ser gärna att du:

  • Har en högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom ett relevant område, eller har en bakgrund inom IT-arkitektur och verksamhetsarkitektur genom arbetslivserfarenhet.
  • Besitter flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet inom informationsarkitektur, och är van vid att arbeta med etablerade arkitekturmetoder, verktyg och processer.
  • Har erfarenhet av 3NF, Data vault och Inmon- eller Kimbalmodellering.
  • Har utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter, både i tal och skrift, på svenska och engelska.
  • Har erfarenhet av Data governance och masterdataplattformar.

Vår arbetsplatsstrategi är en hybridlösning mellan att jobba hemma och arbeta från vårt ljusa och luftiga kontor i Solna Business Park med härlig atmosfär, där vi bland annat har fräscha träningslokaler, cykelparkering inomhus och det bästa: vår egen barista.

Har du check på allt?

  • Analytisk
  • Helhetsperspektiv
  • Initiativtagande
  • Kommunikativ
  • Strukturerad

Annars då?

Gillar du oss, och tror att du kan bidra, är vårt tips att inte vänta för länge med att skicka in CV eller LinkedIn-profil. Har du andra idéer på hur du kan visa vem du är? Spännande! Hur du än ansöker så ser vi fram emot att lära känna dig mer.

Title: Database Data Enginer
Description:
Role:

In your role as a Senior Data Engineer, you can work in an ever-evolving agile way of working where you will be part of an empowered product team that strives for continuous learning and improvement. You and your team will:

Providing support, guidelines and best practices on creating and operating data products.Creating and maintaining data products based on business requirements.

You will collaborate with your Product Owner to ensure the right functionality is being developed and the work package can be broken down into tangible items with complexity estimation to be able to plan upcoming sprints. You will determine and maintain the technical design in the area within the given architectural guidelines. Interacting with stakeholders and System Architect is an equally important part of your daily work.

Tech used daily:

Python, Apache Spark, Bash, Table formats (Delta), Cloud Platform technology (Azure), Docker, Data Platforms (Databricks/Snowflake), Github.

Essential requirements:

At least 8 years of experience in relevant fields, with familiarity in Agile methodologies and fluency in English, both spoken and written.


Deep knowledge and passion for modern data architecture principles.
Experience in the design, development, and operation of data pipelines.
Extensive hands-on experience as a Data Engineer in an Agile environment.
Comfortable working both independently and as part of a team.
Pragmatic approach, understanding the balance between the perfect solution and a functional one.
Passion for improving both code quality and data quality.
Knowledge of data modeling, data access, and data storage techniques.
Experience with cloud technologies (Azure and AWS).
Experience applying data protection and privacy methods/tools.


Additional important skills include:


Experience in software development, system design, SQL, orchestration tools (Airflow/Prefect/Dagster), data streaming (Apache Kafka), CI/CD toolchains, IaC, GitOps, DevOps, and networking.
Data is central to everything we do, so a certain level of data expertise is expected. Experience working with the complexities surrounding data is considered an advantage.


Please explain how you meet all the requirements when applying.

Utilization: 100%

Location: Göteborg

Period: 20-10-2024-31-12-2025

Last day to apply: 18-10-2024

We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

Title: Data Engineer - Remote
Description:
For a client we are looking for a Data Engineer. This is a consulting assignment starting in October and ending in March. You can work 100% remote.

Assignment Description

You will be involved in one of the biggest data transformation projects. As a data engineer, you will be working with building data products in the context of the Data Mesh concept based on defined target vision and requirements.

We appreciate a multitude of technical backgrounds, and we believe you will enjoy working here if you are passionate about data.

In this role, you will be required to implement data-intensive solutions for a data-driven organisation.

You will join the Data Engineering Competence area within AI (Artificial Intelligence), Analytics & Data Domain and be an individual contributor in one of the data product-teams. The area supports all our brands globally to create, structure, guard and ensure data is available, understandable and of high quality.

Your Profile


Experience in data query languages (SQL or similar), BigQuery, and different data formats (Parquet, Avro)
Take end-to-end responsibility to design, develop and maintain the large-scale data infrastructure required for the machine learning projects
Have the DevOps mindset and principles to manage CI/CD pipelines and terraform as well as Cloud infrastructure, in our context, it is GCP (Google Cloud Platform).
Leverage the understanding of software architecture and software design patterns to write scalable, maintainable, well-designed, and future-proof code
Work in cross-functional agile team of highly skilled engineers, data scientists, business stakeholders to build the AI ecosystem within our client's organisation

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We know it, you know it. Most companies ramble on about purpose and making the world a better place. And pretty often it feels a bit… well, forced. But we’d like to think that our story is special for real.




Our founders, Shadi Bitar and Ninos Malki, came to Sweden from Syria when they were kids. Books became their compass, guiding them through the maze of life, and helping them shape their destinies in a new world.




Their dream was bold: What if they could unlock the world of books for everyone, making knowledge and inspiration accessible to all? Fast forward a few years, and the tale of Nextory was born.




At Nextory, we've crafted a revolutionary monthly subscription that empowers our users to devour books like never before, be it through reading or listening. It's not just a product; it's a passport to endless adventure and enlightenment.




And now, we're on a quest to find a Data Engineer, someone as passionate as we are about making the world a happier place and enriching lives through the world of reading. Join our extraordinary team, and let's script a future where every day is a chapter of discovery, and every book is a key to a richer life.




WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

As a Data Engineer at Nextory you will work with keeping and developing the data drivenness of Nextotry throughout the organization. With a curious, innovative and analytical mindset and tech-savvy approach you will fuel our data-driven teams.




Together with the team you will be responsible for data services which means, data warehousing, ML/AI, data quality and enabling data insights. You will build and run data pipelines, data warehouses, data frameworks and leverage ML/AI. We believe that you enjoy working autonomously in close collaboration with the cross-functional teams and other stakeholders.




You will be a part of an amazing team and be at the core of understanding a consumer subscription service - always with the continuous aspiration to increase reading! The position is based in Stockholm and you report to our COO.




WHO YOU ARE

We believe that you are currently working in a similar role at a fast-moving company. We believe that you would like to develop a thorough understanding of how consumers use our service and be part of delivering key insights. By using various development techniques, you will keep us in the forefront of creating the best customer experience as well as providing a great self-service data platform. We believe that you take pride in structuring, integrating and transforming data on a daily basis - you believe that data quality is key!

If you have ambitions (or experience!) of working with areas like ML and AI we would love to give you a platform to show your practice! You thrive working in a dynamic and unpretentious environment where you take great responsibility for our product and your team!




SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

• We believe you have, for the field, relevant educational background

• We believe you have around 4 years of experience from working within the field

• We believe that you are an expert in SQL and have worked with Java, Python and/or similar languages

• We believe that you have experience with cloud infrastructure (Azure, AWS, GCP) and cloud data warehousing, preferably BigQuery or equivalent

• We believe that you have experience working with pipelines and data integration solutions with an ELT approach

• We believe that you have experience in operating, maintaining and ensuring quality of production grade software




We are looking forward to your application which should include a CV or LinkedIn profile.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer till KPMG
Description:
Drivs du av att hjälpa olika typer av organisationer bearbeta och strukturera sin data för att möjliggöra analys? Tror du på datadriven innovation? Skulle du vilja utmanas och utvecklas snabbt tillsammans med oss genom rollen som konsult ute hos våra kunder? Då är denna roll för dig! Vi på KPMG bygger nu ut framtidens konsultavdelning inom BI & Analytics. Vi letar efter dig som attraheras av att både sitta ute hos våra kunder, samt vara med oss internt och bygga vidare på ett framgångsrikt team. Hos oss får du de verktyg du behöver för att lyckas, och blir en del av ett stöttande team. Skicka in din ansökan idag och bli en del av en inspirerande arbetsplats med engagerade kollegor.

Om oss och ditt uppdrag

Onsite Solutions består idag av cirka 60 drivna konsulter, fördelade över Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö. Vi är ett sammansvetsat team och ses ofta som KPMG:s "startup", för att vi inte bara vågar tänka stort – vi genomför också våra idéer. Vi är verksamma inom Finance, Data Analytics/BI och HR, och på grund av den höga efterfrågan på vår expertis expanderar vi nu vårt team i Stockholm.

Våra kunder finns representerade i flera olika branscher och innefattar både några av Sveriges största bolag samt mindre entreprenöriella startups. Även uppdragens art är varierande, ofta kommer vi in som en tillfällig kompetensförstärkning eller vid behov av extra kompetens. Vi kan ta oss an de flesta roller inom BI & Analytics, och stannar så länge vi behövs. Vår ambition är att vara en självklar affärspartner, identifiera kundens förbättringsområden och leverera datadrivna lösningar. Vi arbetar oftast på plats hos kunden och blir en integrerad del av organisationen. Att rätt konsult hamnar hos rätt kund är det absolut viktigaste för ett lyckat uppdrag, varav att vi lägger stor vikt i den matchningen och vi är intresserade av just den kompetens du kommer in med.

Vi tror att de bästa besluten baseras på relevant och korrekt data. Ditt uppdrag som konsult inom BI & Analytics är att supportera våra kunder med din expertis. Du driver projekt och utför uppdrag inom exempelvis KPI-automation, data visualisering, utbildning av visualiseringsverktyg och bidrar med strategisk dataanalys till effektiva och professionella leveranser från oss på KPMG.

Vad vi erbjuder

På KPMG är din personliga utveckling central. När du börjar hos oss får du en dedikerad Performance Manager som coachar och stöttar dig i din karriärutveckling. Vi erbjuder en tydlig utvecklingstrappa som ger dig möjligheten att forma din framtid. För rätt kandidat är möjligheterna många!

Idag är vi fyra konsulter som verkar inom BI & Analytics området, men alla inom Onsite Solutions blir dina närmsta kollegor. Vi garanterar att du blir en del av ett socialt, lärande och inspirerande gäng. Som konsult hos oss är du alltid uppbackad av kompetenta kollegor som finns tillgängliga för stöd och expertis i dina uppdrag. Utöver konsultuppdrag anordnar vi regelbundet aktiviteter som AWs, resor, gemensamma träningspass och middagar. Vår interna kultur och starka gemenskap är centrala för oss!

,

För att lyckas hos oss på Onsite Solutions BI & Analytics ser vi att du bör ha:


Universitets- eller högskoleexamen inom relevant område, på kandidat- eller masternivå.
Minst 2 års jobberfarenhet inom en liknande roll.
Kunskap i Python och/eller SQL.
Erfarenhet av datavisualiseringsverktyg som Tableau, PowerBI, Looker och/eller Qlik.
Pratar affärsmässig svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift.


Vi ser det som meriterande om du har följande:


Meriterande med kunskap inom molntjänster som AWS, Azure och/eller GCP.
Meriterande med kunskap inom datawarehousing och verktyg som Redshift, Snowflake eller motsvarande.
God kännedom om ELT/ETL, datamodellering, transformering och visualisering.


I övrigt värdesätter vi att du är en initiativtagande person som får saker att hända, och är snabb på att etablera nätverk. Vi tror att du föredrar att arbeta strukturerat, noggrant och effektivt, samt har en god kommunikativ förmåga. Hos oss finns alla möjligheter att bredda eller fördjupa din kompetens. Vi har höga ambitioner för vår affär och söker dig som verkligen vill vara med och skapa en exceptionellt bra konsultverksamhet. Vi är ett tight team som peppar varandra och bjussar på både kompetens och erfarenheter, och räknar med att du gör detsamma.

Vill du vara med och göra skillnad med oss?

Så, vill du vara med och bygga framtidens konsultavdelning inom BI & Analytics med oss? Vi erbjuder en hybrid arbetsmodell med utgångspunkt i Stockholm. Urval sker löpande. Vill du veta mer om tjänsten innan du söker är du varmt välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Hedvig Gåve på Hedvig.gave@kpmg.se

Eftersom vår framgång bygger på briljanta medarbetare, och vi strävar efter en mångfaldig arbetsplats där alla känner sig välkomna, har vi en rekryteringsprocess som säkerställer att vi är en perfekt match, samtidigt som vi ser till att processen är rättvis och fri från omedvetna fördomar. Rekryteringsprocessen inkluderar:


Telefonavstämning
Kognitiva färdighetstester och personlighetsformulär
Kompetensbaserad intervju
Caseintervju
Referenstagning


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a Data Engineer Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our

About VIPAS :

Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.

Job Description:

We are looking for a talented Data Engineer to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for extracting, transforming, and storing this data in a structured format, as well as visualizing the processed data using Power BI. You will work closely with various stakeholders to provide insights and support business decision-making processes.

Key Responsibilities:


Being able to create structure for the data from various event-based sources
Being able to use the data to transform it
Design and implement efficient storage solutions
Develop dashboards and reports in Power BI
Adhere to data governance policies to ensure security compliance


Requirements:


Familiarity with Azure stack, Azure functions, CosmosDB, Azure Busses, etc.
Familiarity with .NET / Microsoft stack
Familiarity with Python development for data management
Advanced skills in database management
Excellent problem-solving abilities
Strong communication skills and team building skills


Education and Experience:


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
4+ years of professional experience in frontend development.


Required Skills


CosmosDB
Microsoft Stack
.Net
Azure Stack
Database Management
Data Management
Python
Azure Functions
Problem Solving


Preferred Skills


Machine Learning


Languages


English (Proficient)


Why Join Us?

Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.

You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!

Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a Data Engineer Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our

About VIPAS :

Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.

Job Description:

We are looking for a talented Data Engineer to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for extracting, transforming, and storing this data in a structured format, as well as visualizing the processed data using Power BI. You will work closely with various stakeholders to provide insights and support business decision-making processes.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Being able to create structure for the data from various event-based sources
  • Being able to use the data to transform it
  • Design and implement efficient storage solutions
  • Develop dashboards and reports in Power BI
  • Adhere to data governance policies to ensure security compliance

Requirements:

  • Familiarity with Azure stack, Azure functions, CosmosDB, Azure Busses, etc.
  • Familiarity with .NET / Microsoft stack
  • Familiarity with Python development for data management
  • Advanced skills in database management
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities
  • Strong communication skills and team building skills

Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • 4+ years of professional experience in frontend development.

Required Skills

  • CosmosDB
  • Microsoft Stack
  • .Net
  • Azure Stack
  • Database Management
  • Data Management
  • Python
  • Azure Functions
  • Problem Solving

Preferred Skills

  • Machine Learning

Languages

  • English (Proficient)

Why Join Us?

Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Title: Data Engineer - Royalties & Data
Description:
We are looking for someone technically skilled, and passionate about leveraging data to support our artists and drive the growth of our organization!




Role Description




As our Data Engineer in the Tech & Product domain, you will be working with the lifeblood of Amuse: the royalties and data. Your responsibilities will involve collecting, transforming, and extracting valuable insights from data while ensuring it is accessible to end-users and internal stakeholders. You will also play a key part in developing Amuse's best practices for data strategy, ensuring our methods remain forward-thinking and effective.




To thrive in this role, you should be a proactive and analytical thinker, with strong attention to detail and the ability to navigate a fast-paced environment effectively. You take pride in organizing, integrating, and transforming information, knowing that high data quality is crucial for success. Bonus, if you also find the music industry exciting and share our passion for music!




Responsibilities:




Further developing and maintaining the royalty flows through the business.
Collaborate with engineers, PMs, and stakeholders to build and manage the platform for collecting, storing, transforming, and exposing data.
Further develop Amuse's best practices around data strategy.
Build data pipelines in Google Cloud Composer/Airflow to enable user-facing and internal royalty & data use cases.
Collaborate on new features and services that utilize data to provide value to artists and internal stakeholders.
Based on stakeholder input and needs, maintain existing reports and create new financial reports that will be used across the company.




Qualities and skills you possess:




Experienced working in Google Cloud, utilizing services such as Google Cloud Storage, Google Cloud Composer, Big Table, Big Query, etc.
Familiar with the ETL data processing patterns.
Proficient in software development (we mainly use Golang and Python).
Proficient in SQL as a tool for writing reporting and data transformations.
We use the Google Cloud service suite for our data ecosystem, so if you're already familiar with it, that's a bonus.
Bonus if you also:
Have a bachelor's degree in a related field, such as computer science or data/statistics.




Practical information:




Scope: Full-time and permanent.
Team: Tech & Product.
Reports to: Head Of Tech - Jonatan Bodvill.
Location: Stockholm/Hybrid.




If this description resonates with you, we hope you will apply to this role as we'll interview candidates continuously until we find our match. We encourage you to apply even if you do not match the description perfectly, as you may have other relevant experiences.

Title: Business System Analyst
Description:
Business System Analyst for Battery Production, a cornerstone in our clients eMobility program

 

As Business System Analyst for Battery Production, a cornerstone in our clients eMobility program you will translate the business requirement into detailed functional and technical specifications. you will be one key part as an interface between business and IT. You will work with requirement management, data collection and analysis, facilitate workshops to establish as-is and to-be processes. All of this to secure deliveries from IT development to business. As a business and system analyst you will be a part of the strategy and development planning and also have internal responsibilities in OKR work. You will be a part of both projects and maintenance and work in different teams with different tasks but always with the customer in mind.

 

You will

… work primarily with the battery production unit but also work close to other areas connected to the battery production to secure processes to and from production. You will also work with different development teams to verify the completeness and functionality of different deliveries. As a key member of the team focusing on battery production you will work closely with Business stakeholders and as this is a cross-functional role you will work with other IT stakeholders including Project Managers, Business Analysts, Line Managers, Product Owners, etc., and resources in other IT departments. A collaborative mindset is how you will ensure the business needs, architecture perspectives and standards are fully considered and secured in the IT solution at the battery factory.

 

 

Requirements




The top three most important candidate requirements/skills for the role are:

Requirements Management and Process Development
Ability to translate business needs into functional and technical specifications.
Experience in managing requirements, facilitating workshops, and mapping as-is/to-be processes.
Collaboration and Communication Skills
Strong skills in working cross-functionally with business stakeholders, IT teams, and other departments.
Ability to communicate and present effectively in English.
IT Knowledge and Technical Understanding
Experience in IT-related roles with knowledge of ERP, MES, and SCADA systems.
Understanding of development processes, methodologies, and Industry 4.0 concepts.

These skills ensure the candidate can bridge the gap between business and IT, manage technical processes, and collaborate across various teams effectively.

 

 

 Furthermore you have

education within IT on a university level 
2-5 years of work experience within IT
good cooperation skills
good understanding of development
good understanding of process development
good methos and structure skills 
good communication and presentation skills in English 



Experience with ERP, MES and SCADA systems and the impact of Industry 4.0 is meritorious. Swedish language skills are also meritorious. 

 

For you to have fun and thrive in his position we believe you are a curious and structured person with an interest in different technologies who stays up to date with different techniques and methodologies.

 

We value personal characteristics and don’t want you to hesitate to apply even if you don’t fulfil all requirements for the job. 

 

You have a positive mindset and enjoy networking & collaboration rather than working by yourself. 

 

You want to be in the factory or in the office, you know that presence is important and find energy in meeting other people.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:

Merkle Sweden - a Dentsu company is a consultancy firm with expertise in the areas of digital analytics and conversion optimization. We help large corporations and organizations collect, interpret, and act on data from their digital touchpoints, such as apps and websites, and use the data to make their communications and marketing efforts more hard-hitting.

Our extensive experience and deep proficiency in Google Analytics 360 and Google Optimize mean that our clients rely on us for their most complex, challenging assignments.

Job Description:

Merkle is looking for a driven specialist with a huge interest in data and analytics. You’ll be based in either Gothenburg or Stockholm.


Implement metrics for clients and provide regular analysis.
Give recommendations for measurement solutions for digital services based on clients’ business and activity goals.
Maintain and develop a strong know-how of Google Marketing Platform in general and Google Analytics 360 in particular. Other measurement tools may be used.
Provide insights and recommendations that improve clients’ activities and business.
Develop data-visualization solutions (in dashboards) that make it possible for clients to follow sales and other important performance indicators in real time.



Qualifications:


Minimum of 3 years’ experience in similar role
Experience working with large amounts of data and an understanding of SQL and databases.
In-depth knowledge of working with Google Analytics data, being an advanced user.
Presentation skills to both large and small groups of varying degrees of knowledge, internally within the Group and also with clients.
Ability to manage different work tasks and projects and prioritize accordingly as you will be working with several clients and projects at the same time.
Ability to work with data analysis and provide accurate recommendations based on data.
Knowledge of data-visualization tools, formal statistics training, and experience with Google Cloud (especially BigQuery) are desirable.
Good communication skills in Swedish and English, both in speaking and writing.



Some of the Perks We Offer:


We have a collective agreement and attractive benefits. Several years in a row, we have won the DI Gasell Award, won the Mästargasellen Award, and been named a “Superföretag” (Super Company) by Veckans Affärer and Bisnode.
Friendly, knowledgeable colleagues who like to share their knowledge.
Possibility to work with multinational companies in a number of different industries, meaning you get a wide range of experience and the chance to work with different data sets.
Working for a certified reseller of several Google Marketing Platform products and working closely with Google in Sweden, England, Ireland, and the United States. We are the biggest player in the Nordics when it comes to Google Analytics 360.
Continuous personal development in the form of lab days, groups exchanging experiences, and your own professional development budget.
The chance to grow both within your area of specialty and within Dentsu, the global network Merkle Northern Europe is a part of.



Inclusion and Diversity:

Our diverse and inclusive culture enables our employees to bring their whole selves to work and be proud of doing so. For us, this is the foundation for great innovation which, in turn, generates better outcomes for our people, partners and communities. This is why we encourage applications from people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures.

We are happy to discuss flexible and agile approaches to working for all our roles – we can’t promise we will be able to offer you everything you want or need but we do promise to discuss it with you openly and honestly. If you have any reasonable adjustment needs arising from a disability or medical condition to fully participate in the recruitment process, please discuss this with our recruitment teams.

About dentsu:

Dentsu Group is a global marketing communications company headquartered in Tokyo, Japan. It is one of the largest advertising and media firms in the world. The company offers a wide range of services in advertising, marketing, communication, and digital media, catering to clients across various industries.

We help clients to win, keep, and grow their best customers and achieve meaningful progress for their businesses with the best-in-class services and solutions in media, CXM, and creative. For more information please see: www.dentsu.com.

Working with us:

Joining dentsu, you’ll join a team of 72,000 people. It’s an opportunity to produce career-defining work. Along the way, you’ll team up with inspiring colleagues and encounter a richness of clients, cultures, and experiences.  We offer exciting challenges, a great working environment, memorable experiences, and opportunities to shape your future.

Contact:

We look forward to receiving your application for any questions, please contact the TA in charge of this role: Thomas Holley, Talent Acquisition Partner, EMEA, NE by email at: Thomas.holley@dentsu.com or by phone at: +45 53 84 75 82

 

Location:

Stockholm

Brand:

Merkle

Time Type:

Full time

Contract Type:

Permanent

Title: Data Quality Support
Description:
We need a Consultant who can, with coaching from colleagues, help our organization with the following:


Do actual data changes in our systems regarding customer, subscription, and asset data when needed. The person to become an expert on how data is entered into our different systems, where to find data, understand dependencies what the root issue/demand is, and through that understand how to best adjust the data to create custom satisfaction, accuracy, and quality. The person will be taught and coached by employees in the team who are experts but do not have sufficient time to make the actual changes.
We might, for example, see in an analysis that we need to change several customer’s info from one setup to another to have a more efficient way of working and to do changes you need to understand each customer’s situation, which might require detective work in our systems and an understanding of impacts from changes and w solution is best fit for each customer.
Another example could be that a customer is re-organizing which creates new company setups that need to be re-in our systems (for the customers to see their services and assets accurately, and invoices correctly). The person we are looking for would then be the person who understands how to do this and can perform actual change.
Be a person who can work with services and billing support cases
Example cases are that a customer wants to make a change in their service subscription or has received an inaccurate work then contains identifying and understanding the issue, finding a solution together with the customer, and making the solution happen. If a pattern can be identified then the person could also be a part of a business development act. A person who can help in testing of new IT developments and implementations locally. This is a functionality test focused on ensuring accuracy in our data and ensuring that input and extraction of our service, billing, and customer are done accurately and efficiently.


Requirements


All of the above requires a person who is structured, meticulous, has an eye for details and data quality, and can work independently, which requires a higher degree of logical thinking. The person should also not be afraid to align issues and solutions with customers and employees when needed, clear communication and being able to explain pedagogically are important.
The person is required to have good knowledge of common Microsoft Office tools, especially Excel, where this person should know how to use more complicated formulas (macro is not required).
It’s a plus (not a must) if the person has experience in system or software testing.


Skills:


Data Analysis
Excel
Data Quality
Microsoft Office


Education: What we search for is someone who has a good level of logical thinking and is capable of learning new things in a fa accurate way - a relevant University degree is an indicator of this, but not an absolute requirement.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
ICA Sverige söker en Lead Data Analyst – Replenishment

ICA Sverige är mitt i en spännande resa där vi migrerar vår data till Google Cloud. Vi söker nu en Lead Data Analyst för att stödja vårt arbete inom Replenishment. Replenishment är en del inom ICA Sveriges logistikfunktion med huvudsyfte att säkra varutillgången till butik och skapa förutsättningar för en kostnadseffektiv varuförsörjning. Är du en analytisk problemlösare med en passion för data och dess möjligheter? Då kan du vara den vi söker!

Om rollen:

Som Lead Data Analyst kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att skapa förutsättningar för att optimera och kvalitetssäkra våra processer. I denna rollen är du huvudansvarig för att säkerställa datatillgänglighet och driva utvecklingen av datadrivna arbetssätt inom Replenishment. Du blir en nyckelspelare i att hjälpa oss att fatta datadrivna beslut genom att säkerställa att rätt data finns tillgänglig och lämpligt paketerad.

Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:


Driva vår resa med att migrera data till Google Cloud och implementera nya verktyg och tekniker för analys.
Leda arbetet med att utveckla rapporter i aktuella BI-verktyg som t.ex. Tableau, Excel, Google Big Query, Power BI och Celonis. Arbetet sker utifrån ett kundperspektiv där verksamhetens behov styr.
Identifiera och förädla use cases från verksamheten för att driva Replenishment framåt inom datadrivna arbetssätt.
Säkerställer Replenishments intressen vid central utveckling av informationsdatakällor och deltar i projekt vid behov.
Bidra i tvärfunktionella prioforum för logistik och Replenishment med fokus på att säkra prioriteringar och driva utveckling inom det datadrivna.
Ansvara för att datahantering inom Replenishment sker på ett sätt som är i linje med ICA:s säkerhetspolicy.



Vem är du?

Vi söker dig som har en stark bakgrund inom dataanalys och som har erfarenhet av att arbeta med stora datamängder i molnmiljöer, gärna inom Google Cloud. Du är lösningsorienterad och kan arbeta både operativt och strategiskt för att möta verksamhetens databehov. För att lyckas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har:


Kandidatexamen i statistik, datavetenskap, ekonomi eller relaterat område.
Flera års erfarenhet av dataanalys, gärna inom logistik eller supply chain.
Erfarenhet av arbete med Google Cloud eller liknande molnplattformar.
Kunskap om SQL, Python och verktyg för datavisualisering (t.ex. Looker, Tableau eller Power BI).
Starka kommunikations- och samarbetsförmågor samt vana att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team.
Förmåga att arbeta med både strategiska och operativa frågor samt att prioritera utifrån affärsbehov.
Erfarenhet av att självständigt driva analyser och presentera insikter för verksamheten.
Förmåga att utbilda och stötta medarbetare i användningen av data och analysverktyg.



Låter detta som din nästa utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan och bli en del av vårt engagerade team som arbetar för att säkerställa att ICA Sverige fortsätter att vara ledande inom logistik och Replenishment!

Om ICA Gruppen

ICA gruppen är ett av Nordens ledande detaljhandelsföretag med verksamhet inom mat och måltider, bank, apotek, specialvaror och fastigheter. ICAs värderingar grundar sig på enkelhet, engagemang och entreprenörskap. Balansen mellan individens drivkraft och kraften i det gemensamma är en del av vår framgång. Har du vilja och egna idéer finns en mängd möjligheter att lyckas hos oss.

Sista dag för ansökan är 2024-10-25

Intervjuer sker löpande och vi ser fram emot din ansökan så snart som möjligt, tillträdesdatum enligt överenskommelse. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning, heltid med placeringsort Västerås eller Solna.

Kontaktperson:

Tom Söderberg chef Varuflödesanalys

E-post:

tom.soderberg@ica.se

Telefonnummer:

072 220 26 99

ICA ska spegla våra kunder såväl som samhället i stort och är beroende av medarbetare med olika kompetenser. Vi strävar efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund och värdesätter den kunskap och erfarenhet det medför. Vi värnar om goda förutsättningar för ett hållbart arbetsliv för våra medarbetare med god arbetsmiljö och möjlighet till ständig utveckling. Vi tillämpar drogtestning i samband med rekryteringsförfarandet. 
Show more
HTML:
ICA Sverige söker en Lead Data Analyst – Replenishment

ICA Sverige är mitt i en spännande resa där vi migrerar vår data till Google Cloud. Vi söker nu en Lead Data Analyst för att stödja vårt arbete inom Replenishment. Replenishment är en del inom ICA Sveriges logistikfunktion med huvudsyfte att säkra varutillgången till butik och skapa förutsättningar för en kostnadseffektiv varuförsörjning. Är du en analytisk problemlösare med en passion för data och dess möjligheter? Då kan du vara den vi söker!

Om rollen:

Som Lead Data Analyst kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att skapa förutsättningar för att optimera och kvalitetssäkra våra processer. I denna rollen är du huvudansvarig för att säkerställa datatillgänglighet och driva utvecklingen av datadrivna arbetssätt inom Replenishment. Du blir en nyckelspelare i att hjälpa oss att fatta datadrivna beslut genom att säkerställa att rätt data finns tillgänglig och lämpligt paketerad.

Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:

  • Driva vår resa med att migrera data till Google Cloud och implementera nya verktyg och tekniker för analys.
  • Leda arbetet med att utveckla rapporter i aktuella BI-verktyg som t.ex. Tableau, Excel, Google Big Query, Power BI och Celonis. Arbetet sker utifrån ett kundperspektiv där verksamhetens behov styr.
  • Identifiera och förädla use cases från verksamheten för att driva Replenishment framåt inom datadrivna arbetssätt.
  • Säkerställer Replenishments intressen vid central utveckling av informationsdatakällor och deltar i projekt vid behov.
  • Bidra i tvärfunktionella prioforum för logistik och Replenishment med fokus på att säkra prioriteringar och driva utveckling inom det datadrivna.
  • Ansvara för att datahantering inom Replenishment sker på ett sätt som är i linje med ICA:s säkerhetspolicy.


Vem är du?

Vi söker dig som har en stark bakgrund inom dataanalys och som har erfarenhet av att arbeta med stora datamängder i molnmiljöer, gärna inom Google Cloud. Du är lösningsorienterad och kan arbeta både operativt och strategiskt för att möta verksamhetens databehov. För att lyckas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har:

  • Kandidatexamen i statistik, datavetenskap, ekonomi eller relaterat område.
  • Flera års erfarenhet av dataanalys, gärna inom logistik eller supply chain.
  • Erfarenhet av arbete med Google Cloud eller liknande molnplattformar.
  • Kunskap om SQL, Python och verktyg för datavisualisering (t.ex. Looker, Tableau eller Power BI).
  • Starka kommunikations- och samarbetsförmågor samt vana att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team.
  • Förmåga att arbeta med både strategiska och operativa frågor samt att prioritera utifrån affärsbehov.
  • Erfarenhet av att självständigt driva analyser och presentera insikter för verksamheten.
  • Förmåga att utbilda och stötta medarbetare i användningen av data och analysverktyg.


Låter detta som din nästa utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan och bli en del av vårt engagerade team som arbetar för att säkerställa att ICA Sverige fortsätter att vara ledande inom logistik och Replenishment!

Om ICA Gruppen

ICA gruppen är ett av Nordens ledande detaljhandelsföretag med verksamhet inom mat och måltider, bank, apotek, specialvaror och fastigheter. ICAs värderingar grundar sig på enkelhet, engagemang och entreprenörskap. Balansen mellan individens drivkraft och kraften i det gemensamma är en del av vår framgång. Har du vilja och egna idéer finns en mängd möjligheter att lyckas hos oss.

Intervjuer sker löpande och vi ser fram emot din ansökan så snart som möjligt, tillträdesdatum enligt överenskommelse. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning, heltid med placeringsort Västerås eller Solna.

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.

With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.

Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories


Job Description

Day-to-day life 

Design, develop, and deploy data solutions (think databases, pipelines, and warehouses) – tailor-made for clients
Work with team members and Google experts to guide customers to new solutions and through complex data challenges
help junior colleagues become data masters and foster a culture of continuous learning
Work with the latest developments in Google Cloud Platform and continue to develop your expertise
Manage presentations and direct communication with clients, bridging the gap between customers and technical solutions



Want to know more? Check out our people stories on Youtube


Qualifications

We're looking for a data virtuoso with five years of proven experience in designing, developing, and deploying databases, data pipelines, and data warehouses. You'll be a cloud champion who understands data warehousing concepts, setups, and design patterns within the Google Cloud Platform. As a coding mastermind, you'll possess strong SQL and Python or Java skills and a passion for exploring new technologies. 



Excellent communication is key – you'll build relationships with clients, translate their needs into actionable solutions, and present complex topics with clarity and confidence. Finally, you're a team player at heart, thriving in collaborative environments where you can share knowledge, mentor others, and foster a culture of open communication and support.


Additional Information

Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?

Own the AI revolution: Dive into the exciting world of Generative AI and ML, playing a pivotal role in shaping projects around Google's groundbreaking Gemini foundation model.
Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.



"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." — Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.

We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don’t lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn



Benefits

Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
A human-centric and value-based company culture.
Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
A modern office in central Stockholm.
Full provision of work tools.
A variety of social events.



Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.

 

Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check our Instagram page



Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Lead Data Engineer position and become part of something exceptional!



Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page

 

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Map Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!







Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Swedish.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Sweden.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Sweden for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Apply Online Today!

Show more

Title: Data Engineer - Remote
Description:
For a client we are looking for a Data Engineer. This is a consulting assignment starting in October and ending in March. You can work 100% remote.

Assignment Description

You will be involved in one of the biggest data transformation projects. As a data engineer, you will be working with building data products in the context of the Data Mesh concept based on defined target vision and requirements.

We appreciate a multitude of technical backgrounds, and we believe you will enjoy working here if you are passionate about data.

In this role, you will be required to implement data-intensive solutions for a data-driven organisation.

You will join the Data Engineering Competence area within AI (Artificial Intelligence), Analytics & Data Domain and be an individual contributor in one of the data product-teams. The area supports all our brands globally to create, structure, guard and ensure data is available, understandable and of high quality.

Your Profile


Experience in data query languages (SQL or similar), BigQuery, and different data formats (Parquet, Avro)
Take end-to-end responsibility to design, develop and maintain the large-scale data infrastructure required for the machine learning projects
Have the DevOps mindset and principles to manage CI/CD pipelines and terraform as well as Cloud infrastructure, in our context, it is GCP (Google Cloud Platform).
Leverage the understanding of software architecture and software design patterns to write scalable, maintainable, well-designed, and future-proof code
Work in cross-functional agile team of highly skilled engineers, data scientists, business stakeholders to build the AI ecosystem within our client's organisation

Show more

Title: MicroStrategy Developer - SQL/Python
Description:
MicroStrategy Developer - SQL/Python




We’re on the hunt for a skilled MicroStrategy Developer to help build innovative reporting solutions for our leading Financial Services customer.




In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of exciting tasks that bring these solutions to life. From analysing business requirements to designing the semantic layer, creating insightful reports and dashboards, ensuring data security, and managing the release of your work, every day will offer dynamic problem-solving opportunities.




You’ll play a key role in delivering high-quality solutions to production, making a real impact on how users interact with critical data. Your expertise will also help ensure that the reports are not only informative but also secure, as you will be responsible for applying data security measures and performing essential security checks. In addition to developing these solutions, you'll provide support to end users, ensuring they can easily access and benefit from the tools you create.




The customer is looking for someone with extensive experience using MicroStrategy software, particularly in working with large datasets. You should also have strong proficiency in SQL coding and Python scripting to handle data efficiently. While familiarity with the SAF framework is ideal, it’s not essential. What we do value highly is a collaborative spirit, and we are looking for a team player who enjoys sharing ideas and working together to solve complex challenges.




This is a full-time, freelance opportunity offering long-term prosperity and the opportunity to drive major impacts within a leading institution.




This is an urgent role with interview slots confirmed with the client, so please apply immediately if this sounds like the next role for you!

Show more
