We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ambitious, business savvy and passionate about data and analysis? Then we have a unique opportunity for you.




In the Kilroy Group, we have been on an ambitious mission to digitize our end-to-end customer experience across 6 brands, 5 business concepts, 8 markets and 400+ colleagues. In this position you will play a pivotal role in transforming all this data into actionable insights.




As our Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be responsible for delivering data-driven insights and recommendations that can help optimize our strategic priorities and operational excellence. You will work closely with management and various business units to understand their needs and provide them with relevant and reliable reports, dashboards, and analyses. You will also ensure the quality and integrity of our data across source systems, promote a culture of data literacy and instill best practices across the organization. In this position you will get a network across functions, brands, and markets as you get to deep dive into the data and business processes behind our commercial performance across the organization. You will report to the COO.


Areas of responsibilities:
Reports & Dashboards:
Primary responsible for all non-financial reports that help steer our commercial priorities.
Joining financial and non-financial reporting where it adds value by creating business insights.
Complete a unified KPI reporting setup that combines our data sources, preferably in both a PowerBI reporting suite with drill down functionality as well as a slice and dice format accessible via power tools in Excel. We have data sitting in bespoke sales systems, in Salesforce, HR platform, email automation system, marketing platforms as well as survey tools for NPS and similar.
Reports and dashboards should cater to past performance, present operational efficiency, and forecast of future performance.
Collaborate with system analysts/product owners to ensure a unified approach to operational reporting, providing consistent insights across stakeholder groups in our organization.
Analysis & Actionable insights:
Primary responsible for proactive analysis and subsequent actionable insights to help drive commercial excellence, in close collaboration with both product owners and commercial managers.
"Daily go to person" for management when they need help with report creation, analysis, and validation of data on ad hoc analysis.
Data architecture:
Ensure that data for reporting can be ingested from multiple sources, can be transformed and triangulated to support reports and analyses.
Bring your input to the conversation on data management to jointly solve Master data management, i.e. identifying the necessary data for each system and specifying which system holds the master data, consult on the most suitable approach to data integration and storage systems, including plans on data maintenance. Work with relevant stakeholders across the organization to set the standards for governance to ensure high data discipline.







These words describe you well:
You are motivated by complexity and enjoy decomposing high-level information into actionable insights
Ability to communicate complex data findings in a clear and concise manner, both visually, verbally and in writing
Solid understanding of data warehousing, ETL and data modeling concepts and techniques
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and Power BI (in a PC driven and Microsoft based company)
Strong analytical skills, and attention to detail
Curiosity and enthusiasm for identifying patterns or insights, learning new skills, and understanding the data architecture of different tech platforms
A collaborative customer-oriented and commercial mindset, a proactive and flexible attitude
AI curiosity and interest is a plus
A Bachelor or Masters degree or equivalent in business, economics, statistics, computer science or a related field
3+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analysis or a similar role
Fluency in English is required
You are a team player with an ability to develop and sustain strong relationships with stakeholders across the business 

Next step

If you are excited about this opportunity and can see yourself add value in this position, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Please include your CV and cover letter in you application via the link below. 

We look forward to hearing from you!




Kilroy International A/S - About us

Kilroy International A/S heads up a group of leading European companies, specializing in adventurous travel experiences, group trips, study trips, study abroad experiences and student benefits. Our legacy is built on the notion that travelling is the best way to widen your horizon and break down cultural barriers, and this is still what drives our mission today. The Kilroy Group operates in eight markets (Belgium, Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway, Sweden, the Netherlands and the UK) and in 2023 we employed over 400 people and generated a total turnover of more than DKK 1,4 billion.

The Group comprises of seven brands BENNS, Education Abroad, ISIC, Jysk Rejsebureau, KILROY, MyPlanet and Winberg Travel. Our shared units’ office, Kilroy International, supports all brands across the Group with services such as marketing, products, finance, fulfilment, HR, in-house system development and operations. Situated in the heart of Copenhagen, our office fosters an international collegial environment and a dynamic atmosphere. We are approx. 80 colleagues representing more than 15 different nationalities. We pride ourselves with an informal atmosphere and a culture where good ideas are worth investigating and unexpected outcomes are opportunities to learn from.

Read more about us on www.kilroygroup.net

Title: Marketing Insights Analyst
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us to enable the business to generate value through the provision of analytics and insights based on customer data and data from external sources. You will work with data across the full customer journey, from awareness through the sales funnel to loyalty.

As our new Marketing Insights Analyst, you will join Analytics and Insights team in Kongens Lyngby, Denmark. The two key components of this role will be reporting (via Power BI dashboards) and ad hoc, complex Marketing analytics.

Key Responsibilities



Possess contextual business knowledge and functional domain expertise in the advertising, social, CRM and media space, using data, analytics, and insights to add revenue and business-impacting value via audience selection and behavioural engagement.
Develop actionable insights and recommendations for optimization.
Provide insights to aid in the planning of campaigns across marketing channels.
Create and deliver routine reports and as well as ad-hoc and in-depth analytics.
Forecast the potential uplift of campaign activations, optimizations, and new features to aid prioritization.
Build on the foundations of automated data collection, processing, and reporting.
Improve our techniques, processes and quality assurance of implemented analytics tracking and reporting.
Build relationships with data architects, analytics and data teams that manage tools and data sets, with the aim of creating meaningful data integrations that reveal more powerful insights.
Work closely with colleagues, partners and agencies of differing analytics expertise to ensure proposed solutions meet desired reporting requirements.



What You Bring

We are seeking someone who is enthusiastic about data and who are continuously learning and bringing new developments to the team.

Additionally, you bring:



Minimum 8 years of experience in analytics, data science, or quantitative insights in an enterprise setting.
Minimum 3 years working with marketing analytics data.
Master’s Degree or Ph.D. in Data Science, Operations Research, Psychometrics, Marketing Science, Finance, (Bio)Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or another quantitative field.
Advanced skills in writing in Python/R (modelling) and SQL/Spark (data).
Proficiency in evaluating the big picture and solve business problems rather than focusing solely on metrics.
Prior experience with at least one of the following methodologies: media mix modelling, multitouch attribution, customer lifetime value, customer loyalty and churn, behaviour-based segmentation, incrementality modelling, propensity modelling or targeting.
Prior expereince working with Pandas, StatsModels, PYMC, TensorFlow, Pytorch, Spark/ML, sklearn, NumPy and related packages will be advantageous but is not a requirement.
Convincing drive for results and intellectual curiosity; must be a self-starter.
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and projects at once without sacrificing quality.
Excellent written and verbal and communication skills in English.



What We Offer

As part of our Analytics & Insights function, you will join a team of 5 experts based in Lyngby, Denmark. Analytics & Insights is part of our wider marketing function where there will be daily collaboration, but this role will also interact with many other customer-facing functions across the business.

With approximately 1.000 employees, Bang & Olufsen is an agile company that gives room for individual flexibility and decision-making. Our hierarchy is flat, and our communication is open and trustworthy. We believe in mutual respect and with a unique pool of people coming from +55 countries we aim to build a more inclusive workplace to grow as professionals and as a company and remain innovative.

Compensation: Competitive salary and benefits package.

Location: Kongens Lyngby, Denmark.

Start date: As soon as possible.

Travel: Approx. 5%

How To Apply

Submit your CV and application in English by pressing the ‘Apply’ button. Applications are assessed continuously, so please apply as soon as possible and no later than 20th October 2024.

At Bang & Olufsen, we believe in equal opportunities for all. We encourage applicants to focus on their qualifications, skills, and experience when submitting their CVs. Please refrain from including personal information such as photographs, marital status, or gender. Our hiring decisions are based solely on merit, and we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal chance to succeed. If you see yourself in the position and believe you have the potential to support build B&O's future, even if you don't meet all the requirements, we sincerely encourage you to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

If you want to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact our TA Consultant, Nina Vestergaard on NVES@bang-olufsen.dk . Please do not send your CV and application to this e-mail directly as these will not be taken into consideration.

Read more about our recruitment process and explore your career opportunities within Bang & Olufsen here .

Bang & Olufsen has for more than 99 years developed luxury audio products that change moods and inspire minds. With offices in Denmark (headquartered in Struer) and the rest of the world, Bang & Olufsen is determined to create products that push the boundaries of audio technology. To this day, every product is still characterized by the unique combination of beautiful sound, timeless design and unrivalled craftmanship.
Show more

We believe in mutual respect and with a unique pool of people coming from +55 countries we aim to build a more inclusive workplace to grow as professionals and as a company and remain innovative.

Compensation: Competitive salary and benefits package.

Location: Kongens Lyngby, Denmark.

Start date: As soon as possible.

Travel: Approx. 5%

How To Apply

Submit your CV and application in English by pressing the ‘Apply’ button. Applications are assessed continuously, so please apply as soon as possible and no later than 20th October 2024.

At Bang & Olufsen, we believe in equal opportunities for all. We encourage applicants to focus on their qualifications, skills, and experience when submitting their CVs. Please refrain from including personal information such as photographs, marital status, or gender. Our hiring decisions are based solely on merit, and we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal chance to succeed. If you see yourself in the position and believe you have the potential to support build B&O's future, even if you don't meet all the requirements, we sincerely encourage you to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

If you want to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact our TA Consultant, Nina Vestergaard on NVES@bang-olufsen.dk . Please do not send your CV and application to this e-mail directly as these will not be taken into consideration.

Read more about our recruitment process and explore your career opportunities within Bang & Olufsen here .

Bang & Olufsen has for more than 99 years developed luxury audio products that change moods and inspire minds. With offices in Denmark (headquartered in Struer) and the rest of the world, Bang & Olufsen is determined to create products that push the boundaries of audio technology. To this day, every product is still characterized by the unique combination of beautiful sound, timeless design and unrivalled craftmanship.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Lenus is looking for a BI Specialist for our Copenhagen Office

Could you see yourself thriving in a dynamic global culture, working on big and innovative projects that propel the Lenus brand towards an impactful vision of making the world a happier and healthier place? Then this could be the dream job you’ve been looking for.




Why business intelligence specialist and not data analyst?

While the role involves data analysis, the primary responsibility is to co-create solutions with business stakeholders and deliver tangible value. We don’t just build and ship dashboards, we build solutions that enable our stakeholders to reach their goals. Not everything we build is a dashboard. Sometimes it’s a sheet, sometimes it’s a steamlit app, sometimes it’s a product feature, etc. We put a lot of emphasis on business understanding and continuous collaboration. We don’t just deliver numbers but take active ownership of how numbers are used and how our deliveries create value.




Who are we looking for?




Key Responsibilities

As a BI Specialist, you will join us in our Business Intelligence and Data team in Copenhagen and you will:

Identify and design solutions that improve business performance and operational efficiency.
Be responsible for the entire process from requirement identification till successful adoption of deliverables.
Collaborate with stakeholders across business functions (Finance, Marketing, Sales amongst others) to understand data requirements and identify process improvement opportunities.
Design functional and easily interpretable visualizations that drive decision making.
Conduct workshops to educate teams on how to incorporate data in their daily processes.
Work with a high level of autonomy.




Qualifications

You are keen to work on a modern tech stack that is constantly evolving to better meet our business's rapid growth. We use BigQuery as our data warehouse, DBT to organise our business logic and Tableau to primarily visualize all of our data and insights.
You are familiar with Tableau or PowerBI - with some work experience in building the dashboards, preferably from a student position (up to 2 years of relevant experience from a full-time job position is also welcome).
You have a masters in business or a technical masters with some introductory business courses.
You are familiar with SQL to model large datasets.
You are the kind of person that is curious, proactive and a quick learner with solid business understanding.
You love visualizing complex datasets.
You have experience and/or willingness to work in a fast-paced agile environment.
You are motivated by professional challenges and intellectual sparring.




The Team

You will be a valued member of our close-knit team consisting of Data Scientists, BI Specialists and Data Engineers.

Our team is driven by excellent cooperation and dynamic sparring. We take ownership of our projects, come up with new ideas and strive to deliver with the highest quality. Our team is trusted with a great amount of responsibility and we take pride in our autonomous way of working. We trust each other to speak up if feeling stuck or if a new perspective is needed and you’ll find us chatting and sparring throughout the day. As a majority of the team are expats we have naturally become a part of each other’s lives outside Lenus through monthly board game nights, sports activities, team dinners, boat trips, etc.

If you recognize yourself in a setting like this, we’d love to have you on board!




Benefits & Perks

Structured and prioritised development opportunities
Development feedback cycle with quarterly check ins
Team events and monthly social events in all our offices
Company wide events like our summer party, end of year party and Lenus birthday party!
Sports and activities, like paddle tournaments, Workout Wednesdays, Run & Dip, and much more!
Daily snacks and fuel. Our offices are set up with fruits, snack bars, and a selection of drinks
A Macbook and other hardware to support you in your daily work
Mandatory insurance through AP Pension
Voluntary pension plan




We'll be going through applications frequently, so if this sounds like a great opportunity for you, hit apply and our talent team will go through it and be in touch with you. We look forward to reading your application.




About Lenus

Lenus was founded in Denmark by Bertram Thorslund, in 2016. We are a health technology company that empowers health coaches to scale their businesses through the use of pioneering technology and our in-house business, health, and innovation expertise.

We’re inspiring a new generation of health coaches. People who have the power to move not only bodies but minds too. We are at the forefront of an industry under rapid transformation and our strategic innovations pave the path for the change we want to see. Happier and healthier people.

Today, Lenus is headquartered in Copenhagen, with offices in New York, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Hamburg, Madrid, Helsinki, Oslo, Toronto, Miami, Southern California & beyond.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Charles Levick have partnered with a market leader within the Energy Trading space, We have been commissioned to find a highly motivated Senior Quantitative Analyst as they continue to expand their ever growing team.




Your role & responsibilities

You will oversee and deliver independent validation of complex valuation models
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure that P&L and model exposures are accurately verified, captured, and reported
Play a critical role in providing risk oversight to trading desk activities
Regular reassessment of pricing structures and methodologies







Must Have

Strong quantitative skills working with pricing and valuation models
Proficient in SQL & Python
Strong knowledge of European Power and Gas markets







Benefits & Package

Highly competitive salary
Lucrative bonus package
Health Care
A personal learning & development budget
Hybrid role







If this sounds like you, or something you wish to explore further, don't hesitate to reach out or apply:




Thanks,

Ashdon

Title: Data Engineer, Impact
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about creating data solutions that are scalable and provide data-driven insights? If you're interested in joining a dedicated and collaborative team that specializes in data collection, visualization, and reporting to help world-class researchers understand the impact of their work, you might be the Data Engineer we're looking for in our Data Department!

Our Data Department is part of the Novo Nordisk Foundation's Impact Area. The department aims to deliver high-quality data and advanced data-based solutions that align with the Foundation's strategy and key objectives. The goal is to create impact across the entire value chain of the Foundation. The responsibility of the Impact Area is to evaluate the impact of the Foundation's initiatives and monitor our progress toward strategic targets.

The Impact Area comprises 15 highly skilled and passionate colleagues, including seven members in the Data Department. As a team, we are committed to excellence in our work, leveraging strong professional expertise, dedication, and a passion for making a difference in our respective fields, all while enjoying teamwork and camaraderie.

The Job

As a Data Engineer, you'll develop solutions and construct data pipelines to assess Novo Nordisk Foundation's grant impacts across various sectors. Collaborating with the Data Department and Impact Area, you'll handle data processing and analysis. You'll also lead projects creating Business Intelligence (BI) solutions for key stakeholders.

Your tasks will include:


Setting up systems and processes for cleaning data using tools of your choice to ensure high data quality and integrity through audits and validation processes
Extracting data via advanced queries from multiple databases and ensuring seamless system-to-system integration
Designing and implementing dimensional models to support data warehousing and reporting needs
Creating and maintaining semantic models for the BI solutions
Build and maintain data pipelines, primarily using Databricks, PySpark, SQL, and Python to deliver clean, well-structured data for consumption by data scientists and analysts, ensuring readiness for machine learning and statistical analysis, while leveraging relevant Azure tools
Staying updated with the latest industry trends and best practices in data engineering and analytics



Professional And Personal Qualifications

Our ideal candidate holds an M.Sc. and/or Ph.D. in (Social) Data Science or has equivalent experience with documented training. We are looking for someone with at least 5 years of experience in data management or data engineering. You should have extensive knowledge of Python, SQL, and Azure tools like Databricks and Microsoft Fabric, be familiar with Jupyter Notebook or R Studio, and possess:


Broad experience with data engineering and data management
Strong project management skills and experience from implementing BI solution in a larger organization
Expert knowledge in analysing, modelling, and interpreting complex data sets
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal


Your current colleagues would describe you as someone who is collaborative, confident and has a structured approach to problem-solving, and you are known for building strong relationships across your organisation. Furthermore, we are looking for a colleague who is:


Impact oriented, quality-conscious, and with good analytical skills
Well-organised and able to structure complex matters
Able to understand the link between technical solutions, data and organisational behaviour
Curiosity driven, resourceful and resilient
A team player that thrives in a collaborative working environment



What We Offer


A steep learning curve by taking on responsibility from day one
Projects in which you can immerse yourself in challenges to make a positive impact
Freedom to realise own initiatives and implement your ideas
A development-focused workplace where you will be given opportunities to grow both personally and professionally



Working at the Novo Nordisk Foundation

We offer a committed and professional workplace in which we emphasize ensuring that our colleagues thrive, are challenged and have opportunities to develop their potential. A career at the Novo Nordisk Foundation gives you the opportunity to work: 

on important projects that benefit society; 

with key actors within research and development in Denmark;

and as part of a dedicated team that is passionate about creating value for society.

Application and Information

For further information, please contact Head of Data, Senior Impact Lead, Rasmus Vendelbo Lund Jensen on e-mail: RLJ@novo.dk

We encourage you to send your application as soon as possible and no later than 20 October 2024.

To apply, please send your CV, cover letter, grade transcript from university or similar, and other relevant documents by clicking the "Apply now" button.

About The Novo Nordisk Foundation

The Novo Nordisk Foundation dates back to 1922, and is an independent Danish foundation with corporate interests. Our vision is to contribute significantly to research and development that improves the lives of people and the sustainability of society.

In the period 2018-2022, the Novo Nordisk Foundation has awarded DKK 30.6 billion through more than 3,150 grants. Of these, 44% (DKK 13.4 billion) were awarded for physiological, endocrinological, metabolic and other medical research, 5% (DKK 1.5 billion) have been awarded for research hospital activities within diabetes and 51% (DKK 15.6 billion), were awarded for other scientific, humanitarian and social purposes, respectively. The Foundation gets its income from ownership in the Novo Group companies and more than 160 other life science companies.

In the coming years, the Foundation will further broaden its scope and increase its grants for scientific, humanitarian and social purposes. As a consequence, we are a growing organization, which means new job openings and exciting opportunities for employees to be a part of forming the future of the Foundation.

Read more about the Novo Nordisk Foundation's history, strategy and ownership structure here: Frontpage - Novo Nordisk Fonden.

The Foundation gets its income from ownership in the Novo Group companies and more than 160 other life science companies.

In the coming years, the Foundation will further broaden its scope and increase its grants for scientific, humanitarian and social purposes. As a consequence, we are a growing organization, which means new job openings and exciting opportunities for employees to be a part of forming the future of the Foundation.

Read more about the Novo Nordisk Foundation's history, strategy and ownership structure here: Frontpage - Novo Nordisk Fonden.

Title: Data Analyst/Power BI specialist within Marketing Operations
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
#WeAreUR and we continuously redefine automation

Universal Robots, part of Teradyne Inc., has a simple mission: Automation for Anyone. Anywhere .

Our vision is to create a world where people work with robots, not like robots. And with 75,000+ cobots already installed worldwide, we’re already making a difference. Working towards our vision gives us endless opportunities to learn, grow, innovate, and solve problems together as we bring our technology to companies of all sizes all over the world.

The Marketing Operations function in UR Marketing is relatively new. Hence you will join an ambitious and business critical team, who are on an exciting growth journey – keen to improve and support the business and UR marketing even better.

The team supports the global and regional marketing teams on everything related to budgets, targets, performance, and extensive reporting. We work with a substantial list of KPIs and metrics, and it is imperative that you understand the logic and formulas behind. Business acumen is vital in this role, as you will actively help us discover trends and insights that will guide our decisions.

You will be responsible for producing new as well as elevating and maintaining insightful, interactive dashboards and visual reports giving our marketing leaders instant performance insight and drive data-driven decision-making processes within the organization.

Apart from working with the marketing organization, we work closely with the Sales Operations team and the Strategic Data team ensuring our ability to report seamlessly across the commercial organization and spot opportunities and challenges internally and in the market. Hence, you will need to not only work with the numbers but also understand and articulate the story they tell.

Responsibilities


Extract and transform data from various sources e.g. SalesForce to prepare it for analysis.
Develop and maintain dashboards to showcase marketing performance metrics across product areas, pipeline, conversion rates, and value split by e.g. industry, geography, time etc.
Generate Power BI reports with seamless integration into Excel for comprehensive data analysis and reporting.
Build Predictive Analysis reports to enable us to use our data proactively to build stronger plans
Build forecast model


We are driven by honesty and act with integrity - #WhoAreUR


5-8 years of experience from marketing analytics or related field
Proficiency in Power BI, SalesForce and Excel, with hands-on experience in developing marketing dashboards.
Key Competencies includes development of user-friendly dashboards and reports, data visualization and analysis, automating routine tasks and processes, creating data models and implementing best practices
Ability to work independently to identify and visualize relevant KPIs that align with business objectives. Demonstrated ability to gather, structure, and analyze complex data for reporting and visualization purposes
Skilled in collaborating with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to deliver data-driven insights and actionable recommendations
Strong analytical skills to gather and structure data effectively for reporting purposes and look for trends in the numbers we can use to scale our business.
Must be based in Denmark and be fluid in spoken and written English


We collaborate - it´s in our DNA

Join Universal Robots, the ground-breaking technology company, and help us on our mission: Automation for Anyone. Anywhere. Shaping next year’s innovations. Moving a fast-growing industry forward. Building a truly global career. You can do it all here .

At Universal Robots we are a diverse group of bright, ambitious people working at the forefront of collaborative robotics. Through our agility, resilience, and entrepreneurial approach, we are taking our innovative robot products into more markets and regions than ever before.

We employ around 1000 people in offices across North America, South America, Europe, and Asia – and we’re growing all the time. So, if you’re looking to build your career working with some of the best talent from all over the world, we want to get in touch with you!

Please apply using the link. We invite candidates into the recruitment process on a continuous basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

Title: Data Lead 8 Months Contract
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a skilled Data Lead to oversee and guide a team of Data and Business Analysts responsible for securing the data requirements enabling the introduction of a new generation Financial Crime Prevention (FCP) Investigation tool.

In your role you will be collaborating closely with the Data Team Product Owner to drive change in accordance with the FCP Data strategy, ensuring Data Governance, Data Quality and Data Products are delivered in accordance with the business need.

Furthermore, you will be working with a range of diverse stakeholders including Business, Architecture, and Technology owners to align on business requirements, whilst driving efficient project execution in accordance with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe).

Key Responsibilities:


Be servant leader and enabler for a team of data and business analysts ensuring the performance and quality of deliverables
Collaborate closely with stakeholders from Business, Architecture, Train trio and Technology to facilitate decisions and drive the delivery of data requirements according to set data strategy



Qualifications:


Senior Business Analyst (5-8 years)
Proven experience in leading data teams
Excellent stakeholder management skills
Excellent communication skills
Excellent facilitation skills
Very good understanding of data strategy and data modelling principles
Very good understanding of IT strategy and Architecture
Good understanding of principals around data modelling from business and performance perspective
Very good change management understanding
Good understanding of Financial Services and Financial Crime
Fluent English (spoken and written)



Requirements

Required skills

Data Modelling

Change Management

Business Analysis

Languages

English

  • Very good understanding of data strategy and data modelling principles
  • Very good understanding of IT strategy and Architecture
  • Good understanding of principals around data modelling from business and performance perspective
  • Very good change management understanding
  • Good understanding of Financial Services and Financial Crime
  • Fluent English (spoken and written)


Requirements

Required skills

Data Modelling

Change Management

Business Analysis

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Key Role in Improving Decision-Making
Place: Lyngby, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location: Denmark : Lyngby

Country: Denmark

Are you passionate about transforming data into actionable insights? Join a highly dedicated analytics team at our HQ in Lyngby. As a key player in Business Finance, you will help drive smarter decision-making and optimize business processes.

Welcome to Data Insights & Analytics

You will be part of the Data Insights & Analytics team, which consists of 5 employees in Denmark and 4 in India. We have a strong collaborative spirit where curiosity and ambition drive us to explore new technologies and data solutions. Our team supports each other to succeed, fostering a sense of belonging and collective achievement.

In this position, you’ll make an impact by…

As our new Business Intelligence Analyst, you will play a key role in improving decision-making processes by designing and implementing analytical solutions that support business objectives. Primarily focusing on the Finance department, your work will have a broad impact as you collaborate with multiple stakeholders across the company. You will gather and analyze data from various sources to create solutions that align with business goals, metrics, and requirements.

Some Of Your Key Tasks Will Include


Collecting and utilizing data from diverse sources to identify and build solutions.
Creating and maintaining data models, databases, and dashboards to support decision-making.
Collaborating with stakeholders to translate business goals into analytical solutions.
Conducting data quality checks to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Identifying opportunities for process improvements and optimization based on data insights.


Collaboration with colleagues will be key, as you will frequently interact with stakeholders. Whether working on Finance, Commercial, R&D, or production-related projects, your input will drive meaningful results.

To Succeed In This Role, You Will Need


2-5 years of experience in finance, data analytics, or related fields.
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Analytics, Business Administration, Data Science, or a related discipline.
Experience or a willingness to learn programming languages and tools such as Python, KNIME, and Power BI.
A basic understanding of database concepts and data warehousing principles.
A commitment to continuous learning and staying updated on industry trends and technologies.


The ability to collaborate effectively should be complemented with attention to detail and strong communication skills. These attributes will enable you to work across departments and translate complex data into clear insights, driving decision-making within the organization.

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

Application deadline: November 1st 2024

Contact details: Director, Head of Data Insights and Analytics, Christian Bodin, CHRBO@novonesis.com
Show more

Title: (Junior) Specialist (m/f/d) - Data Analytics & Insights Team (CPS-GfK)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Country

Denmark

Job Family

Client Solutions

Our Mission

At Consumer Panel Services GfK, our mission is clear: to provide key information on who buys what, where, how much, how often, and most importantly, why (or why not). We take pride in delivering high-quality, uninterrupted data, expert consultancy, and unparalleled expertise to empower our clients to deliver superior customer experiences at every stage of the shopper journey.

Job Description

We have one goal: To support our customers in strengthening their market position.

In continuous consumer research, we collect and analyse the purchasing behaviour of consumers within the FMCG market. This gives us important information about which purchasing decisions consumers make and how behaviour changes over time. In this way, the consumer panel explains how and when markets and brands change. For them we make predictions for tomorrow so that they can make the right decisions today. Through our data analysis, we filter out and structure the relevant information, we ensure that our customers from trade and industry recognize the right signals that are for them in the flood of data and thus support e.g. marketing strategies.

The (Junior) Specialist (m/f/d) sits within our Data Analytics & Insights Team in Consumer Panel Services and is responsible for research design, project proposal as well as ad hoc data analysis and reporting for our Nordic clients. The (Junior) Specialist is able to take a large amount of data, structure it according to it each case, and built up a relevant storyline for the client in collaboration with the responsible consultants for each client. Reporting to our Director Data Analytics & Insights Team based in Germany the (Junior) Specialist will have an autonomous approach to their work but also benefit from close collaboration with consulting, commercial and operational colleagues across the Nordic region.

Purpose of the Role

The purpose of the role may vary depending on the candidate scope but ideally to include:


Define adequate analyses design
Structuring data and build up a relevant storyline
Responsible for providing all types of insight deliveries to clients
Build solutions colleges and clients can benefit from
Constantly improving our data and add process quality
Provides input for designing statistical analyses and setting up efficient processes
If applicable: is responsible for project management tasks
Proactive and independent problem solving (finds solutions for business problems), not just execution of tasks!


Key Activities

Research Design & Proposal Development


Create and adapt adequate research design
Provides input for designing statistical analyses and setting up efficient processes


Analysis and reporting


Create in-depth client studies for reporting purposes or detailed customer requests
Analyse data and trends in data using various tools in order to generate insights for the client
Develop presentation charts and client reports with corresponding insights which reply the client’s questions; utilization of fact-based-consultancy
Promote automation processes and develops efficient ways to create client deliverables such as excel tables, PPT slides and internal programmes you will learn to use


Client Management


To some extent have client interaction and act as an expert in the analysis we make for them
Being in charge of delivering monthly/quarterly/annual reports to clients


Requirements


Reading and understanding either Danish or Swedish
English language skills - B2 min.
An advantage with skills in Excel and PPT
The motivation to take a large amount of data, structure it and make a universe for many kinds of clients
Eager to learn our internal data analysis programmes
Ideally able to work in our Copenhagen office. Otherwise work from our Stockholm office as an alternative


We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions.

(Junior) Specialist (m/k/d) – Data Analytics & Insights Team

Job beskrivelse

Vi har ét mål: At støtte vores kunder i at styrke deres markedsposition.

I løbende forbrugerundersøgelser indsamler og analyserer vi forbrugernes købsadfærd inden for FMCG-markedet. Dette giver os vigtig information om, hvilke købsbeslutninger forbrugerne træffer, og hvordan adfærd ændrer sig over tid. På den måde identificerer forbrugerpanelet, hvordan og hvornår markeder og brands ændrer sig. For kunderne laver vi morgendagens forudsigelser, så de kan træffe de rigtige beslutninger i dag.

(Junior) Specialist (m/k/d) for Market Research sidder i vores Data Analytics & Insights Team i vores Consumer Panel afdeling og er ansvarlig for analysedesign, projektforslag samt ad hoc dataanalyse og rapportering for vores nordiske kunder. (Junior) Specialist er i stand til at tage en stor mængde data, strukturere den efter det hver case og opbygge en relevant storyline for kunden i samarbejde med de ansvarlige konsulenter for hver kunde. Ved at rapportere til vores Director Data Analytics & Insights Team baseret i Tyskland vil projektlederen have en selvstændig tilgang til deres arbejde, men også drage fordel af et tæt samarbejde med konsulent-, kommercielle og operationelle kolleger på tværs af Norden.

Rollens formål

Formålet med rollen kan variere afhængigt af kandidatens faglige baggrund, men ideelt set omfatte:

Research Design


Definere passende analysedesign
Strukturere data og opbygge en relevant storyline
Ansvarlig for at levere alle typer indsigtsleverancer til kunder
Konstant forbedring af vores data og proceskvalitet
Give input til design af statistiske analyser og opsætning af effektive processer
Hvis relevant: er ansvarlig for projektledelsesopgaver
Proaktiv og selvstændig problemløsning (finder løsninger på forretningsproblemer), ikke kun udførelse af opgaver!


Analyse og rapportering


Udarbejde dybdegående kundeundersøgelser til rapporteringsformål eller detaljerede kundeønsker
Analysere data og trends i data ved hjælp af forskellige værktøjer med henblik på at generere indsigt til kunden
Udvikle præsentationsdiagrammer og klientrapporter med tilsvarende indsigt, som besvarer kundens spørgsmål; udnyttelse af faktabaseret rådgivning
Fremme automatiseringsprocesser og udvikle effektive måder til at skabe kundeleverancer såsom excel-tabeller, PPT-dias og interne programmer, du vil lære at bruge


Kundestyring


Til en vis grad have klientinteraktion og fungere som ekspert i den analyse, vi laver for dem
At stå for levering af månedlige/kvartalsvise/årlige rapporter til kunder


Krav


At læse og forstå enten dansk eller svensk
Engelsk sprogkundskaber - B2 min.
En fordel med kompetencer i Excel og PPT
Motivationen til at tage en stor mængde data, strukturere den og lave et univers til mange forskellige kunder
Klar på at lære vores interne dataanalyseprogrammer
Ideelt set i stand til at arbejde på vores kontor i København. Ellers arbejde fra vores Stockholm-kontor som et alternativ


Vi er en etisk og ærlig virksomhed, der er engageret i sine kunder og medarbejdere. Vi er stolte af at være en inkluderende arbejdsplads for alle og er forpligtet til lige muligheder i beskæftigelsen, som fokuserer på, at alle vores medarbejdere når deres fulde potentiale. Hos CPS arbejder vi sammen med vores kolleger, men tilbyder en fleksibel arbejdstilgang, herunder at dele vores tid mellem kontor & fjernarbejde samt mulighed for at flekse vores arbejdstid omkring teamets kernetimer.

Vi tilbyder et spændende arbejdsmiljø, der bringer mennesker sammen. Vi tilskynder til en iværksætterånd og innovativ ånd. Vi gør brug af de nyeste digitale teknologier. Vi søger en god kollega, som tager imod udfordringer og skaber løsninger.

We are an ethical and honest company that is wholly committed to its clients and employees. We are proud to be an inclusive workplace for all and are committed to equal employment opportunity, focusing on all of our employees reaching their full potential.

We respect and value every employee regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, personality, experience, culture, faith, socio-economic status, or physical or mental disabilities.

We endorse the core principles and rights set forth in the United Nations Declaration of Human Rights and the Social Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union, promoting the universal values of human dignity, freedom, equality, and solidarity.

Learn more about who we are and everything we do on: https://www.gfk-cps.com/about-gfk-cps

Title: Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer (EGRISS)
Description:
Hardship Level (not applicable for home-based)

H (no hardship)

Family Type (not applicable for home-based)

Family

Staff Member / Affiliate Type

UNOPS IICA1

Target Start Date

2025-01-01

Deadline for Applications

October 29, 2024

Terms of Reference

Title: Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer (EGRISS)

ICA Level: IICA-1

Corresponding Level: P-2

Duty station: Copenhagen, Denmark

Duration: 01/01/2025 - 31/12/2025 (with possibility of extension)

General Background

UNHCR’s mandate to protect and find solutions for refugees and other forcibly displaced persons increasingly relies on the availability of timely and reliable data and analysis. The Agency's Global Data Service (GDS) based in Copenhagen, is the focal point in UNHCR for the implementation of its Data Transformation Strategy that has been put in place to facilitate this process over the next few years. Within this, the Statistics, Data Science and Survey Section (SDSS), coordinates the collection, analysis and dissemination of UNHCR's statistics, and provides technical statistical support to regional bureau and country offices. It aims to support the development of improved and more efficient systems for statistics on refugees and other persons of concern to UNHCR, such as stateless people and internally displaced persons (IDPs).

Increasingly, UNHCR’s data efforts are grounded in collaboration and joint engagements with partners to better achieve outcomes for those affected by forced displacement. In contexts of protracted displacement, working closely with governments and national statistical offices to enhance national ownership of data produced and better integrate refugees and IDPs into national statistical systems is a core priority. As part of this effort, UNHCR has taken a leading role in the Expert Group on Refugee, IDP and Statelessness Statistics (EGRISS), both as a Steering Committee member and through hosting its Secretariat. The EGRISS currently consists of 60 countries and 37 international/regional organisations. Other Steering Committee members include the World Bank, Eurostat, Statistics Norway, Joint IDP Profiling Service (JIPS) and United Nations Statistics Division (UNSD), Internal Displacement Monitoring Centre (IDMC), International Organization for Migration (IOM), World Bank-UNHCR Joint Data Center (JDC), United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Western Asia (UNESCWA), Philippines, Colombia, Kurdistan Republic of Iraq and African Union’s Institute of Statistics (STATAFRIC).

The EGRISS was established in 2016 by the UN Statistical Commission to develop recommendations on refugee and IDP statistics and produce guidance for their implementation at country level. The International Recommendations on Refugee (IRRS) and IDP (IRIS) Statistics were endorsed in 2018 and 2020, respectively, under EGRISS' first two mandates. The International Recommendations on Statelessness Statistics (IROSS) were subsequently developed and endorsed in 2023. During 2020-2024, the EGRISS' mandate was expanded to focus on implementation of the recommendations which is ongoing through advocacy, capacity building, and further methodological development and testing. This work will continue through the group’s upcoming mandate period of 2025-2030.

All of EGRISS’ work is developed or conducted collaboratively with affected states and statistical experts from within its membership. The Secretariat therefore plays a critical role in coordinating, facilitating and supporting these collaborative efforts through a range of channels. The Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer will be part of the EGRISS Secretariat and support key activities, as outlined below, in order to help the Group successfully fulfill its mandate from the UNSC.

Purpose and Scope of Assignment

The Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer (EGRISS) will support the work of the Expert Group on Refugee, IDP and Statelessness Statistics (EGRISS). They will report to the Senior Statistics and Data Analysis Officer (EGRISS) and will work in close collaboration with other EGRISS Secretariat colleagues as well as members of the EGRISS Steering Committee and its broader membership.

Duties and Responsibilities

The Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer (EGRISS) will support the implementation of EGRISS third mandate in the following ways:


Support to Secretariat-led activities
Act as focal point for EGRISS E-learning, a flagship resource for EGRISS, including its dissemination (in coordination with the Secretariat’s Communications Officer) and translation into French and Spanish.
Identify opportunities and support activities for IROSS roll-out, including integrating statelessness into the workstreams of Technical Subgroups and exploring linkages with the newly launched Global Alliance to End Statelessness.
Support work of Technical Subgroups
Support to EGRISS Technical Subgroups in close coordination with Technical Subgroup co-leads, identified activity leads and Secretariat staff. This will include coordination support (e.g. organisation of meetings, documentation of minutes, follow up on workplans), administrative support (e.g. development of TORs, procurement processes, organisation of workshops) and substantive support (e.g. research, writing/editing, delivery and follow up from regional workshops) as relevant. During 2025, priorities will likely include organisation and delivery of regional workshop/training in Africa.
Substantive support to specifically identified activities from TSG workplans based on EGRISS priorities for 2025, capacity, interest and opportunities for professional growth. This will primarily include the further development of the durable solutions-related measures outlined in the International Recommendations on IDP Statistics (IRIS) that will be under-taken by a newly (re-)established “IDP Subgroup” including affected states. Tasks will likely include coordination and administrative support tasks for the IDP Subgroup as well as substantive support to activities included in the workplan.
Management support for EGRISS
Budget management support, in close collaboration with Head of Secretariat, including creating and maintaining budget planning and management tools, liaising with relevant finance colleagues for expenditure report reviews, and other tasks as relevant.
Act as team-focal point/coordinator for common Microsoft Teams channels, ensuring guidance is provided to new/existing colleagues, and knowledge management is facilitated.
Other support for EGRISS
Contribute to monitoring & evaluation activities, with focus on areas of responsibility/expertise.
Active participation in Steering Committee meetings as required.
Active participation in and support for EGRISS All Members Meeting.
Input to relevant publications and other communications and reporting activities.
Ad hoc requests from Head of EGRISS Secretariat.


Monitoring and Progress Controls


Regional workshop in Africa successfully delivered (February 2025)
E-learning course translated into French and Spanish (June 2025)
Technical Subgroups effectively supported with coordination and administrative support (ongoing)
New IDP Subgroup established, workplan to complete IRIS durable solutions-related measures developed and progress effectively supported including the delivery of online/in-person meetings (Dec 2025)
EGRISS budget management support effectively provided (ongoing)


Qualifications And Experience


Education


     

University Degree in Statistics, Demography, Public Policy, Social Sciences, International Relations or any other related field.


Work Experience


     

Required:


3 years relevant experience with Undergraduate degree; or 2 years relevant experience with Graduate degree; or 1 year relevant experience with Doctorate degree.
Experience working with multi-stakeholder projects with significant coordination needs.
Experience with administrative work, organization of professional conferences or workshops, and/or budget management in a support capacity.
Experience working with National Statistical Offices, statistical production or quantitative data collection, analysis or dissemination processes.
Experience working on migration, displacement or statelessness policy or practice.
Experience writing or editing technical publications in English.


Desired:


Previous UN experience or experience of working with an international organization.
Ability to work in a second language (ideally French, Spanish or Arabic).
Key Competencies


    


Knowledge about forced displacement, statelessness or related topics.
Understanding of official statistics, including different data sources (surveys, administrative data and census).
Experience with developing written material (reports, notes from meetings and advocacy material).
Knowledge of MS Office suite.
Excellent organizational skills and ability to work within established deadlines.
Excellent oral and written communication skills and interpersonal abilities with fluency in English, (knowledge of another UN language is an asset).


Location and Conditions

The successful candidate will be based in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Shortlisted candidates might be required to sit for a written test. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. No late applications will be accepted.

Please note that UNHCR does not charge a fee at any stage of its recruitment process (application, interview, meeting, travelling, processing, training or any other fees).

All UNHCR workforce members must individually and collectively, contribute towards a working environment where each person feels safe, and empowered to perform their duties. This includes by demonstrating no tolerance for sexual exploitation and abuse, harassment including sexual harassment, sexism, gender inequality, discrimination, and abuse of power.

As individuals and as managers, all must be proactive in preventing and responding to inappropriate conduct, support ongoing dialogue on these matters and speaking up and seeking guidance and support from relevant UNHCR resources when these issues arise.

Terms of Reference

Title: Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer (EGRISS)

ICA Level: IICA-1

Corresponding Level: P-2

Duty station: Copenhagen, Denmark

Duration: 01/01/2025 - 31/12/2025 (with possibility of extension)

General Background

UNHCR’s mandate to protect and find solutions for refugees and other forcibly displaced persons increasingly relies on the availability of timely and reliable data and analysis. The Agency's Global Data Service (GDS) based in Copenhagen, is the focal point in UNHCR for the implementation of its Data Transformation Strategy that has been put in place to facilitate this process over the next few years. Within this, the Statistics, Data Science and Survey Section (SDSS), coordinates the collection, analysis and dissemination of UNHCR's statistics, and provides technical statistical support to regional bureau and country offices. It aims to support the development of improved and more efficient systems for statistics on refugees and other persons of concern to UNHCR, such as stateless people and internally displaced persons (IDPs).

Increasingly, UNHCR’s data efforts are grounded in collaboration and joint engagements with partners to better achieve outcomes for those affected by forced displacement. In contexts of protracted displacement, working closely with governments and national statistical offices to enhance national ownership of data produced and better integrate refugees and IDPs into national statistical systems is a core priority. As part of this effort, UNHCR has taken a leading role in the Expert Group on Refugee, IDP and Statelessness Statistics (EGRISS), both as a Steering Committee member and through hosting its Secretariat. The EGRISS currently consists of 60 countries and 37 international/regional organisations. Other Steering Committee members include the World Bank, Eurostat, Statistics Norway, Joint IDP Profiling Service (JIPS) and United Nations Statistics Division (UNSD), Internal Displacement Monitoring Centre (IDMC), International Organization for Migration (IOM), World Bank-UNHCR Joint Data Center (JDC), United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Western Asia (UNESCWA), Philippines, Colombia, Kurdistan Republic of Iraq and African Union’s Institute of Statistics (STATAFRIC).

The EGRISS was established in 2016 by the UN Statistical Commission to develop recommendations on refugee and IDP statistics and produce guidance for their implementation at country level. The International Recommendations on Refugee (IRRS) and IDP (IRIS) Statistics were endorsed in 2018 and 2020, respectively, under EGRISS' first two mandates. The International Recommendations on Statelessness Statistics (IROSS) were subsequently developed and endorsed in 2023. During 2020-2024, the EGRISS' mandate was expanded to focus on implementation of the recommendations which is ongoing through advocacy, capacity building, and further methodological development and testing. This work will continue through the group’s upcoming mandate period of 2025-2030.

All of EGRISS’ work is developed or conducted collaboratively with affected states and statistical experts from within its membership. The Secretariat therefore plays a critical role in coordinating, facilitating and supporting these collaborative efforts through a range of channels. The Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer will be part of the EGRISS Secretariat and support key activities, as outlined below, in order to help the Group successfully fulfill its mandate from the UNSC.

Purpose and Scope of Assignment

The Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer (EGRISS) will support the work of the Expert Group on Refugee, IDP and Statelessness Statistics (EGRISS). They will report to the Senior Statistics and Data Analysis Officer (EGRISS) and will work in close collaboration with other EGRISS Secretariat colleagues as well as members of the EGRISS Steering Committee and its broader membership.

Duties and Responsibilities

The Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer (EGRISS) will support the implementation of EGRISS third mandate in the following ways:

  • Support to Secretariat-led activities
  • Act as focal point for EGRISS E-learning, a flagship resource for EGRISS, including its dissemination (in coordination with the Secretariat’s Communications Officer) and translation into French and Spanish.
  • Identify opportunities and support activities for IROSS roll-out, including integrating statelessness into the workstreams of Technical Subgroups and exploring linkages with the newly launched Global Alliance to End Statelessness.
  • Support work of Technical Subgroups
  • Support to EGRISS Technical Subgroups in close coordination with Technical Subgroup co-leads, identified activity leads and Secretariat staff. This will include coordination support (e.g. organisation of meetings, documentation of minutes, follow up on workplans), administrative support (e.g. development of TORs, procurement processes, organisation of workshops) and substantive support (e.g. research, writing/editing, delivery and follow up from regional workshops) as relevant. During 2025, priorities will likely include organisation and delivery of regional workshop/training in Africa.
  • Substantive support to specifically identified activities from TSG workplans based on EGRISS priorities for 2025, capacity, interest and opportunities for professional growth. This will primarily include the further development of the durable solutions-related measures outlined in the International Recommendations on IDP Statistics (IRIS) that will be under-taken by a newly (re-)established “IDP Subgroup” including affected states. Tasks will likely include coordination and administrative support tasks for the IDP Subgroup as well as substantive support to activities included in the workplan.
  • Management support for EGRISS
  • Budget management support, in close collaboration with Head of Secretariat, including creating and maintaining budget planning and management tools, liaising with relevant finance colleagues for expenditure report reviews, and other tasks as relevant.
  • Act as team-focal point/coordinator for common Microsoft Teams channels, ensuring guidance is provided to new/existing colleagues, and knowledge management is facilitated.
  • Other support for EGRISS
  • Contribute to monitoring & evaluation activities, with focus on areas of responsibility/expertise.
  • Active participation in Steering Committee meetings as required.
  • Active participation in and support for EGRISS All Members Meeting.
  • Input to relevant publications and other communications and reporting activities.
  • Ad hoc requests from Head of EGRISS Secretariat.

Monitoring and Progress Controls

  • Regional workshop in Africa successfully delivered (February 2025)
  • E-learning course translated into French and Spanish (June 2025)
  • Technical Subgroups effectively supported with coordination and administrative support (ongoing)
  • New IDP Subgroup established, workplan to complete IRIS durable solutions-related measures developed and progress effectively supported including the delivery of online/in-person meetings (Dec 2025)
  • EGRISS budget management support effectively provided (ongoing)

Qualifications And Experience

  • Education

     

University Degree in Statistics, Demography, Public Policy, Social Sciences, International Relations or any other related field.

  • Work Experience

     

Required:

  • 3 years relevant experience with Undergraduate degree; or 2 years relevant experience with Graduate degree; or 1 year relevant experience with Doctorate degree.
  • Experience working with multi-stakeholder projects with significant coordination needs.
  • Experience with administrative work, organization of professional conferences or workshops, and/or budget management in a support capacity.
  • Experience working with National Statistical Offices, statistical production or quantitative data collection, analysis or dissemination processes.
  • Experience working on migration, displacement or statelessness policy or practice.
  • Experience writing or editing technical publications in English.

Desired:

  • Previous UN experience or experience of working with an international organization.
  • Ability to work in a second language (ideally French, Spanish or Arabic).
  • Key Competencies

    

  • Knowledge about forced displacement, statelessness or related topics.
  • Understanding of official statistics, including different data sources (surveys, administrative data and census).
  • Experience with developing written material (reports, notes from meetings and advocacy material).
  • Knowledge of MS Office suite.
  • Excellent organizational skills and ability to work within established deadlines.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills and interpersonal abilities with fluency in English, (knowledge of another UN language is an asset).

Location and Conditions

The successful candidate will be based in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Shortlisted candidates might be required to sit for a written test. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. No late applications will be accepted.

Please note that UNHCR does not charge a fee at any stage of its recruitment process (application, interview, meeting, travelling, processing, training or any other fees).

All UNHCR workforce members must individually and collectively, contribute towards a working environment where each person feels safe, and empowered to perform their duties. This includes by demonstrating no tolerance for sexual exploitation and abuse, harassment including sexual harassment, sexism, gender inequality, discrimination, and abuse of power.

As individuals and as managers, all must be proactive in preventing and responding to inappropriate conduct, support ongoing dialogue on these matters and speaking up and seeking guidance and support from relevant UNHCR resources when these issues arise.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in building the data platforms of the future and shaping how Accenture will become the best in Denmark in AI!

We are currently a group of 20 members in Accenture's department and specialist group for data and artificial intelligence, and we need more wise and committed minds to join our team! As part of Accenture's Data & AI community, you will help build data solutions as well as our internal professional environment within the field.

In our projects, you use a range of skills. We work with data engineering, frontend and backend development, DevOps, data architecture, machine learning and Generative AI. You yourself will have an influence on everyday working life based on what you want to work with. At Accenture, you are in the driver's seat for your future technology career, regardless of whether you want to become a technical expert or a manager with a broad technology background. Accenture is a career school where we guide and learn from each other.

Who are we looking for?

To give you a clearer impression of who we are, we present two of our employees' everyday working life below. We are looking for more AI enthusiasts like Chris and Aurora, with similar ambitions and courage to become part of our active and forward-looking professional environment. In this professional environment, we work with the latest technology in AI and Cloud, organize workshops internally and in customer projects, support technology sales and develop high-quality solutions for our customers.

You are solution-oriented, curious and like to familiarize yourself with new issues where you share your knowledge. You must be happy to work in a team, while also being able to work independently with demanding tasks for our customers.

We are looking for you who:



Has 3+ years of relevant work experience


Has a burning interest in data engineering and artificial intelligence


Has experience with system development, frontend or backend


Has experience with Azure, Google Cloud Platform or AWS


Has practical experience with AI/ML and relevant technologies


Preferably speaks Danish



What can we offer you?



Opportunity to work with frontier technologies on exciting projects with leading companies across various industries


Professional development and training opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career


A local as well as global network


A competitive salary and benefits



Chris's everyday life at Accenture

I studied physics and mathematics and delved into quantum machine learning during my master's. Since I finished my studies in 2022, I have worked at Accenture as a data engineer in the Data&AI department. In my role as backend developer on a significant data platform project for one of our larger clients, I have mainly focused on backend development. I have also had the pleasure of exploring other areas such as front-end development and work with software release strategies, as well as CI/CD automation. This has given me a wide range of skills and experiences in various aspects of software development.

I am actively involved in our vibrant Data&AI community. We regularly organize presentations and invite external speakers to keep us up to date on the latest trends and innovations in the field. In addition, I take regular artificial intelligences and data-related courses to keep up to date with the ever-developing professional landscape. For me, the social aspect is just as important as the academic aspect. Fortunately, this is a group where well-being and togetherness are the focus. We see each other as friends as well as colleagues, and together we organize everything from social events to professional gatherings.

Aurora’s everyday life at Accenture

I have worked as a data engineer in Data&AI since 2022, after studying Computer Science and Engineering at DTU. At university, I immersed myself in various machine learning subjects, and finally ended up with a master's on predicting ship activity in the (partly untouched) Arctic. The combination of data analysis and ML algorithms added flavor, and luckily I get the opportunity to continue exploring this field here at Accenture, with fantastically talented and good colleagues!

I have previously worked on the same project as Chris as data engineer for a large digital transformation, where we use a number of technologies and frameworks for end-to-end development. I am currently on a smaller project working on developing a Generative AI solution through OpenAI. It is incredibly exciting and meaningful to apply today's technology to well-established processes at well-known players. GenAI is a hot topic, which is shown through great commitment to the project within Accenture and at the customer.

In addition to project work, I help lead Accenture's female mentorship program for university students. So there is a lot of variety that you can get involved in, while at the same time you have your belonging in our exotic Data & AI community. Here we are friends and colleagues with the same interests, although there is great variation in the number of years of experience and types of projects, which creates a fantastic starting point to learn from each other. Good atmosphere, low shoulders and commitment!

Does this sound interesting?

Then we would like to hear from you! Paradoxically, we prefer application letters not written by ChatGPT.

Title: Lead Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Redstone Commodity Search focus on offering 360° search solutions to the global commodities markets. With a competitive coverage of Trading Houses, Producers, Majors, Utilities, Merchants, Hedge Funds, Investment Banks and Brokerages; Redstone Commodity Search can confidently offer you an edge in today’s volatile market.




Redstone Commodity Search are working with an established Danish Commodities Trading House, in their search for a Lead Quantitative Researcher to join the growing Energy team.




Key Responsibilities / Tasks




Focus on EU power and Gas markets, seeking out new opportunities and trends.
Build models to power quantitative strategies.
Conduct research and statistical analysis.
Ensure compliance with regulations and reporting within the Energy Market.
Work with large data sets to predict and test statistical market patterns.
Role reports into the Director of Power Trading.




Key Qualifications / Experience




Having a broad understanding of international power and gas fundamentals.
Analytical mindset and strong ability to navigate the markets.
3+ years of relevant quantitative experience.
Master’s degree in finance, mathematics, economics, or a relevant field.
Strong attention to detail, and numerical accuracy.
Located in Denmark.
