Title: (Junior) Specialist (m/f/d) - Data Analytics & Insights Team (CPS-GfK)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Country

Denmark

Job Family

Client Solutions

Our Mission

At Consumer Panel Services GfK, our mission is clear: to provide key information on who buys what, where, how much, how often, and most importantly, why (or why not). We take pride in delivering high-quality, uninterrupted data, expert consultancy, and unparalleled expertise to empower our clients to deliver superior customer experiences at every stage of the shopper journey.

Job Description

We have one goal: To support our customers in strengthening their market position.

In continuous consumer research, we collect and analyse the purchasing behaviour of consumers within the FMCG market. This gives us important information about which purchasing decisions consumers make and how behaviour changes over time. In this way, the consumer panel explains how and when markets and brands change. For them we make predictions for tomorrow so that they can make the right decisions today. Through our data analysis, we filter out and structure the relevant information, we ensure that our customers from trade and industry recognize the right signals that are for them in the flood of data and thus support e.g. marketing strategies.

The (Junior) Specialist (m/f/d) sits within our Data Analytics & Insights Team in Consumer Panel Services and is responsible for research design, project proposal as well as ad hoc data analysis and reporting for our Nordic clients. The (Junior) Specialist is able to take a large amount of data, structure it according to it each case, and built up a relevant storyline for the client in collaboration with the responsible consultants for each client. Reporting to our Director Data Analytics & Insights Team based in Germany the (Junior) Specialist will have an autonomous approach to their work but also benefit from close collaboration with consulting, commercial and operational colleagues across the Nordic region.

Purpose of the Role

The purpose of the role may vary depending on the candidate scope but ideally to include:


Define adequate analyses design
Structuring data and build up a relevant storyline
Responsible for providing all types of insight deliveries to clients
Build solutions colleges and clients can benefit from
Constantly improving our data and add process quality
Provides input for designing statistical analyses and setting up efficient processes
If applicable: is responsible for project management tasks
Proactive and independent problem solving (finds solutions for business problems), not just execution of tasks!



Key Activities

Research Design & Proposal Development


Create and adapt adequate research design
Provides input for designing statistical analyses and setting up efficient processes



Analysis and reporting


Create in-depth client studies for reporting purposes or detailed customer requests
Analyse data and trends in data using various tools in order to generate insights for the client
Develop presentation charts and client reports with corresponding insights which reply the client’s questions; utilization of fact-based-consultancy
Promote automation processes and develops efficient ways to create client deliverables such as excel tables, PPT slides and internal programmes you will learn to use



Client Management


To some extent have client interaction and act as an expert in the analysis we make for them
Being in charge of delivering monthly/quarterly/annual reports to clients



Requirements


Reading and understanding either Danish or Swedish
English language skills - B2 min.
An advantage with skills in Excel and PPT
The motivation to take a large amount of data, structure it and make a universe for many kinds of clients
Eager to learn our internal data analysis programmes
Ideally able to work in our Copenhagen office. Otherwise work from our Stockholm office as an alternative



We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions.

(Junior) Specialist (m/k/d) – Data Analytics & Insights Team

Job beskrivelse

Vi har ét mål: At støtte vores kunder i at styrke deres markedsposition.

I løbende forbrugerundersøgelser indsamler og analyserer vi forbrugernes købsadfærd inden for FMCG-markedet. Dette giver os vigtig information om, hvilke købsbeslutninger forbrugerne træffer, og hvordan adfærd ændrer sig over tid. På den måde identificerer forbrugerpanelet, hvordan og hvornår markeder og brands ændrer sig. For kunderne laver vi morgendagens forudsigelser, så de kan træffe de rigtige beslutninger i dag.

(Junior) Specialist (m/k/d) for Market Research sidder i vores Data Analytics & Insights Team i vores Consumer Panel afdeling og er ansvarlig for analysedesign, projektforslag samt ad hoc dataanalyse og rapportering for vores nordiske kunder. (Junior) Specialist er i stand til at tage en stor mængde data, strukturere den efter det hver case og opbygge en relevant storyline for kunden i samarbejde med de ansvarlige konsulenter for hver kunde. Ved at rapportere til vores Director Data Analytics & Insights Team baseret i Tyskland vil projektlederen have en selvstændig tilgang til deres arbejde, men også drage fordel af et tæt samarbejde med konsulent-, kommercielle og operationelle kolleger på tværs af Norden.

Rollens formål

Formålet med rollen kan variere afhængigt af kandidatens faglige baggrund, men ideelt set omfatte:

Research Design


Definere passende analysedesign
Strukturere data og opbygge en relevant storyline
Ansvarlig for at levere alle typer indsigtsleverancer til kunder
Konstant forbedring af vores data og proceskvalitet
Give input til design af statistiske analyser og opsætning af effektive processer
Hvis relevant: er ansvarlig for projektledelsesopgaver
Proaktiv og selvstændig problemløsning (finder løsninger på forretningsproblemer), ikke kun udførelse af opgaver!



Analyse og rapportering


Udarbejde dybdegående kundeundersøgelser til rapporteringsformål eller detaljerede kundeønsker
Analysere data og trends i data ved hjælp af forskellige værktøjer med henblik på at generere indsigt til kunden
Udvikle præsentationsdiagrammer og klientrapporter med tilsvarende indsigt, som besvarer kundens spørgsmål; udnyttelse af faktabaseret rådgivning
Fremme automatiseringsprocesser og udvikle effektive måder til at skabe kundeleverancer såsom excel-tabeller, PPT-dias og interne programmer, du vil lære at bruge



Kundestyring


Til en vis grad have klientinteraktion og fungere som ekspert i den analyse, vi laver for dem
At stå for levering af månedlige/kvartalsvise/årlige rapporter til kunder



Krav


At læse og forstå enten dansk eller svensk
Engelsk sprogkundskaber - B2 min.
En fordel med kompetencer i Excel og PPT
Motivationen til at tage en stor mængde data, strukturere den og lave et univers til mange forskellige kunder
Klar på at lære vores interne dataanalyseprogrammer
Ideelt set i stand til at arbejde på vores kontor i København. Ellers arbejde fra vores Stockholm-kontor som et alternativ



Vi er en etisk og ærlig virksomhed, der er engageret i sine kunder og medarbejdere. Vi er stolte af at være en inkluderende arbejdsplads for alle og er forpligtet til lige muligheder i beskæftigelsen, som fokuserer på, at alle vores medarbejdere når deres fulde potentiale. Hos CPS arbejder vi sammen med vores kolleger, men tilbyder en fleksibel arbejdstilgang, herunder at dele vores tid mellem kontor & fjernarbejde samt mulighed for at flekse vores arbejdstid omkring teamets kernetimer.

Vi tilbyder et spændende arbejdsmiljø, der bringer mennesker sammen. Vi tilskynder til en iværksætterånd og innovativ ånd. Vi gør brug af de nyeste digitale teknologier. Vi søger en god kollega, som tager imod udfordringer og skaber løsninger.

We are an ethical and honest company that is wholly committed to its clients and employees. We are proud to be an inclusive workplace for all and are committed to equal employment opportunity, focusing on all of our employees reaching their full potential.

We respect and value every employee regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, personality, experience, culture, faith, socio-economic status, or physical or mental disabilities.

We endorse the core principles and rights set forth in the United Nations Declaration of Human Rights and the Social Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union, promoting the universal values of human dignity, freedom, equality, and solidarity.

Learn more about who we are and everything we do on: https://www.gfk-cps.com/about-gfk-cps

Reporting to our Director Data Analytics & Insights Team based in Germany the (Junior) Specialist will have an autonomous approach to their work but also benefit from close collaboration with consulting, commercial and operational colleagues across the Nordic region.

Purpose of the Role

The purpose of the role may vary depending on the candidate scope but ideally to include:

  • Define adequate analyses design
  • Structuring data and build up a relevant storyline
  • Responsible for providing all types of insight deliveries to clients
  • Build solutions colleges and clients can benefit from
  • Constantly improving our data and add process quality
  • Provides input for designing statistical analyses and setting up efficient processes
  • If applicable: is responsible for project management tasks
  • Proactive and independent problem solving (finds solutions for business problems), not just execution of tasks!


Key Activities

Research Design & Proposal Development

  • Create and adapt adequate research design
  • Provides input for designing statistical analyses and setting up efficient processes


Analysis and reporting

  • Create in-depth client studies for reporting purposes or detailed customer requests
  • Analyse data and trends in data using various tools in order to generate insights for the client
  • Develop presentation charts and client reports with corresponding insights which reply the client’s questions; utilization of fact-based-consultancy
  • Promote automation processes and develops efficient ways to create client deliverables such as excel tables, PPT slides and internal programmes you will learn to use


Client Management

  • To some extent have client interaction and act as an expert in the analysis we make for them
  • Being in charge of delivering monthly/quarterly/annual reports to clients


Requirements

  • Reading and understanding either Danish or Swedish
  • English language skills - B2 min.
  • An advantage with skills in Excel and PPT
  • The motivation to take a large amount of data, structure it and make a universe for many kinds of clients
  • Eager to learn our internal data analysis programmes
  • Ideally able to work in our Copenhagen office. Otherwise work from our Stockholm office as an alternative


We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions.

(Junior) Specialist (m/k/d) – Data Analytics & Insights Team

Job beskrivelse

Vi har ét mål: At støtte vores kunder i at styrke deres markedsposition.

I løbende forbrugerundersøgelser indsamler og analyserer vi forbrugernes købsadfærd inden for FMCG-markedet. Dette giver os vigtig information om, hvilke købsbeslutninger forbrugerne træffer, og hvordan adfærd ændrer sig over tid. På den måde identificerer forbrugerpanelet, hvordan og hvornår markeder og brands ændrer sig. For kunderne laver vi morgendagens forudsigelser, så de kan træffe de rigtige beslutninger i dag.

(Junior) Specialist (m/k/d) for Market Research sidder i vores Data Analytics & Insights Team i vores Consumer Panel afdeling og er ansvarlig for analysedesign, projektforslag samt ad hoc dataanalyse og rapportering for vores nordiske kunder. (Junior) Specialist er i stand til at tage en stor mængde data, strukturere den efter det hver case og opbygge en relevant storyline for kunden i samarbejde med de ansvarlige konsulenter for hver kunde. Ved at rapportere til vores Director Data Analytics & Insights Team baseret i Tyskland vil projektlederen have en selvstændig tilgang til deres arbejde, men også drage fordel af et tæt samarbejde med konsulent-, kommercielle og operationelle kolleger på tværs af Norden.

Rollens formål

Formålet med rollen kan variere afhængigt af kandidatens faglige baggrund, men ideelt set omfatte:

Research Design

  • Definere passende analysedesign
  • Strukturere data og opbygge en relevant storyline
  • Ansvarlig for at levere alle typer indsigtsleverancer til kunder
  • Konstant forbedring af vores data og proceskvalitet
  • Give input til design af statistiske analyser og opsætning af effektive processer
  • Hvis relevant: er ansvarlig for projektledelsesopgaver
  • Proaktiv og selvstændig problemløsning (finder løsninger på forretningsproblemer), ikke kun udførelse af opgaver!


Analyse og rapportering

  • Udarbejde dybdegående kundeundersøgelser til rapporteringsformål eller detaljerede kundeønsker
  • Analysere data og trends i data ved hjælp af forskellige værktøjer med henblik på at generere indsigt til kunden
  • Udvikle præsentationsdiagrammer og klientrapporter med tilsvarende indsigt, som besvarer kundens spørgsmål; udnyttelse af faktabaseret rådgivning
  • Fremme automatiseringsprocesser og udvikle effektive måder til at skabe kundeleverancer såsom excel-tabeller, PPT-dias og interne programmer, du vil lære at bruge


Kundestyring

  • Til en vis grad have klientinteraktion og fungere som ekspert i den analyse, vi laver for dem
  • At stå for levering af månedlige/kvartalsvise/årlige rapporter til kunder


Krav

  • At læse og forstå enten dansk eller svensk
  • Engelsk sprogkundskaber - B2 min.
  • En fordel med kompetencer i Excel og PPT
  • Motivationen til at tage en stor mængde data, strukturere den og lave et univers til mange forskellige kunder
  • Klar på at lære vores interne dataanalyseprogrammer
  • Ideelt set i stand til at arbejde på vores kontor i København. Ellers arbejde fra vores Stockholm-kontor som et alternativ


Vi er en etisk og ærlig virksomhed, der er engageret i sine kunder og medarbejdere. Vi er stolte af at være en inkluderende arbejdsplads for alle og er forpligtet til lige muligheder i beskæftigelsen, som fokuserer på, at alle vores medarbejdere når deres fulde potentiale. Hos CPS arbejder vi sammen med vores kolleger, men tilbyder en fleksibel arbejdstilgang, herunder at dele vores tid mellem kontor & fjernarbejde samt mulighed for at flekse vores arbejdstid omkring teamets kernetimer.

Vi tilbyder et spændende arbejdsmiljø, der bringer mennesker sammen. Vi tilskynder til en iværksætterånd og innovativ ånd. Vi gør brug af de nyeste digitale teknologier. Vi søger en god kollega, som tager imod udfordringer og skaber løsninger.

We are an ethical and honest company that is wholly committed to its clients and employees. We are proud to be an inclusive workplace for all and are committed to equal employment opportunity, focusing on all of our employees reaching their full potential.

We respect and value every employee regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, personality, experience, culture, faith, socio-economic status, or physical or mental disabilities.

We endorse the core principles and rights set forth in the United Nations Declaration of Human Rights and the Social Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union, promoting the universal values of human dignity, freedom, equality, and solidarity.

Learn more about who we are and everything we do on: https://www.gfk-cps.com/about-gfk-cps

Title: Data engineer
Description:
Would you like to take part in making renewable energy a commercially viable business by facilitating data-driven value-creation in a global energy trading company? Then you might be just who we are looking for as our new data engineer!

Here’s what the job entails
In the role, your primary function will be to work on data products related to the entire value chain – from pre-trading processes based on signals in the market, to registration of trades, and up until they have been settled. As part of the job, you will do backend development of data pipelines and products, exposing data and advising users on how to find the data they need in the most efficient way.

Concretely, your areas of responsibility will include the following:

collaborate with product owners, other data engineers and users in a dedicated portfolio team to discover new features and data products, leveraging the billions of data points we process every day
analyse, design and develop high quality, scalable data products to support business processes
maintain and continually improve products in the portfolio and the underlying data platform(s)
review other team members’ code and share learnings within the team as well as with the data engineering community in Danske Commodities
learn new technologies and transform your learnings into applicable tools to benefit our business stakeholders and your own development



Meet the team
As our new data engineer, you will join our Data Engineering and Architecture (DARC) team. Here, you will become part of a team of more than 30 data engineers, data scientists and software developers. We are a curious and motivated bunch – curious about each other, about the energy trading business model and, of course, about anything related to data and analytics. Our culture is informal and always with value creation at the forefront of everything we do. Personal development is a high priority, and you will get the opportunity to leverage your existing skill set and add new competencies along the way.

In the team, we enjoy getting together for dinners, paddle matches, mini golf – and not least, our epic DARC parties. At the workplace, everyone enjoys a high amount of flexibility to design a working day that matches their personal preferences.

But enough about us… over to you!
As you will be working with many different stakeholders whose needs you need to understand to create value, we are looking for someone with great collaboration skills. Also, as we handle a lot of data, we imagine that you take a structured approach to information processing.

Furthermore, we imagine that you:

are proficient in Microsoft SQL, i.e. you can document at least two years of experience
are experienced in dimensional modelling, i.e. you can document at least two years of experience
are proficient in English – both written and verbal
potentially have experience with any other programming languages for data (Python, Scala)



Please note that it is not a requirement to have prior knowledge of the energy industry to enter this role; however, prior knowledge or genuine interest in the industry would ensure a smoother onboarding experience.

We’ll take good care of you
At Danske Commodities, we take great care of our people. Joining us means you’ll get a lot of great perks – including social events, cultural experiences, tasty food and benefits to better your health, your life and your future.

Here are some of the benefits we offer our employees:

Flexible working hours including the opportunity to work part-time as well as the option to work from home up to two days per week
Vast development opportunities with the help of your own individual development plan, access to our DC University with 50+ courses as well as remote courses through Harvard Learning
Global career prospects as part of the Equinor group with +20,000 colleagues across the world
10% paid pension as well as a beneficial health care and insurance package
Great parental leave conditions from day one including 26 weeks of paid maternity leave and 16 weeks of paid paternity/co-parent leave as well as the opportunity to join the network Inspired Beyond Babies
Unlimited paid children’s sick days no limit on paid absence days in relation to child sickness
Extra days off five, to be exact, as well as a Yay Day (an additional day off dedicated to ‘me time’) every year – adding to the standard five weeks off each year
Senior days if you’re over 55 years old
Bonus scheme
Share savings meaning you have the opportunity to participate in our parent company Equinor’s attractive share savings programme
Paid at home internet and equipment including a mobile phone with paid subscription and IT equipment for when working from home
100+ yearly social and professional events including DC Sports and DC Talks events, gatherings in our book club, bicycle club, student network, wine club, CS:GO team and more
Various free tickets to family-friendly and cultural attractions
Discounts at hotels, restaurants, sports clubs and more
Organic food including a light breakfast, lunch buffet and snacks throughout the day
An office in the heart of Aarhus right next to the central train station



Recruitment process and relocation
You can read more about our recruitment process here. Please note that if you are an international candidate, we will reimburse travel expenses in connection with potential interviews and support you with the relocation process.

What we’re about
We're a tech-driven energy trading company present in 42 markets across five continents. Our +600 people are driven by a need to constantly better things. If you are too, we could very well be the right place for you. You'll join a collective of thinkers and doers. Aspiring chefs, runners, parents, beekeepers, gamers – the list goes on. We're highly specialised experts within our fields. But it’s actually our diversity of ideas we’re most proud of, which is why we continuously work on strengthening an inclusive culture where diverse teams thrive.

Our organisation is flat with an open-door policy. We expect you to care. About your work. About your own and your colleagues’ collective successes. And about the difference we make at Danske Commodities. Together with our parent company Equinor, we have the vision and strength to accelerate the energy transition and make an impact. Like no other.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a Data Engineer (Oracle + MongoDB) for one of our clients in the Pharma Industry.




Job Description

This role presents an exciting opportunity to join Lab Operations and explore how IT technology can innovate our lab operations area, taking it to the next level of usability and reliability.




Core Responsibilities:

Play your part in our team's success




In this position, you will be part of a product team responsible for helping scientists with access, integration, analysis and visualization of data generated in our clients scientific labs as well as storage of processed data together with enriched analytics of meta data.




Key responsibilites includes:

Optimizing the performance of Oracle views.
Defining robust and scalable data models in Oracle and MongoDB, and developing efficient ETL processes to integrate various data sources seamlessly.
Maintain data pipelines to ensure continuous, accurate data flow from lab instruments to storage systems, facilitating integration with other enterprise systems and external sources.
This role requires hands-on expertise in Oracle, PostgreSQL, and MongoDB, advanced SQL skills, and experience with ETL tools and scripting languages like Python or Shell for automation.







Do you have what it takes?

Extensive experience with Oracle and MongoDB (documentDB).
Proficiency in optimizing database performance and managing large datasets.
Strong knowledge of data modeling principles and best practices.
Ability to design robust, scalable, and efficient data models across multiple database platforms.
Hands-on experience with ETL tools and frameworks.
Proven ability to develop and maintain data pipelines for continuous data flow.
Advanced knowledge of SQL for querying, data manipulation, and performance tuning.
Familiarity with scripting languages such as Python or Shell for automation tasks.
Experience in developing data visualization tools and dashboards.




Start date: 01/11/2024

End date: 30/10/2025

Location: Måløv

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented, curious, and data-driven problem solver who wants to build up and maintain a Data Platform for reporting and analytics in a fast-growing FinTech company? Then you might be the one we are looking for.




Banking Circle is a truly international and vibrant company with more than 550 skilled and dedicated employees worldwide, who are all passionate about creating next-generation mission-critical financial services infrastructure and leading the rise of a super-correspondent banking network.




About the role

We are looking to hire a highly skilled Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering team in Copenhagen, reporting to the Data Engineering Team Lead.




In this role you will get the chance to work on building and maintaining our next generation Data Platform in Azure. The Data Engineering team owns Banking Circle’s Data Platform, which is closely coupled to our payment processing system. Our tech stack includes Python, Terraform, Microsoft Azure cloud ecosystem, Azure DevOps, and Microsoft Power BI. Furthermore, we also use Databricks SQL warehouses and Astronomer/Airflow to orchestrate our processing pipelines.

What you will be doing

Build and maintain our Data Platform in collaboration with peers
Advocate for software architecture patterns, efficient data processing, modern data integration, and solid data modelling
Collaborate in the continual analysis of project requirements in collaboration with teams across the organization
Participate in Agile team rituals (stand-up, planning, and retrospective)
Contribute to continuous improvements of the team’s way of working
Take responsibility for own learning and development




What we are looking for

To be the right candidate for this position, we expect you to have an educational background within computer science, software engineering, or other related fields, with a bachelor's degree as a minimum. We expect you to have 3+ years of relevant work experience within pipelines, infrastructure, or the platform world, including strong Python skills. Furthermore, it is a big advantage if you have experience within Microsoft Azure cloud.




As a person we expect you to be open-minded, and willing to learn and further expand your existing experience in Data Engineering. You are curious, communicative, and able to work well on your own as well in a team.




As Banking Circle is an international company it´s a requirement, that you are fluent in English.




What we offer you

We offer a hybrid work model for our employees to allow for flexibility and productivity, however we do also expect you to spend time in the office on a regular basis to build community and efficiency in the team. Furthermore, we offer a competitive salary and a generous benefit package, opportunities for continuous learning, development, and a dynamic and collaborative culture that values personal initiative and professional achievements.




Would you like to join us?

We will be conducting interviews continuously; therefore, we urge interested candidates to apply online as soon as possible. Please note that we do not accept applications by email.




If you have questions do not hesitate to contact Kheira Nougal, Global Recruitment Partner on khno@bankingcircle.com. No agencies, please.




Who we are

Banking Circle is a fully licensed next generation Payments Bank that is designed to meet the global banking and payments needs of Payments businesses, Banks, and Marketplaces. Through our API, we deliver fast, low-cost global payments and banking services by connecting to the world’s clearing systems – enabling our clients to move liquidity in real-time for all major currencies securely and compliantly. To learn more about Banking Circle, visit us at www.bankingcircle.com




We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, age, religion, sexual orientation, national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local laws, regulations and ordinances.

Title: Senior Master Data Business Analyst
Place: København SV, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about Master Data and data management? Do you have an interest in good data quality and sustainable data solutions? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you in the Master Data Team.

Falck has embarked on an ambitious journey towards becoming a digital and data driven organization. Master Data is acknowledged as a critical component by the executive level, which is why, we are part of the most significant programs in Falck.

To fuel our ongoing digital transformation, we are seeking a highly motivated and result-oriented Senior Master Data Business Analyst to join our team. Your role will be crucial in covering business needs and ensuring successful analysis and documentation, while driving the adoption of MDM practices, and improving processes to deliver high-quality data. We are looking for someone who is passionate about delivering value through data and is eager to contribute to our organization's growth and success.

You will be part of a team consisting of 10 colleagues.


About The Job


In your new position as a In your new position as a Senior Master Data Business Analyst, you will be working with:



Requirements Management: Understand business goals, derive master data ambitions, unveil hidden data needs, and translate them into data requirements. Participate in delivery of requirements and act as quality assurance.
Data Analysis: Lead cross-functional business and data analysis, coordinating within the team and with other teams. Uncovering pains and identifying opportunities.
Governance: Implement global Master Data Governance and data standards across business units and markets.
Business Engagement & Stakeholder Management: Ensure close alignment with business stakeholders, Subject Matter Experts and Master Data Owner/Stewards.
Support Stewardship Community: Actively engage with Master Data Stewards, facilitate meetings and Domain Master Data forums.
Quality Monitoring: Create and utilize quality dashboards to facilitate conversations around the quality and to collaborate with stakeholders to ensure uplift.


We love diversity and we encourage people with all kinds of backgrounds to apply for the job, but

unfortunately, we do not have the possibility to reallocate candidates. Given the nature of the job,

the position requires on-site presence in Copenhagen.


About You


We are looking for a senior profile with a high drive and curiosity to enable better Master Data Management and Master Data Quality.


You enjoy engaging with stakeholders and translate business needs into relevant master data deliverables.
You are comfortable working with requirements related to processes & organization, systems & integrations and especially data quality.
You are good at planning and coordinating deliverables. Some you will manage and develop yourself; others will be co-created together with colleagues in the team.
You are used to incorporating many perspectives in your work, you consider the end-to-end impact and the full data flow. It comes natural to you, to ask ‘why’.
You have a strong focus on impact and business value. If you have experience connecting data use cases with measurable business impact, it will be an advantage.
You have proficiency within Data Management and Data Governance. If you have experience within Master Data Management, it will also be an advantage.
You know your way around Power BI and know how to use it as input for dialogue on data quality.
You have worked with modern data management tools or MDM platforms.
You strive to work smarter by embracing digital opportunities whether it is using our own Falck GPT to support your work, automating data cleansing with robots, or improving data entries by applying data quality assurance practices.
You have great experience in working between business and IT. Maybe you have worked as a Data Analyst, Senior Business Analyst, or Data Governance Specialist.
The ideal candidate has domain knowledge across the entire value chain; commercial, operations,



Financial, HR And Other Group Functions.



About us


The Data function is where data is turned into information in Falck. We are four different teams working with: Data & Analytics, Master Data, Strategic Automation and Power Platform & AI Services. In the entire function we are 90+ data specialists working in Copenhagen and Warsaw.  

The Master Data Team is an international team with good energy and high spirits. We respect each other’s differences and spend many lunches discussing shared interests. We are an animal-loving team that can always be won over with good snacks and cake.

The team has existed for almost 3 years and has grown every year. We work in an agile way, using Azure DevOps, and we have a Master Data-specialized Scrum Master. We are a strategic team that aims to enable the business and group functions through governance, data quality, standardization, and principles. Over the past year we have adopted a more fact-based approach, by using Master Data Quality measurements as input for dialogues.

In Falck, you get highly flexible working conditions. We believe in a strong work-life balance and will aid you in becoming the best version of yourself. We value candidates with a willingness to learn and want you to grow with us by continually exploring new skills and new domains.

If you are a self-starter who is passionate about data, data governance and data quality and want to deliver long-term change, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

We look forward to meeting you.

Show more
HTML:
Are you passionate about Master Data and data management? Do you have an interest in good data quality and sustainable data solutions? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you in the Master Data Team.

Falck has embarked on an ambitious journey towards becoming a digital and data driven organization. Master Data is acknowledged as a critical component by the executive level, which is why, we are part of the most significant programs in Falck.

To fuel our ongoing digital transformation, we are seeking a highly motivated and result-oriented Senior Master Data Business Analyst to join our team. Your role will be crucial in covering business needs and ensuring successful analysis and documentation, while driving the adoption of MDM practices, and improving processes to deliver high-quality data. We are looking for someone who is passionate about delivering value through data and is eager to contribute to our organization's growth and success.

You will be part of a team consisting of 10 colleagues.


About The Job


In your new position as a In your new position as a Senior Master Data Business Analyst, you will be working with:

  • Requirements Management: Understand business goals, derive master data ambitions, unveil hidden data needs, and translate them into data requirements. Participate in delivery of requirements and act as quality assurance.
  • Data Analysis: Lead cross-functional business and data analysis, coordinating within the team and with other teams. Uncovering pains and identifying opportunities.
  • Governance: Implement global Master Data Governance and data standards across business units and markets.
  • Business Engagement & Stakeholder Management: Ensure close alignment with business stakeholders, Subject Matter Experts and Master Data Owner/Stewards.
  • Support Stewardship Community: Actively engage with Master Data Stewards, facilitate meetings and Domain Master Data forums.
  • Quality Monitoring: Create and utilize quality dashboards to facilitate conversations around the quality and to collaborate with stakeholders to ensure uplift.

We love diversity and we encourage people with all kinds of backgrounds to apply for the job, but

unfortunately, we do not have the possibility to reallocate candidates. Given the nature of the job,

the position requires on-site presence in Copenhagen.


About You


We are looking for a senior profile with a high drive and curiosity to enable better Master Data Management and Master Data Quality.

  • You enjoy engaging with stakeholders and translate business needs into relevant master data deliverables.
  • You are comfortable working with requirements related to processes & organization, systems & integrations and especially data quality.
  • You are good at planning and coordinating deliverables. Some you will manage and develop yourself; others will be co-created together with colleagues in the team.
  • You are used to incorporating many perspectives in your work, you consider the end-to-end impact and the full data flow. It comes natural to you, to ask ‘why’.
  • You have a strong focus on impact and business value. If you have experience connecting data use cases with measurable business impact, it will be an advantage.
  • You have proficiency within Data Management and Data Governance. If you have experience within Master Data Management, it will also be an advantage.
  • You know your way around Power BI and know how to use it as input for dialogue on data quality.
  • You have worked with modern data management tools or MDM platforms.
  • You strive to work smarter by embracing digital opportunities whether it is using our own Falck GPT to support your work, automating data cleansing with robots, or improving data entries by applying data quality assurance practices.
  • You have great experience in working between business and IT. Maybe you have worked as a Data Analyst, Senior Business Analyst, or Data Governance Specialist.
  • The ideal candidate has domain knowledge across the entire value chain; commercial, operations,


Financial, HR And Other Group Functions.



 About us


The Data function is where data is turned into information in Falck. We are four different teams working with: Data & Analytics, Master Data, Strategic Automation and Power Platform & AI Services. In the entire function we are 90+ data specialists working in Copenhagen and Warsaw.  

The Master Data Team is an international team with good energy and high spirits. We respect each other’s differences and spend many lunches discussing shared interests. We are an animal-loving team that can always be won over with good snacks and cake.

The team has existed for almost 3 years and has grown every year. We work in an agile way, using Azure DevOps, and we have a Master Data-specialized Scrum Master. We are a strategic team that aims to enable the business and group functions through governance, data quality, standardization, and principles. Over the past year we have adopted a more fact-based approach, by using Master Data Quality measurements as input for dialogues.

In Falck, you get highly flexible working conditions. We believe in a strong work-life balance and will aid you in becoming the best version of yourself. We value candidates with a willingness to learn and want you to grow with us by continually exploring new skills and new domains.

If you are a self-starter who is passionate about data, data governance and data quality and want to deliver long-term change, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

We look forward to meeting you.

Title: Data Management Engineer
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a highly organized, detail-oriented, and communicative data management scientist to be responsible for managing the successful completion of tasks within Quality Control.

In this role you will support QC with Data tasks including visualizations, setup of data flows to track operational activities and identification of improvements in data handling across the department. This position requires a high degree of business acumen as well as process insight to drive, facilitate, and manage stakeholders across the entire QC business with authority and charisma.

In this position you will build up strong insights to our business, and a strong network both internally and with various stakeholders. You will serve as our go-to person in our Data & Visual Workflow hub within QC Projects and hold a key role in overseeing the task portfolio within the team.

Your task and responsibilities among others will be: 


Oversight of portfolio and task distribution within the Data & Visual Workflow hub.
Create and maintain dashboards in Tableau for Quality Control.
Optimize data flow from quality systems to create advanced views, e.g. through use of Power Apps/Power Automate.
Develop and manage models to identify trends and to measure KPIs.
Utilize tools as Alteryx and Tableau for data processing and visualization.



You will work closely together with internal stakeholders within FUJIFILM to ensure high quality and timely completion. You are expected to be service minded and creative in identifying solutions and mitigations for the business, however, you are also expected to be realistic and patient in explaining and guiding your stakeholders in what can be achieved.

The Data & Visual Workflow hub is part of QC Projects which is part of the QC organization. In QC we work in a busy and dynamic environment where we support biologics Drug Substance (DS) and Drug Product (DP) production as well as the global release of commercial products (DS/DP) for our global network of clients.

About Your Qualifications And Competences


Bachelor’s (BA) or Master’s Degree (MSc) in IT, Engineering, or any other relevant field.
Relevant QA IT or QC experience from the pharmaceutical industry.
Knowledge of GMP Quality Systems
As a person, you are organized with an attention to detail and still able to keep an overview.
You are service minded with excellent verbal and oral communication skills.
You have an ability to work independently and are self-driven.
You are a team player.
You thrive in a changing environment.
You enjoy multitasking.



Application

For questions, please do not hesitate to contact hiring manager Stephan Spence on +4541949796.

Working at FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies

We offer a competitive compensation package in a site/company growing rapidly, with many opportunities for individual growth, we also offer access to fitness and an attractive canteen.

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies is an industry-leading Biologics Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in Hillerød, Denmark, Teesside, UK, RTP, North Carolina and College Station, Texas, USA. We use our skills, dedication and ambition to enable impact for the world’s most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcare’s potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customers’ products – enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologic, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion. We fuel one another’s passion, help accelerate progress, expand capabilities, strengthen innovation, and improve processes to improve lives.

Our Manufacturing site in Hillerød, Denmark, brings together a complete range of expertise, capabilities and technologies to manufacture advanced biologics. As we continue to enhance and expand our capabilities, we are looking for people who share our passion, drive, and energy – what we call Genki – to join our team.

 

We offer the chance to be part of a global workplace where passion, drive and commitment are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. Deeply committed to diversity and inclusion, we ensure that everyone no matter their background or gender has an opportunity to develop. We take pride in enriching our communities, caring for our environment, and cultivating a world of opportunity for future generations.

We aim to foster a collaborative, innovative and rewarding environment, where diverse perspectives and people come together united by a common purpose and shared values. We pursue our fullest potential as individual contributors and team members. We strive to be the employer of choice and offer a competitive compensation and benefit package.

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identify or any other protected class.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Uno-X Mobility Danmark
Description:
Vi søger en Business Intelligence Analyst til Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S




Hos Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S søger vi en ny Business Intelligence Analyst til vores BI-team, som vil være med til at styrke det nuværende BI-landskab og drive vores digitale udvikling fremad. Som Business Intelligence Analyst får du mulighed for at analysere data og levere indsigt, der understøtter strategiske beslutninger på tværs af organisationen.




Er du skarp til at indsamle, analysere og præsentere data på en måde, der skaber værdi og hjælper med at træffe bedre forretningsbeslutninger? Så er denne stilling måske noget for dig!




Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S er midt i en spændende udvikling, hvor vi ikke kun leverer moderne og relevante produkter til vores kunder, men også investerer massivt i digitalisering og data. Efter sammenlægningen af Uno-X og det tidligere YX i 2023 står vores IT-systemer over for en gennemgribende integrering med målet om "én virksomhed." Derudover er der stort fokus på at udvikle innovative dataløsninger, som skaber værdi både eksternt og internt.




Dine hovedopgaver:

Som Business Intelligence Analyst bliver du en del af et team, der er ansvarligt for at skabe data-drevne løsninger på tværs af organisationen. Du vil arbejde tæt sammen med forskellige afdelinger for at identificere deres behov og levere værdifulde rapporter og analyser.




Som Business Intelligence Analyst vil dine ansvarsområder omfatte:

Indsamling og analyse af data for at skabe indsigtsfulde rapporter og dashboards i Power BI.
Udvikling og vedligeholdelse af BI-løsninger, der understøtter virksomhedens strategi og operationelle beslutninger.
Transformere komplekse datasæt til letforståelige visualiseringer og anbefalinger.
Samarbejde med resten af BI teamet for at sikre datakvalitet og opretholde relevante datakilder.
Være proaktiv i at identificere muligheder for forbedring gennem dataanalyse.
Samarbejde tæt med alle forretningsområder for at forstå deres specifikke behov og sikre, at rapporter og analyser er tilpasset forretningsmålene og giver værdifuld indsigt til beslutningstagning.
Identificere og implementere muligheder for automatisering af rapporteringsprocesser og løbende forbedringer af BI-systemer.




Hvad forventer vi af dig?

Vi forestiller os, at du har erfaring fra en lignende stilling, hvor du har arbejdet med dataanalyse og udvikling af rapporteringsløsninger. Du er analytisk, struktureret og god til at kommunikere dine indsigter til både tekniske og ikke-tekniske interessenter.




Opsummerende, for at have succes, skal du:

Have erfaring med Power BI til rapportering og datavisualisering.
Kunne omsætte komplekse data til klare, handlingsorienterede anbefalinger.
Være en stærk formidler, som kan præsentere resultater klart og forståeligt.
Være teamplayer og trives med at samarbejde på tværs af organisationen.




Det er en fordel, hvis du har erfaring med resten af Power Platformen.




Hvad kan vi tilbyde?

Vi tilbyder en stærk kultur med gode værdier og fokus på at "bygge store mennesker." Vores arbejdsdag er præget af høj grad af tillid og ansvarstagen samt et langsigtet fokus, hvor der bygges sten på sten. Det har resulteret i et godt arbejdsmiljø med gode forhold og generelt en lang anciennitet i virksomheden.




Derudover har vi:

Et dynamisk og innovativt arbejdsmiljø med spændende opgaver.
Muligheden for at arbejde tæt sammen med forskellige afdelinger og interessenter.
En virksomhedskultur, der værdsætter fleksibilitet og effektivitet.
Konkurrencedygtig løn og gode ansættelsesvilkår.
Mulighed for personlig og faglig udvikling gennem projekter og udfordringer.




Om Uno-X

Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S er en del af norske REITAN Retail A/S. Vores mission er at udvikle og fremme løsninger for fremtidens mobilitet. Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S fokuserer på at drive og vedligeholde et effektivt netværk for flydende brændstof, samtidig med at vi, i samarbejde med vores søsterselskab, udvikler tilbud til elbilister, uanset hvor kunderne har behov for opladning.




Uno-X Mobility Danmark henvender sig til alle segmenter inden for mobilitet: Privat, erhverv, personbiler, varebiler og lastbiler. Herudover tilbyder vi leverancer inden for opvarmning, landbrug, entreprenør og marine.




Uno-X Mobility Danmark har hovedkontor i Søborg, en større omsætning i milliardklassen samt en solid indtjening på bundlinjen. Organisationen følger en lean-tankegang, hvor overflødige ledelseslag ikke eksisterer. Med andre ord, der er en flad organisationsstruktur og kort vej fra idé til handling. Det strategiske omdrejningspunkt for virksomheden er at skabe den bedste kundeoplevelse. Læs mere på www.unoxmobility.dk




Ansøg nu

Lyder jobbet som noget for dig? Så send din ansøgning samt CV via linket. Samtaler afholdes løbende. Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte rekrutteringsansvarlig, Johan Hygum Hillers på johan@individuals.dk.




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig og til at byde en ny, engageret kollega velkommen til Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S!

Title: Data Analyst/Power BI specialist within Marketing Operations
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
#WeAreUR and we continuously redefine automation

Universal Robots, part of Teradyne Inc., has a simple mission: Automation for Anyone. Anywhere .

Our vision is to create a world where people work with robots, not like robots. And with 75,000+ cobots already installed worldwide, we’re already making a difference. Working towards our vision gives us endless opportunities to learn, grow, innovate, and solve problems together as we bring our technology to companies of all sizes all over the world.

The Marketing Operations function in UR Marketing is relatively new. Hence you will join an ambitious and business critical team, who are on an exciting growth journey – keen to improve and support the business and UR marketing even better.

The team supports the global and regional marketing teams on everything related to budgets, targets, performance, and extensive reporting. We work with a substantial list of KPIs and metrics, and it is imperative that you understand the logic and formulas behind. Business acumen is vital in this role, as you will actively help us discover trends and insights that will guide our decisions.

You will be responsible for producing new as well as elevating and maintaining insightful, interactive dashboards and visual reports giving our marketing leaders instant performance insight and drive data-driven decision-making processes within the organization.

Apart from working with the marketing organization, we work closely with the Sales Operations team and the Strategic Data team ensuring our ability to report seamlessly across the commercial organization and spot opportunities and challenges internally and in the market. Hence, you will need to not only work with the numbers but also understand and articulate the story they tell.

Responsibilities


Extract and transform data from various sources e.g. SalesForce to prepare it for analysis.
Develop and maintain dashboards to showcase marketing performance metrics across product areas, pipeline, conversion rates, and value split by e.g. industry, geography, time etc.
Generate Power BI reports with seamless integration into Excel for comprehensive data analysis and reporting.
Build Predictive Analysis reports to enable us to use our data proactively to build stronger plans
Build forecast model


We are driven by honesty and act with integrity - #WhoAreUR


5-8 years of experience from marketing analytics or related field
Proficiency in Power BI, SalesForce and Excel, with hands-on experience in developing marketing dashboards.
Key Competencies includes development of user-friendly dashboards and reports, data visualization and analysis, automating routine tasks and processes, creating data models and implementing best practices
Ability to work independently to identify and visualize relevant KPIs that align with business objectives. Demonstrated ability to gather, structure, and analyze complex data for reporting and visualization purposes
Skilled in collaborating with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to deliver data-driven insights and actionable recommendations
Strong analytical skills to gather and structure data effectively for reporting purposes and look for trends in the numbers we can use to scale our business.
Must be based in Denmark and be fluid in spoken and written English


We collaborate - it´s in our DNA

Join Universal Robots, the ground-breaking technology company, and help us on our mission: Automation for Anyone. Anywhere. Shaping next year’s innovations. Moving a fast-growing industry forward. Building a truly global career. You can do it all here .

At Universal Robots we are a diverse group of bright, ambitious people working at the forefront of collaborative robotics. Through our agility, resilience, and entrepreneurial approach, we are taking our innovative robot products into more markets and regions than ever before.

We employ around 1000 people in offices across North America, South America, Europe, and Asia – and we’re growing all the time. So, if you’re looking to build your career working with some of the best talent from all over the world, we want to get in touch with you!

Please apply using the link. We invite candidates into the recruitment process on a continuous basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible.


Show more
HTML:
#WeAreUR and we continuously redefine automation

Universal Robots, part of Teradyne Inc., has a simple mission: Automation for Anyone. Anywhere .

Our vision is to create a world where people work with robots, not like robots. And with 75,000+ cobots already installed worldwide, we’re already making a difference. Working towards our vision gives us endless opportunities to learn, grow, innovate, and solve problems together as we bring our technology to companies of all sizes all over the world.

The Marketing Operations function in UR Marketing is relatively new. Hence you will join an ambitious and business critical team, who are on an exciting growth journey – keen to improve and support the business and UR marketing even better.

The team supports the global and regional marketing teams on everything related to budgets, targets, performance, and extensive reporting. We work with a substantial list of KPIs and metrics, and it is imperative that you understand the logic and formulas behind. Business acumen is vital in this role, as you will actively help us discover trends and insights that will guide our decisions.

You will be responsible for producing new as well as elevating and maintaining insightful, interactive dashboards and visual reports giving our marketing leaders instant performance insight and drive data-driven decision-making processes within the organization.

Apart from working with the marketing organization, we work closely with the Sales Operations team and the Strategic Data team ensuring our ability to report seamlessly across the commercial organization and spot opportunities and challenges internally and in the market. Hence, you will need to not only work with the numbers but also understand and articulate the story they tell.

Responsibilities

  • Extract and transform data from various sources e.g. SalesForce to prepare it for analysis.
  • Develop and maintain dashboards to showcase marketing performance metrics across product areas, pipeline, conversion rates, and value split by e.g. industry, geography, time etc.
  • Generate Power BI reports with seamless integration into Excel for comprehensive data analysis and reporting.
  • Build Predictive Analysis reports to enable us to use our data proactively to build stronger plans
  • Build forecast model

We are driven by honesty and act with integrity - #WhoAreUR

  • 5-8 years of experience from marketing analytics or related field

  • Key Competencies includes development of user-friendly dashboards and reports, data visualization and analysis, automating routine tasks and processes, creating data models and implementing best practices

  • Skilled in collaborating with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to deliver data-driven insights and actionable recommendations
  • Strong analytical skills to gather and structure data effectively for reporting purposes and look for trends in the numbers we can use to scale our business.
  • Must be based in Denmark and be fluid in spoken and written English

Title: Data Lead 8 Months Contract
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a skilled Data Lead to oversee and guide a team of Data and Business Analysts responsible for securing the data requirements enabling the introduction of a new generation Financial Crime Prevention (FCP) Investigation tool.

In your role you will be collaborating closely with the Data Team Product Owner to drive change in accordance with the FCP Data strategy, ensuring Data Governance, Data Quality and Data Products are delivered in accordance with the business need.

Furthermore, you will be working with a range of diverse stakeholders including Business, Architecture, and Technology owners to align on business requirements, whilst driving efficient project execution in accordance with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe).

Key Responsibilities:


Be servant leader and enabler for a team of data and business analysts ensuring the performance and quality of deliverables
Collaborate closely with stakeholders from Business, Architecture, Train trio and Technology to facilitate decisions and drive the delivery of data requirements according to set data strategy



Qualifications:


Senior Business Analyst (5-8 years)
Proven experience in leading data teams
Excellent stakeholder management skills
Excellent communication skills
Excellent facilitation skills
Very good understanding of data strategy and data modelling principles
Very good understanding of IT strategy and Architecture
Good understanding of principals around data modelling from business and performance perspective
Very good change management understanding
Good understanding of Financial Services and Financial Crime
Fluent English (spoken and written)



Requirements

Required skills

Data Modelling

Change Management

Business Analysis

Languages

English

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Key Role in Improving Decision-Making
Place: Lyngby, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location: Denmark : Lyngby

Country: Denmark

Are you passionate about transforming data into actionable insights? Join a highly dedicated analytics team at our HQ in Lyngby. As a key player in Business Finance, you will help drive smarter decision-making and optimize business processes.

Welcome to Data Insights & Analytics

You will be part of the Data Insights & Analytics team, which consists of 5 employees in Denmark and 4 in India. We have a strong collaborative spirit where curiosity and ambition drive us to explore new technologies and data solutions. Our team supports each other to succeed, fostering a sense of belonging and collective achievement.

In this position, you’ll make an impact by…

As our new Business Intelligence Analyst, you will play a key role in improving decision-making processes by designing and implementing analytical solutions that support business objectives. Primarily focusing on the Finance department, your work will have a broad impact as you collaborate with multiple stakeholders across the company. You will gather and analyze data from various sources to create solutions that align with business goals, metrics, and requirements.

Some Of Your Key Tasks Will Include


Collecting and utilizing data from diverse sources to identify and build solutions.
Creating and maintaining data models, databases, and dashboards to support decision-making.
Collaborating with stakeholders to translate business goals into analytical solutions.
Conducting data quality checks to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Identifying opportunities for process improvements and optimization based on data insights.


Collaboration with colleagues will be key, as you will frequently interact with stakeholders. Whether working on Finance, Commercial, R&D, or production-related projects, your input will drive meaningful results.

To Succeed In This Role, You Will Need


2-5 years of experience in finance, data analytics, or related fields.
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Analytics, Business Administration, Data Science, or a related discipline.
Experience or a willingness to learn programming languages and tools such as Python, KNIME, and Power BI.
A basic understanding of database concepts and data warehousing principles.
A commitment to continuous learning and staying updated on industry trends and technologies.


The ability to collaborate effectively should be complemented with attention to detail and strong communication skills. These attributes will enable you to work across departments and translate complex data into clear insights, driving decision-making within the organization.

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

Application deadline: November 1st 2024

Contact details: Director, Head of Data Insights and Analytics, Christian Bodin, CHRBO@novonesis.com

Title: (Junior) Specialist (m/f/d) - Data Analytics & Insights Team (CPS-GfK)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Country

Denmark

Job Family

Client Solutions

Our Mission

At Consumer Panel Services GfK, our mission is clear: to provide key information on who buys what, where, how much, how often, and most importantly, why (or why not). We take pride in delivering high-quality, uninterrupted data, expert consultancy, and unparalleled expertise to empower our clients to deliver superior customer experiences at every stage of the shopper journey.

Job Description

We have one goal: To support our customers in strengthening their market position.

In continuous consumer research, we collect and analyse the purchasing behaviour of consumers within the FMCG market. This gives us important information about which purchasing decisions consumers make and how behaviour changes over time. In this way, the consumer panel explains how and when markets and brands change. For them we make predictions for tomorrow so that they can make the right decisions today. Through our data analysis, we filter out and structure the relevant information, we ensure that our customers from trade and industry recognize the right signals that are for them in the flood of data and thus support e.g. marketing strategies.

The (Junior) Specialist (m/f/d) sits within our Data Analytics & Insights Team in Consumer Panel Services and is responsible for research design, project proposal as well as ad hoc data analysis and reporting for our Nordic clients. The (Junior) Specialist is able to take a large amount of data, structure it according to it each case, and built up a relevant storyline for the client in collaboration with the responsible consultants for each client. Reporting to our Director Data Analytics & Insights Team based in Germany the (Junior) Specialist will have an autonomous approach to their work but also benefit from close collaboration with consulting, commercial and operational colleagues across the Nordic region.

Purpose of the Role

The purpose of the role may vary depending on the candidate scope but ideally to include:


Define adequate analyses design
Structuring data and build up a relevant storyline
Responsible for providing all types of insight deliveries to clients
Build solutions colleges and clients can benefit from
Constantly improving our data and add process quality
Provides input for designing statistical analyses and setting up efficient processes
If applicable: is responsible for project management tasks
Proactive and independent problem solving (finds solutions for business problems), not just execution of tasks!


Key Activities

Research Design & Proposal Development


Create and adapt adequate research design
Provides input for designing statistical analyses and setting up efficient processes


Analysis and reporting


Create in-depth client studies for reporting purposes or detailed customer requests
Analyse data and trends in data using various tools in order to generate insights for the client
Develop presentation charts and client reports with corresponding insights which reply the client’s questions; utilization of fact-based-consultancy
Promote automation processes and develops efficient ways to create client deliverables such as excel tables, PPT slides and internal programmes you will learn to use


Client Management


To some extent have client interaction and act as an expert in the analysis we make for them
Being in charge of delivering monthly/quarterly/annual reports to clients


Requirements


Reading and understanding either Danish or Swedish
English language skills - B2 min.
An advantage with skills in Excel and PPT
The motivation to take a large amount of data, structure it and make a universe for many kinds of clients
Eager to learn our internal data analysis programmes
Ideally able to work in our Copenhagen office. Otherwise work from our Stockholm office as an alternative


We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions.

(Junior) Specialist (m/k/d) – Data Analytics & Insights Team

Job beskrivelse

Vi har ét mål: At støtte vores kunder i at styrke deres markedsposition.

I løbende forbrugerundersøgelser indsamler og analyserer vi forbrugernes købsadfærd inden for FMCG-markedet. Dette giver os vigtig information om, hvilke købsbeslutninger forbrugerne træffer, og hvordan adfærd ændrer sig over tid. På den måde identificerer forbrugerpanelet, hvordan og hvornår markeder og brands ændrer sig. For kunderne laver vi morgendagens forudsigelser, så de kan træffe de rigtige beslutninger i dag.

(Junior) Specialist (m/k/d) for Market Research sidder i vores Data Analytics & Insights Team i vores Consumer Panel afdeling og er ansvarlig for analysedesign, projektforslag samt ad hoc dataanalyse og rapportering for vores nordiske kunder. (Junior) Specialist er i stand til at tage en stor mængde data, strukturere den efter det hver case og opbygge en relevant storyline for kunden i samarbejde med de ansvarlige konsulenter for hver kunde. Ved at rapportere til vores Director Data Analytics & Insights Team baseret i Tyskland vil projektlederen have en selvstændig tilgang til deres arbejde, men også drage fordel af et tæt samarbejde med konsulent-, kommercielle og operationelle kolleger på tværs af Norden.

Rollens formål

Formålet med rollen kan variere afhængigt af kandidatens faglige baggrund, men ideelt set omfatte:

Research Design


Definere passende analysedesign
Strukturere data og opbygge en relevant storyline
Ansvarlig for at levere alle typer indsigtsleverancer til kunder
Konstant forbedring af vores data og proceskvalitet
Give input til design af statistiske analyser og opsætning af effektive processer
Hvis relevant: er ansvarlig for projektledelsesopgaver
Proaktiv og selvstændig problemløsning (finder løsninger på forretningsproblemer), ikke kun udførelse af opgaver!


Analyse og rapportering


Udarbejde dybdegående kundeundersøgelser til rapporteringsformål eller detaljerede kundeønsker
Analysere data og trends i data ved hjælp af forskellige værktøjer med henblik på at generere indsigt til kunden
Udvikle præsentationsdiagrammer og klientrapporter med tilsvarende indsigt, som besvarer kundens spørgsmål; udnyttelse af faktabaseret rådgivning
Fremme automatiseringsprocesser og udvikle effektive måder til at skabe kundeleverancer såsom excel-tabeller, PPT-dias og interne programmer, du vil lære at bruge


Kundestyring


Til en vis grad have klientinteraktion og fungere som ekspert i den analyse, vi laver for dem
At stå for levering af månedlige/kvartalsvise/årlige rapporter til kunder


Krav


At læse og forstå enten dansk eller svensk
Engelsk sprogkundskaber - B2 min.
En fordel med kompetencer i Excel og PPT
Motivationen til at tage en stor mængde data, strukturere den og lave et univers til mange forskellige kunder
Klar på at lære vores interne dataanalyseprogrammer
Ideelt set i stand til at arbejde på vores kontor i København. Ellers arbejde fra vores Stockholm-kontor som et alternativ


Vi er en etisk og ærlig virksomhed, der er engageret i sine kunder og medarbejdere. Vi er stolte af at være en inkluderende arbejdsplads for alle og er forpligtet til lige muligheder i beskæftigelsen, som fokuserer på, at alle vores medarbejdere når deres fulde potentiale. Hos CPS arbejder vi sammen med vores kolleger, men tilbyder en fleksibel arbejdstilgang, herunder at dele vores tid mellem kontor & fjernarbejde samt mulighed for at flekse vores arbejdstid omkring teamets kernetimer.

Vi tilbyder et spændende arbejdsmiljø, der bringer mennesker sammen. Vi tilskynder til en iværksætterånd og innovativ ånd. Vi gør brug af de nyeste digitale teknologier. Vi søger en god kollega, som tager imod udfordringer og skaber løsninger.

We are an ethical and honest company that is wholly committed to its clients and employees. We are proud to be an inclusive workplace for all and are committed to equal employment opportunity, focusing on all of our employees reaching their full potential.

We respect and value every employee regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, personality, experience, culture, faith, socio-economic status, or physical or mental disabilities.

We endorse the core principles and rights set forth in the United Nations Declaration of Human Rights and the Social Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union, promoting the universal values of human dignity, freedom, equality, and solidarity.

Learn more about who we are and everything we do on: https://www.gfk-cps.com/about-gfk-cps
