Title: Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer (EGRISS)
Description:
Hardship Level (not applicable for home-based)

H (no hardship)

Family Type (not applicable for home-based)

Family

Staff Member / Affiliate Type

UNOPS IICA1

Target Start Date

2025-01-01

Deadline for Applications

October 29, 2024

Terms of Reference

Title: Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer (EGRISS)

ICA Level: IICA-1

Corresponding Level: P-2

Duty station: Copenhagen, Denmark

Duration: 01/01/2025 - 31/12/2025 (with possibility of extension)

General Background

UNHCR’s mandate to protect and find solutions for refugees and other forcibly displaced persons increasingly relies on the availability of timely and reliable data and analysis. The Agency's Global Data Service (GDS) based in Copenhagen, is the focal point in UNHCR for the implementation of its Data Transformation Strategy that has been put in place to facilitate this process over the next few years. Within this, the Statistics, Data Science and Survey Section (SDSS), coordinates the collection, analysis and dissemination of UNHCR's statistics, and provides technical statistical support to regional bureau and country offices. It aims to support the development of improved and more efficient systems for statistics on refugees and other persons of concern to UNHCR, such as stateless people and internally displaced persons (IDPs).

Increasingly, UNHCR’s data efforts are grounded in collaboration and joint engagements with partners to better achieve outcomes for those affected by forced displacement. In contexts of protracted displacement, working closely with governments and national statistical offices to enhance national ownership of data produced and better integrate refugees and IDPs into national statistical systems is a core priority. As part of this effort, UNHCR has taken a leading role in the Expert Group on Refugee, IDP and Statelessness Statistics (EGRISS), both as a Steering Committee member and through hosting its Secretariat. The EGRISS currently consists of 60 countries and 37 international/regional organisations. Other Steering Committee members include the World Bank, Eurostat, Statistics Norway, Joint IDP Profiling Service (JIPS) and United Nations Statistics Division (UNSD), Internal Displacement Monitoring Centre (IDMC), International Organization for Migration (IOM), World Bank-UNHCR Joint Data Center (JDC), United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Western Asia (UNESCWA), Philippines, Colombia, Kurdistan Republic of Iraq and African Union’s Institute of Statistics (STATAFRIC).

The EGRISS was established in 2016 by the UN Statistical Commission to develop recommendations on refugee and IDP statistics and produce guidance for their implementation at country level. The International Recommendations on Refugee (IRRS) and IDP (IRIS) Statistics were endorsed in 2018 and 2020, respectively, under EGRISS' first two mandates. The International Recommendations on Statelessness Statistics (IROSS) were subsequently developed and endorsed in 2023. During 2020-2024, the EGRISS' mandate was expanded to focus on implementation of the recommendations which is ongoing through advocacy, capacity building, and further methodological development and testing. This work will continue through the group’s upcoming mandate period of 2025-2030.

All of EGRISS’ work is developed or conducted collaboratively with affected states and statistical experts from within its membership. The Secretariat therefore plays a critical role in coordinating, facilitating and supporting these collaborative efforts through a range of channels. The Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer will be part of the EGRISS Secretariat and support key activities, as outlined below, in order to help the Group successfully fulfill its mandate from the UNSC.

Purpose and Scope of Assignment

The Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer (EGRISS) will support the work of the Expert Group on Refugee, IDP and Statelessness Statistics (EGRISS). They will report to the Senior Statistics and Data Analysis Officer (EGRISS) and will work in close collaboration with other EGRISS Secretariat colleagues as well as members of the EGRISS Steering Committee and its broader membership.

Duties and Responsibilities

The Associate Statistics and Data Analysis Officer (EGRISS) will support the implementation of EGRISS third mandate in the following ways:


Support to Secretariat-led activities
Act as focal point for EGRISS E-learning, a flagship resource for EGRISS, including its dissemination (in coordination with the Secretariat’s Communications Officer) and translation into French and Spanish.
Identify opportunities and support activities for IROSS roll-out, including integrating statelessness into the workstreams of Technical Subgroups and exploring linkages with the newly launched Global Alliance to End Statelessness.
Support work of Technical Subgroups
Support to EGRISS Technical Subgroups in close coordination with Technical Subgroup co-leads, identified activity leads and Secretariat staff. This will include coordination support (e.g. organisation of meetings, documentation of minutes, follow up on workplans), administrative support (e.g. development of TORs, procurement processes, organisation of workshops) and substantive support (e.g. research, writing/editing, delivery and follow up from regional workshops) as relevant. During 2025, priorities will likely include organisation and delivery of regional workshop/training in Africa.
Substantive support to specifically identified activities from TSG workplans based on EGRISS priorities for 2025, capacity, interest and opportunities for professional growth. This will primarily include the further development of the durable solutions-related measures outlined in the International Recommendations on IDP Statistics (IRIS) that will be under-taken by a newly (re-)established “IDP Subgroup” including affected states. Tasks will likely include coordination and administrative support tasks for the IDP Subgroup as well as substantive support to activities included in the workplan.
Management support for EGRISS
Budget management support, in close collaboration with Head of Secretariat, including creating and maintaining budget planning and management tools, liaising with relevant finance colleagues for expenditure report reviews, and other tasks as relevant.
Act as team-focal point/coordinator for common Microsoft Teams channels, ensuring guidance is provided to new/existing colleagues, and knowledge management is facilitated.
Other support for EGRISS
Contribute to monitoring & evaluation activities, with focus on areas of responsibility/expertise.
Active participation in Steering Committee meetings as required.
Active participation in and support for EGRISS All Members Meeting.
Input to relevant publications and other communications and reporting activities.
Ad hoc requests from Head of EGRISS Secretariat.


Monitoring and Progress Controls


Regional workshop in Africa successfully delivered (February 2025)
E-learning course translated into French and Spanish (June 2025)
Technical Subgroups effectively supported with coordination and administrative support (ongoing)
New IDP Subgroup established, workplan to complete IRIS durable solutions-related measures developed and progress effectively supported including the delivery of online/in-person meetings (Dec 2025)
EGRISS budget management support effectively provided (ongoing)


Qualifications And Experience


Education


     

University Degree in Statistics, Demography, Public Policy, Social Sciences, International Relations or any other related field.


Work Experience


     

Required:


3 years relevant experience with Undergraduate degree; or 2 years relevant experience with Graduate degree; or 1 year relevant experience with Doctorate degree.
Experience working with multi-stakeholder projects with significant coordination needs.
Experience with administrative work, organization of professional conferences or workshops, and/or budget management in a support capacity.
Experience working with National Statistical Offices, statistical production or quantitative data collection, analysis or dissemination processes.
Experience working on migration, displacement or statelessness policy or practice.
Experience writing or editing technical publications in English.


Desired:


Previous UN experience or experience of working with an international organization.
Ability to work in a second language (ideally French, Spanish or Arabic).
Key Competencies


    


Knowledge about forced displacement, statelessness or related topics.
Understanding of official statistics, including different data sources (surveys, administrative data and census).
Experience with developing written material (reports, notes from meetings and advocacy material).
Knowledge of MS Office suite.
Excellent organizational skills and ability to work within established deadlines.
Excellent oral and written communication skills and interpersonal abilities with fluency in English, (knowledge of another UN language is an asset).


Location and Conditions

The successful candidate will be based in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Shortlisted candidates might be required to sit for a written test. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. No late applications will be accepted.

Please note that UNHCR does not charge a fee at any stage of its recruitment process (application, interview, meeting, travelling, processing, training or any other fees).

All UNHCR workforce members must individually and collectively, contribute towards a working environment where each person feels safe, and empowered to perform their duties. This includes by demonstrating no tolerance for sexual exploitation and abuse, harassment including sexual harassment, sexism, gender inequality, discrimination, and abuse of power.

As individuals and as managers, all must be proactive in preventing and responding to inappropriate conduct, support ongoing dialogue on these matters and speaking up and seeking guidance and support from relevant UNHCR resources when these issues arise.

,

Additional Qualifications

Education

Bachelor of Science (BS): Demography (Required), Bachelor of Science (BS): International Relations (Required), Bachelor of Science (BS): Political Science (Required), Bachelor of Science (BS): Statistics (Required)

Certifications

Other Information

This position doesn't require a functional clearance

Title: Data Engineer (100 % remote) - (m/f/d)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
BiLLWERK+ is looking for a Data Engineer who wants to work in a high growth international environment with a world class team.

BiLLWERK+ is a fast-growing company and having proven our ability to attract and retain customers we are now at the exciting phase of scaling up all aspects of the company as we look to expand into new product lines and enter new markets.

What part you will play?

We are searching for a highly motivated and skilled Data Engineer to play a pivotal role in shaping our Data & Analytics strategy! In this role, you will collaborate with all parts of our data ecosystem and have the opportunity to lead key projects. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, particularly the product team, to drive innovation and foster data literacy across the company.

Your key tasks will include:


Upgrading our Data Lake by implementing a new Data Catalog.
Developing and optimizing real-time Data Streaming to support better decision-making.
Enhancing our Analytics Stack with new features and capabilities.
Supporting our Analytics Engineer with GenAI initiatives and innovations.



This is an exceptional opportunity to make a significant impact on our product and technology roadmap!

What do we require from you?


Data Platform & Pipeline Management
Collaborate with the data engineering team to upgrade our company-wide DataLake (AWS, Snowflake).
Get involved in all steps of the data lifecycle, including ingestion, processing, and serving.
Design and implement data models and pipelines on various technologies (Kafka, AWS Glue, dbt).
Take responsibility on all the dimension of the infrastructure, also including monitoring, testing and updating to new technologies.




Collaboration & Cross-Team Initiatives
DevOPS Integration & Best Practices
Work closely with the product team to refine our product offering and drive innovation.
Help drive data literacy across the company through close collaboration and communication with stakeholders.
Partner with the DevOps teams to bring your solutions into production (Terraform, DataOps, CI/CD).
Implement best development practices, including testing, live monitoring, continuous integration, code deployment, and end-to-end automation.
ML & Analytics Projects
Assist with the development and operationalization of machine learning projects, such as churn prediction and GenAI solutions.
Work with the Analytics Engineer to apply cutting-edge tools for customer analytics, predictive modeling, and journey analysis.



Preferred Skills & Experience:


Entrepreneurship mindset and experiences working in a dynamic environment.
Experience or aspirations in data architecture.
Basic knowledge of data governance.
Experience with data cataloguing and other data lake components.
Experience with end-to-end ML tools and a strong interest in generative AI and LLMs.



What We Offer You


Impact: The chance to make a lasting contribution to the pioneer and driver of the European Subscription Economy.
Flexibility: Choice of office locations or remote working. A modern corporate culture with a focus on work-life balance, flexible working hours, and a generous holiday policy.
Professional Growth: Opportunities for personal and professional development with room for manoeuvre to develop optimally.
Engagement: Your opinion matters – take responsibility, show initiative, and have your input valued.
Environment: A trust-based environment with short communication and decision-making paths, and a strong team spirit.
Compensation: A salary strongly correlated to your performance and commitment.



What We Value at BiLLWERK+


Curiosity: Seek out opportunities to learn and don’t be afraid to ask questions.
Ownership: Be the driver and take accountability.
Adaptability: Embrace change in the ever-evolving technology landscape.
Engagement: Share your passion for technology with colleagues and collaborators.
A degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience in data engineering or a related software development role.
Extensive understanding of the modern data stack and broad knowledge of the cloud ecosystem.
Experience with technologies such as Python, SQL, AWS, Snowflake, Java, and Terraform.
Knowledge of streaming technology is a plus (Kafka, Debezium, Kinesis).
Familiarity with cloud native computing.
Experience with CI/CD.
Knowledge of Agile/Scrum or Kanban lean principles.
Proficiency with version control and knowledge sharing tools (e.g., Git, Jira, Confluence, or equivalent systems).
Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively in a remote team environment.
Proficiency in English.



Ideal localisation :


Copenhagen
Frankfurt
UK / London
Gdansk

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented, curious, and data-driven problem solver who wants to build up and maintain a Data Platform for reporting and analytics in a fast-growing FinTech company? Then you might be the one we are looking for.




Banking Circle is a truly international and vibrant company with more than 550 skilled and dedicated employees worldwide, who are all passionate about creating next-generation mission-critical financial services infrastructure and leading the rise of a super-correspondent banking network.




About the role

We are looking to hire a highly skilled Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering team in Copenhagen, reporting to the Data Engineering Team Lead.




In this role you will get the chance to work on building and maintaining our next generation Data Platform in Azure. The Data Engineering team owns Banking Circle’s Data Platform, which is closely coupled to our payment processing system. Our tech stack includes Python, Terraform, Microsoft Azure cloud ecosystem, Azure DevOps, and Microsoft Power BI. Furthermore, we also use Databricks SQL warehouses and Astronomer/Airflow to orchestrate our processing pipelines.

What you will be doing

Build and maintain our Data Platform in collaboration with peers
Advocate for software architecture patterns, efficient data processing, modern data integration, and solid data modelling
Collaborate in the continual analysis of project requirements in collaboration with teams across the organization
Participate in Agile team rituals (stand-up, planning, and retrospective)
Contribute to continuous improvements of the team’s way of working
Take responsibility for own learning and development




What we are looking for

To be the right candidate for this position, we expect you to have an educational background within computer science, software engineering, or other related fields, with a bachelor's degree as a minimum. We expect you to have 3+ years of relevant work experience within pipelines, infrastructure, or the platform world, including strong Python skills. Furthermore, it is a big advantage if you have experience within Microsoft Azure cloud.




As a person we expect you to be open-minded, and willing to learn and further expand your existing experience in Data Engineering. You are curious, communicative, and able to work well on your own as well in a team.




As Banking Circle is an international company it´s a requirement, that you are fluent in English.




What we offer you

We offer a hybrid work model for our employees to allow for flexibility and productivity, however we do also expect you to spend time in the office on a regular basis to build community and efficiency in the team. Furthermore, we offer a competitive salary and a generous benefit package, opportunities for continuous learning, development, and a dynamic and collaborative culture that values personal initiative and professional achievements.




Would you like to join us?

We will be conducting interviews continuously; therefore, we urge interested candidates to apply online as soon as possible. Please note that we do not accept applications by email.




If you have questions do not hesitate to contact Kheira Nougal, Global Recruitment Partner on khno@bankingcircle.com. No agencies, please.




Who we are

Banking Circle is a fully licensed next generation Payments Bank that is designed to meet the global banking and payments needs of Payments businesses, Banks, and Marketplaces. Through our API, we deliver fast, low-cost global payments and banking services by connecting to the world’s clearing systems – enabling our clients to move liquidity in real-time for all major currencies securely and compliantly. To learn more about Banking Circle, visit us at www.bankingcircle.com




We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, age, religion, sexual orientation, national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local laws, regulations and ordinances.

If you have questions do not hesitate to contact Kheira Nougal, Global Recruitment Partner on khno@bankingcircle.com. No agencies, please.


Who we are

Banking Circle is a fully licensed next generation Payments Bank that is designed to meet the global banking and payments needs of Payments businesses, Banks, and Marketplaces. Through our API, we deliver fast, low-cost global payments and banking services by connecting to the world’s clearing systems – enabling our clients to move liquidity in real-time for all major currencies securely and compliantly. To learn more about Banking Circle, visit us at www.bankingcircle.com


We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, age, religion, sexual orientation, national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local laws, regulations and ordinances.

Title: Senior Master Data Business Analyst
Place: København SV, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about Master Data and data management? Do you have an interest in good data quality and sustainable data solutions? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you in the Master Data Team.

Falck has embarked on an ambitious journey towards becoming a digital and data driven organization. Master Data is acknowledged as a critical component by the executive level, which is why, we are part of the most significant programs in Falck.

To fuel our ongoing digital transformation, we are seeking a highly motivated and result-oriented Senior Master Data Business Analyst to join our team. Your role will be crucial in covering business needs and ensuring successful analysis and documentation, while driving the adoption of MDM practices, and improving processes to deliver high-quality data. We are looking for someone who is passionate about delivering value through data and is eager to contribute to our organization's growth and success.

You will be part of a team consisting of 10 colleagues.


About The Job


In your new position as a In your new position as a Senior Master Data Business Analyst, you will be working with:



Requirements Management: Understand business goals, derive master data ambitions, unveil hidden data needs, and translate them into data requirements. Participate in delivery of requirements and act as quality assurance.
Data Analysis: Lead cross-functional business and data analysis, coordinating within the team and with other teams. Uncovering pains and identifying opportunities.
Governance: Implement global Master Data Governance and data standards across business units and markets.
Business Engagement & Stakeholder Management: Ensure close alignment with business stakeholders, Subject Matter Experts and Master Data Owner/Stewards.
Support Stewardship Community: Actively engage with Master Data Stewards, facilitate meetings and Domain Master Data forums.
Quality Monitoring: Create and utilize quality dashboards to facilitate conversations around the quality and to collaborate with stakeholders to ensure uplift.


We love diversity and we encourage people with all kinds of backgrounds to apply for the job, but

unfortunately, we do not have the possibility to reallocate candidates. Given the nature of the job,

the position requires on-site presence in Copenhagen.


About You


We are looking for a senior profile with a high drive and curiosity to enable better Master Data Management and Master Data Quality.


You enjoy engaging with stakeholders and translate business needs into relevant master data deliverables.
You are comfortable working with requirements related to processes & organization, systems & integrations and especially data quality.
You are good at planning and coordinating deliverables. Some you will manage and develop yourself; others will be co-created together with colleagues in the team.
You are used to incorporating many perspectives in your work, you consider the end-to-end impact and the full data flow. It comes natural to you, to ask ‘why’.
You have a strong focus on impact and business value. If you have experience connecting data use cases with measurable business impact, it will be an advantage.
You have proficiency within Data Management and Data Governance. If you have experience within Master Data Management, it will also be an advantage.
You know your way around Power BI and know how to use it as input for dialogue on data quality.
You have worked with modern data management tools or MDM platforms.
You strive to work smarter by embracing digital opportunities whether it is using our own Falck GPT to support your work, automating data cleansing with robots, or improving data entries by applying data quality assurance practices.
You have great experience in working between business and IT. Maybe you have worked as a Data Analyst, Senior Business Analyst, or Data Governance Specialist.
The ideal candidate has domain knowledge across the entire value chain; commercial, operations,



Financial, HR And Other Group Functions.



About us


The Data function is where data is turned into information in Falck. We are four different teams working with: Data & Analytics, Master Data, Strategic Automation and Power Platform & AI Services. In the entire function we are 90+ data specialists working in Copenhagen and Warsaw.  

The Master Data Team is an international team with good energy and high spirits. We respect each other’s differences and spend many lunches discussing shared interests. We are an animal-loving team that can always be won over with good snacks and cake.

The team has existed for almost 3 years and has grown every year. We work in an agile way, using Azure DevOps, and we have a Master Data-specialized Scrum Master. We are a strategic team that aims to enable the business and group functions through governance, data quality, standardization, and principles. Over the past year we have adopted a more fact-based approach, by using Master Data Quality measurements as input for dialogues.

In Falck, you get highly flexible working conditions. We believe in a strong work-life balance and will aid you in becoming the best version of yourself. We value candidates with a willingness to learn and want you to grow with us by continually exploring new skills and new domains.

If you are a self-starter who is passionate about data, data governance and data quality and want to deliver long-term change, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

We look forward to meeting you.

We look forward to meeting you.

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Senior Quantitative Analyst

In MFT Energy we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Senior Quantitative Analyst to join our ambitious Intraday team with experienced colleagues, who strive to be the best every day.




The job of a Senior Quantitative Analyst

As our new Senior Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of a professional and dedicated algorithmic trading team. Our team contributes to developing autonomous trading strategies in the European intraday power market using cutting-edge technologies and trading methodologies.

The team consists of a highly diverse set of individuals, all with a common passion for data-driven trading, and with a goal to create the most sophisticated setup in the industry.

Your work areas will be within programming new trading strategies as well as supporting the improvement of our current trading setup. You will be reporting to our Head of Algorithmic Trading, Daniel Vibe.




Your key responsibilities

Research new market opportunities
Develop new trading strategies using machine learning and market knowledge
Contribute to existing trade signal and execution frameworks
Benchmark and evaluate external forecast providers
Optimize our active trade execution algorithms
Acquire and maintain data from external sources




Your qualifications and personal skills

Have experience from a trading desk - preferably within European Intraday Power
Industry experience with machine learning and/or statistical modeling
Skilled in Python and can write production-grade code
Excellent communication skills and a proactive approach
Strong analytical skills and an eye for detail
Have a curious mind and the courage to take on a steep learning curve
The ability to work independently and structure your workload
A positive and competitive attitude, but at the same time a valued team player
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English




Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We have 163 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, USA, and Singapore as well as several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best – we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.




We offer:

A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach
The chance to one day have ownership within the company
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.




Make the most of your talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with your CV and likely also your diplomas. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.




Start date: As soon as possible.




We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

Title: Data Management Engineer
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a highly organized, detail-oriented, and communicative data management scientist to be responsible for managing the successful completion of tasks within Quality Control.

In this role you will support QC with Data tasks including visualizations, setup of data flows to track operational activities and identification of improvements in data handling across the department. This position requires a high degree of business acumen as well as process insight to drive, facilitate, and manage stakeholders across the entire QC business with authority and charisma.

In this position you will build up strong insights to our business, and a strong network both internally and with various stakeholders. You will serve as our go-to person in our Data & Visual Workflow hub within QC Projects and hold a key role in overseeing the task portfolio within the team.

Your task and responsibilities among others will be: 


Oversight of portfolio and task distribution within the Data & Visual Workflow hub.
Create and maintain dashboards in Tableau for Quality Control.
Optimize data flow from quality systems to create advanced views, e.g. through use of Power Apps/Power Automate.
Develop and manage models to identify trends and to measure KPIs.
Utilize tools as Alteryx and Tableau for data processing and visualization.



You will work closely together with internal stakeholders within FUJIFILM to ensure high quality and timely completion. You are expected to be service minded and creative in identifying solutions and mitigations for the business, however, you are also expected to be realistic and patient in explaining and guiding your stakeholders in what can be achieved.

The Data & Visual Workflow hub is part of QC Projects which is part of the QC organization. In QC we work in a busy and dynamic environment where we support biologics Drug Substance (DS) and Drug Product (DP) production as well as the global release of commercial products (DS/DP) for our global network of clients.

About Your Qualifications And Competences


Bachelor’s (BA) or Master’s Degree (MSc) in IT, Engineering, or any other relevant field.
Relevant QA IT or QC experience from the pharmaceutical industry.
Knowledge of GMP Quality Systems
As a person, you are organized with an attention to detail and still able to keep an overview.
You are service minded with excellent verbal and oral communication skills.
You have an ability to work independently and are self-driven.
You are a team player.
You thrive in a changing environment.
You enjoy multitasking.



Application

For questions, please do not hesitate to contact hiring manager Stephan Spence on +4541949796.

Working at FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies

We offer a competitive compensation package in a site/company growing rapidly, with many opportunities for individual growth, we also offer access to fitness and an attractive canteen.

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies is an industry-leading Biologics Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in Hillerød, Denmark, Teesside, UK, RTP, North Carolina and College Station, Texas, USA. We use our skills, dedication and ambition to enable impact for the world’s most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcare’s potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customers’ products – enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologic, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion. We fuel one another’s passion, help accelerate progress, expand capabilities, strengthen innovation, and improve processes to improve lives.

Our Manufacturing site in Hillerød, Denmark, brings together a complete range of expertise, capabilities and technologies to manufacture advanced biologics. As we continue to enhance and expand our capabilities, we are looking for people who share our passion, drive, and energy – what we call Genki – to join our team.

 

We offer the chance to be part of a global workplace where passion, drive and commitment are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. Deeply committed to diversity and inclusion, we ensure that everyone no matter their background or gender has an opportunity to develop. We take pride in enriching our communities, caring for our environment, and cultivating a world of opportunity for future generations.

We aim to foster a collaborative, innovative and rewarding environment, where diverse perspectives and people come together united by a common purpose and shared values. We pursue our fullest potential as individual contributors and team members. We strive to be the employer of choice and offer a competitive compensation and benefit package.

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identify or any other protected class.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Uno-X Mobility Danmark
Description:
Vi søger en Business Intelligence Analyst til Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S




Hos Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S søger vi en ny Business Intelligence Analyst til vores BI-team, som vil være med til at styrke det nuværende BI-landskab og drive vores digitale udvikling fremad. Som Business Intelligence Analyst får du mulighed for at analysere data og levere indsigt, der understøtter strategiske beslutninger på tværs af organisationen.




Er du skarp til at indsamle, analysere og præsentere data på en måde, der skaber værdi og hjælper med at træffe bedre forretningsbeslutninger? Så er denne stilling måske noget for dig!




Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S er midt i en spændende udvikling, hvor vi ikke kun leverer moderne og relevante produkter til vores kunder, men også investerer massivt i digitalisering og data. Efter sammenlægningen af Uno-X og det tidligere YX i 2023 står vores IT-systemer over for en gennemgribende integrering med målet om "én virksomhed." Derudover er der stort fokus på at udvikle innovative dataløsninger, som skaber værdi både eksternt og internt.




Dine hovedopgaver:

Som Business Intelligence Analyst bliver du en del af et team, der er ansvarligt for at skabe data-drevne løsninger på tværs af organisationen. Du vil arbejde tæt sammen med forskellige afdelinger for at identificere deres behov og levere værdifulde rapporter og analyser.




Som Business Intelligence Analyst vil dine ansvarsområder omfatte:

Indsamling og analyse af data for at skabe indsigtsfulde rapporter og dashboards i Power BI.
Udvikling og vedligeholdelse af BI-løsninger, der understøtter virksomhedens strategi og operationelle beslutninger.
Transformere komplekse datasæt til letforståelige visualiseringer og anbefalinger.
Samarbejde med resten af BI teamet for at sikre datakvalitet og opretholde relevante datakilder.
Være proaktiv i at identificere muligheder for forbedring gennem dataanalyse.
Samarbejde tæt med alle forretningsområder for at forstå deres specifikke behov og sikre, at rapporter og analyser er tilpasset forretningsmålene og giver værdifuld indsigt til beslutningstagning.
Identificere og implementere muligheder for automatisering af rapporteringsprocesser og løbende forbedringer af BI-systemer.




Hvad forventer vi af dig?

Vi forestiller os, at du har erfaring fra en lignende stilling, hvor du har arbejdet med dataanalyse og udvikling af rapporteringsløsninger. Du er analytisk, struktureret og god til at kommunikere dine indsigter til både tekniske og ikke-tekniske interessenter.




Opsummerende, for at have succes, skal du:

Have erfaring med Power BI til rapportering og datavisualisering.
Kunne omsætte komplekse data til klare, handlingsorienterede anbefalinger.
Være en stærk formidler, som kan præsentere resultater klart og forståeligt.
Være teamplayer og trives med at samarbejde på tværs af organisationen.




Det er en fordel, hvis du har erfaring med resten af Power Platformen.




Hvad kan vi tilbyde?

Vi tilbyder en stærk kultur med gode værdier og fokus på at "bygge store mennesker." Vores arbejdsdag er præget af høj grad af tillid og ansvarstagen samt et langsigtet fokus, hvor der bygges sten på sten. Det har resulteret i et godt arbejdsmiljø med gode forhold og generelt en lang anciennitet i virksomheden.




Derudover har vi:

Et dynamisk og innovativt arbejdsmiljø med spændende opgaver.
Muligheden for at arbejde tæt sammen med forskellige afdelinger og interessenter.
En virksomhedskultur, der værdsætter fleksibilitet og effektivitet.
Konkurrencedygtig løn og gode ansættelsesvilkår.
Mulighed for personlig og faglig udvikling gennem projekter og udfordringer.




Om Uno-X

Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S er en del af norske REITAN Retail A/S. Vores mission er at udvikle og fremme løsninger for fremtidens mobilitet. Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S fokuserer på at drive og vedligeholde et effektivt netværk for flydende brændstof, samtidig med at vi, i samarbejde med vores søsterselskab, udvikler tilbud til elbilister, uanset hvor kunderne har behov for opladning.




Uno-X Mobility Danmark henvender sig til alle segmenter inden for mobilitet: Privat, erhverv, personbiler, varebiler og lastbiler. Herudover tilbyder vi leverancer inden for opvarmning, landbrug, entreprenør og marine.




Uno-X Mobility Danmark har hovedkontor i Søborg, en større omsætning i milliardklassen samt en solid indtjening på bundlinjen. Organisationen følger en lean-tankegang, hvor overflødige ledelseslag ikke eksisterer. Med andre ord, der er en flad organisationsstruktur og kort vej fra idé til handling. Det strategiske omdrejningspunkt for virksomheden er at skabe den bedste kundeoplevelse. Læs mere på www.unoxmobility.dk




Ansøg nu

Lyder jobbet som noget for dig? Så send din ansøgning samt CV via linket. Samtaler afholdes løbende. Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte rekrutteringsansvarlig, Johan Hygum Hillers på johan@individuals.dk.




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig og til at byde en ny, engageret kollega velkommen til Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S!

Show more
HTML:
Vi søger en Business Intelligence Analyst til Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S


Hos Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S søger vi en ny Business Intelligence Analyst til vores BI-team, som vil være med til at styrke det nuværende BI-landskab og drive vores digitale udvikling fremad. Som Business Intelligence Analyst får du mulighed for at analysere data og levere indsigt, der understøtter strategiske beslutninger på tværs af organisationen.


Er du skarp til at indsamle, analysere og præsentere data på en måde, der skaber værdi og hjælper med at træffe bedre forretningsbeslutninger? Så er denne stilling måske noget for dig!


Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S er midt i en spændende udvikling, hvor vi ikke kun leverer moderne og relevante produkter til vores kunder, men også investerer massivt i digitalisering og data. Efter sammenlægningen af Uno-X og det tidligere YX i 2023 står vores IT-systemer over for en gennemgribende integrering med målet om "én virksomhed." Derudover er der stort fokus på at udvikle innovative dataløsninger, som skaber værdi både eksternt og internt.


Dine hovedopgaver:

Som Business Intelligence Analyst bliver du en del af et team, der er ansvarligt for at skabe data-drevne løsninger på tværs af organisationen. Du vil arbejde tæt sammen med forskellige afdelinger for at identificere deres behov og levere værdifulde rapporter og analyser.


Som Business Intelligence Analyst vil dine ansvarsområder omfatte:

  • Indsamling og analyse af data for at skabe indsigtsfulde rapporter og dashboards i Power BI.
  • Udvikling og vedligeholdelse af BI-løsninger, der understøtter virksomhedens strategi og operationelle beslutninger.
  • Transformere komplekse datasæt til letforståelige visualiseringer og anbefalinger.
  • Samarbejde med resten af BI teamet for at sikre datakvalitet og opretholde relevante datakilder.
  • Være proaktiv i at identificere muligheder for forbedring gennem dataanalyse.
  • Samarbejde tæt med alle forretningsområder for at forstå deres specifikke behov og sikre, at rapporter og analyser er tilpasset forretningsmålene og giver værdifuld indsigt til beslutningstagning.
  • Identificere og implementere muligheder for automatisering af rapporteringsprocesser og løbende forbedringer af BI-systemer.


Hvad forventer vi af dig?

Vi forestiller os, at du har erfaring fra en lignende stilling, hvor du har arbejdet med dataanalyse og udvikling af rapporteringsløsninger. Du er analytisk, struktureret og god til at kommunikere dine indsigter til både tekniske og ikke-tekniske interessenter.


Opsummerende, for at have succes, skal du:

  • Have erfaring med Power BI til rapportering og datavisualisering.
  • Kunne omsætte komplekse data til klare, handlingsorienterede anbefalinger.
  • Være en stærk formidler, som kan præsentere resultater klart og forståeligt.
  • Være teamplayer og trives med at samarbejde på tværs af organisationen.


Det er en fordel, hvis du har erfaring med resten af Power Platformen.


Hvad kan vi tilbyde?

Vi tilbyder en stærk kultur med gode værdier og fokus på at "bygge store mennesker." Vores arbejdsdag er præget af høj grad af tillid og ansvarstagen samt et langsigtet fokus, hvor der bygges sten på sten. Det har resulteret i et godt arbejdsmiljø med gode forhold og generelt en lang anciennitet i virksomheden.


Derudover har vi:

  • Et dynamisk og innovativt arbejdsmiljø med spændende opgaver.
  • Muligheden for at arbejde tæt sammen med forskellige afdelinger og interessenter.
  • En virksomhedskultur, der værdsætter fleksibilitet og effektivitet.
  • Konkurrencedygtig løn og gode ansættelsesvilkår.
  • Mulighed for personlig og faglig udvikling gennem projekter og udfordringer.


Om Uno-X

Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S er en del af norske REITAN Retail A/S. Vores mission er at udvikle og fremme løsninger for fremtidens mobilitet. Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S fokuserer på at drive og vedligeholde et effektivt netværk for flydende brændstof, samtidig med at vi, i samarbejde med vores søsterselskab, udvikler tilbud til elbilister, uanset hvor kunderne har behov for opladning.


Uno-X Mobility Danmark henvender sig til alle segmenter inden for mobilitet: Privat, erhverv, personbiler, varebiler og lastbiler. Herudover tilbyder vi leverancer inden for opvarmning, landbrug, entreprenør og marine.


Uno-X Mobility Danmark har hovedkontor i Søborg, en større omsætning i milliardklassen samt en solid indtjening på bundlinjen. Organisationen følger en lean-tankegang, hvor overflødige ledelseslag ikke eksisterer. Med andre ord, der er en flad organisationsstruktur og kort vej fra idé til handling. Det strategiske omdrejningspunkt for virksomheden er at skabe den bedste kundeoplevelse. Læs mere på www.unoxmobility.dk


Ansøg nu

Lyder jobbet som noget for dig? Så send din ansøgning samt CV via linket. Samtaler afholdes løbende. Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte rekrutteringsansvarlig, Johan Hygum Hillers på johan@individuals.dk.


Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig og til at byde en ny, engageret kollega velkommen til Uno-X Mobility Danmark A/S!

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
For DI - Dansk Industri søger vi en Lead Data Engineer




Om stillingen




DI har en ambitiøs digital strategi, der skal bringe dem tættere på medlemmerne, understøtte vækst og sikre effektiv kommunikation og samarbejde på tværs. Som en del af dette og for at styrke Data & Automations Teamet søger DI en Lead Data Engineer.




Som Lead Data Engineer vil du være med til at opbygge en moderne dataplatform i DI. Du får mulighed for at være med i alle faser – fra analyse, design og udvikling til test, implementering og den måske vigtigste fase, forankringen i hverdagen. Du sætter den faglige retning ift. data engineering/dimensionel modellering, og viser at teori kan omsættes til praksis. Du kan skabe overblik på tværs, og ”tænker stort, men starter småt” med øje for, at få data ud at leve i forretningen ved at levere værdiskabende data og indsigter.




Afdelingen har ansvaret for dataprocessering og dataløsninger og er godt i gang med at opbygge en dataplatform på Microsoft Azure stacken – startende med et datavarehus og en række analytiske løsninger. Afdelingen har til ansvar at få teknologierne til at tale sammen ved at automatisere og strømline datapipelines.




Du får en nøglerolle, hvor du er med til at sætte retningen i afdelingen, som er Center of Excellence i forhold til dataplatformen. Du samarbejder tæt med forretningen om at levere værdiskabende data og indsigter gennem bl.a. selvbetjeningsløsninger. I den forbindelse vil du til dagligt være i tæt dialog med forretningen, hvor du også vil agere sparringspartner og indgå i dialog ift. opsætning af integration af data fra forskellige kildesystemer.




Derudover vil dit ansvarsområder bl.a være at:

Være drivende i at opbygge en moderne og mangfoldig dataplatform i DI.
Sætte den faglige retning ift. data engineering/dimensionel modellering, og viser at teori kan omsættes til praksis.
Skabe overblik på tværs, og ”tænker stort, men starter småt” med øje for, at få data ud at leve i forretningen ved at levere værdiskabende data og indsigter.
Du får en nøglerolle, hvor du er med til at sætte retningen i forhold til dataplatformen







Af arbejdsopgaver kan bl.a. nævnes:

Udarbejde tekniske løsningsforslag, såvel som at estimere opgaver og effektivt kommunikere det til forretningen
Designe, udvikle og implementere dataløsninger, primært til data warehouset
Designe, udvikle og vedligeholde dataplatformen og data pipelines
Bidrage til at udvikle en langsigtet strategi for dataplatformen
Integrere data fra en række kilder, og opbygning af datamodeller
Bidrage til tekniske og forretningsmæssige afklaringer af løsninger
Deltage i udviklings- og projektopgaver i forbindelse med optimering af processer og systemer på tværs af DI.




Om dig

Den ideelle kandidat brænder for data og udvikling og tør udfordre status quo og flirte med cloud teknologi og data arkitektur. Du har fire til otte års erfaring fra en lignende stilling, evt. fra et konsulenthus eller en brancheorganisation, hvor du har haft hands-on erfaring med opbygning af data løsninger. Du har en relevant akademisk baggrund formentlig fra CBS, KU eller ITU med særlig fokus på data. Du er serviceorienteret, hjælpsom og kan være bindeled mellem forretningen og it-specialister. Vi ser gerne at du er fagligt nysgerrig i forhold til nye tendenser og udviklingen inden for datavidenskab, herunder data services i Azure. Derudover arbejder du struktureret og selvstændigt med et analytisk mindset og en metodisk tilgang.




Vi ser gerne at du besidder følgende kvalifikationer:

Ekspert i ETL processen, SQL programmering og datamart modellering iflg. Kimball
Solid erfaring med agil udvikling, gerne med afsæt i Git platformen
Gode kommunikationsevner på både dansk og engelsk




Det er en fordel, men ikke et krav, hvis du også har erfaring med:

T-SQL og SQL Server automation rammeværk generelt set
Analytiske applikationer, gerne Microsoft Power BI
Microsoft Azure dataplatform (Infrastruktur)
Azure data factory




Derudover er du en person, der tager ansvar for at kvaliteten, af det der leveres, er høj. Du er god til at sætte dig ind i komplekse og fagligt tunge opgaver. Du er resultatorienteret og har stor handlekraft. Det er også vigtigt, at du er vedholdende, også når det kommer til at udvikle dig selv fagligt og personligt, da teamet har stort fokus på det gode kollegaskab, samt at være gode samarbejdspartnere for hele huset. Det er altså vigtigt, at du er i stand til at danne dig en helhedsforståelse af hele DI. Endelig er du en person som har både hjerte og hjerne med på job og er enig med teamet i, at et godt socialt arbejdsmiljø er en nødvendig del af det at gå på arbejde.




Interesseret?

Så klik på linket herunder med det samme. Tiltrædelse er hurtigst muligt, og vi behandler kandidater løbende. Rekrutteringen faciliteres af vores rekrutteringspartner Kold+Partners. Har du spørgsmål eller brug for mere viden, er du velkommen til at kontakte Peter Kold (2989 0903).

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Drive meaningful change

Are you ready to shape the future of data-driven decision-making? At Abacus Medicine, we’re looking for a passionate Data Engineer with 0 to 3 years of experience, eager to make an impact. Join us in creating cutting-edge data solutions that power business insights and innovation. If you're excited about Data Engineering, working with the latest technologies, and thrive on learning, this is the place for you.




Get a glimpse of our world

Abacus Medicine is searching for a driven Data Engineer to join the Data Engineering team, where you will play a pivotal role in building scalable and robust data solutions. The team is responsible for our cloud data platform and the systems and processes that take in raw data and produce high-quality data that supports downstream use cases such as BI solutions, insight generating analytics, and AI/ML solutions. We leverage a modern data tech-stack to develop robust data solutions and drive the corporate focus to enable data-driven decision-making. The position offers an opportunity to develop your data management skills in and shape the design of a modern cloud data solution.




Are you ready to embark on this journey with us?

As a Data Engineer, you will take on responsibilities such as:

Design, develop, maintain and optimize data pipelines that perform data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes from various sources, ensuring data quality and efficiency.
Work on projects in the field of data engineering that directly impact our data-driven initiatives. Relating to data integration solutions, data quality, storage optimization, upgrading our architecture, and more.
Stay up to date with emerging data engineering trends and technologies to further develop our modern data cloud platform.
Leveraging our scalable monitoring tool and cutting-edge data observability platform to monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines, identifying and resolving issues proactively and build solutions with the aim of reducing time to detection and time to resolution.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and other data professionals and stakeholders throughout the business to gather requirements and design robust data solutions, merging the expertise from different domains to find the best solution for each data challenge.
Optimize big data storage and data retrieval processes.




The Tech-Stack that you will be working with:

Azure Databricks
Azure Data Factory
Azure Data/Delta Lake
Python
PySpark
SQL
Azure DevOps
Monte Carlo, Data Observability Platform
Git
And more!




Fuel for your success in the role

To succeed in the job, it is important that you are passionate, possess technical skills, and have a genuine interest in working with new cloud technologies. Your motivation to deliver high-quality data services, which serve as a foundation for impactful decision-making and advanced analytics across the organization, will be crucial to your success. You thrive in a dynamic and ambitious team environment and approach problem-solving with a creative mindset.

In Data & Analytics, we promote continuous learning and development and help our data engineers to expand their expertise and knowledge in various domains. These are some key qualifications for this role:

Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field.
0-3 years of experience in Data Engineering or a related field.
Proficiency in Python programming.
Familiarity in working with source control such as git.
Basic knowledge of SQL.
Experience in data manipulation, data wrangling, and data cleansing techniques to ensure data quality and integrity.
Strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.
Proactive mindset with a continuous learning approach to keep up with evolving technologies in the data engineering field.
Good oral and written communication skills in English.




It is an advantage (but not a requirement) if you have knowledge or experience with:

Cloud platforms, such as Azure, AWS or GCP.
Azure Data/Delta Lake for efficient storage and processing of big data.
Apache Spark and Databricks for data processing and analytics.
Experience with PySpark.
Experience with Azure Data Factory, or familiarity with other similar data integration and orchestration tools.
Data governance and data modelling best practices
Understanding of CI/CD practices.




Your future colleagues

In the D&A department, we are responsible for developing and maintaining Abacus' datahub, as well as implementing our BI platform, facilitating data-driven projects, and developing advanced analytics models (ML). The department comprises 6 Data Scientists, 5 BI developers, 3 Data Analysts, and 5 Data Engineers.

Our team consists of individuals from diverse nationalities, expertise areas, educational backgrounds, and ownership responsibilities across our data platforms and services. This diversity creates a strong environment for collaboration, technical synergies, and support among units, all while maintaining a positive and motivating work environment.

In summary, our goal is to create innovative data-driven solutions for core business problems within a friendly and professional work setting.




Would you like to know more about us?

If you want to apply for the position, please follow the link and attach your CV and cover letter.

Please note that we will begin reviewing applications after the deadline on November 4th. You can expect to hear from us shortly after this date.




Interested?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.




Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, you’ll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You’ll be part of a caring community of more than 1,300 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.

If you want to apply for the position, please follow the link and attach your CV and cover letter.

Please note that we will begin reviewing applications after the deadline on November 4th. You can expect to hear from us shortly after this date.


Interested?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.


Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, you’ll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You’ll be part of a caring community of more than 1,300 people across the World. Title: Senior data engineer
Description:
It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.

Siemens Gamesa is part of Siemens Energy, a global leader in energy technology with a rich legacy of innovation spanning over 150 years. Together, we are committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. As a leading player in the wind industry and manufacturer of wind turbines, we are passionate about driving the energy transition and providing innovative solutions that meet the growing energy demand of the global community. At Siemens Gamesa, we are constantly seeking talented individuals to join our team and support our focus on energy transformation.

Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Gamesa: Working with us.

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Data Engineer to join our team at Siemens Gamesa. In this role, you will play a key part in elevating our data solutions from on-premises to version 2.0 in Microsoft Azure. If you have solid experience with the Microsoft Data Platform and are ready to take the next step in your career, we want to hear from you!

How To Contribute To Our Vision

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be responsible for leading the transition of our current on-premises solutions to the Azure cloud. You will work closely with a team of experts to implement and optimize one of the multiple parallel processing (MPP) solutions in Azure, such as Azure Synapse, Databricks, or similar.

Key Responsibilities Will Be


Lead the migration of our infrastructure from on-premises to Azure cloud, ensuring minimal downtime and seamless integration with existing business processes.
Develop and maintain Data-Driven Project Modeling (DPM) for all company projects, supporting strategic decision-making, risk assessments, business cases, and financial reporting.
Process and analyze data across the company to model resource risk and provide actionable insights.
Collaborate with a multinational team to translate business logic into application development.
Manage data warehousing, including the design, implementation, and optimization of data storage solutions.
Provide support and documentation to end users for the developed applications.
Oversee master data management to ensure data integrity and consistency across the organization


What You Need To Make a Difference

Besides a passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change, we are also looking for:


Extensive experience as a Data Engineer with strong programming skills in the Microsoft ecosystem (T-SQL, C#, Python, databases, OLAP cubes) for handling large datasets.
Proven experience with Azure Platform.
Several years of experience in a similar role.
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Ability to balance attention to detail with a holistic view of the project.
High level of personal integrity, self-motivation, and independence.
Customer service orientation with a focus on delivering high-quality results under pressure.


If you are passionate about data engineering and excited about the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies in a dynamic environment, apply now to join our team at Siemens Gamesa.

It is a big advantage if you thrive in a multi-cultural environment and are familiar with working in large organizations. It is therefore important that you have excellent English language skills, both written and spoken.

In case you have acquired your skills in alternative ways your application is just as well appreciated.

In return of your commitment we offer you

Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed/variable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more.

Empowering our people

https://www.siemensgamesa.com/sustainability/employees

How do you imagine the future?

How do you imagine the future?

Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.

Other Information

If you have specific questions about the position, please contact the hiring manager Jesper Hildebrandt Knudsen via mail jesper.knudsen@siemensgamesa.com

For further information regarding the recruitment process, please send an email to the recruiter via email martina.valova.ext@siemensgamesa.com

Please mention the Job ID in the email.

Please apply in English via the apply button.

We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation.

For more information about working in Denmark, please see this link: https://www.siemensgamesa.com/explore/journal/wind-engineers-in-denmark

Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, promotion and benefits.



We are driven by people - from more than 100 different countries, they build the company we are every day. Our diverse and inclusive culture encourages us to think outside the box, speak without fear, and be bold. We value the flexibility that our smart-working arrangements, our digital disconnection framework and our family-friendly practices bring to the new way of working.
Show more

Title: Solutions Engineer (Data and AI) - Copenhagen
Description:
Req ID FEQ225R23

The role is based in Copenhagen, Denmark.

At Databricks, our core values are at the heart of everything we do; creating a culture of proactiveness and a customer-centric mindset guides us to create a unified platform that makes data science and analytics accessible to everyone. We aim to inspire our customers to make informed decisions that push their business forward. We provide a user-friendly and intuitive platform that makes it easy to turn insights into action and fosters a culture of creativity, experimentation, and continuous improvement. You will be an essential part of this mission, using your technical expertise to demonstrate how our Databricks Data Intelligence Platform can help customers solve their complex data challenges. You'll work with a collaborative, customer-focused team that values innovation and creativity, using your skills to create customized solutions to help our customers achieve their goals and guide their businesses forward. Join us in our quest to change how people work with data and make a better world!

Reporting to Senior Manager, Field Engineering.

The Impact You Will Have


Form successful relationships with clients throughout your assigned territory, working with an account executive to provide technical and business value.
Gain excitement from clients about Databricks through hands-on evaluation and Spark programming, integrating with the wider cloud ecosystem and 3rd party applications.
Contribute to building the Databricks technical through engagement at workshops, seminars, and meet-ups.
Become a Big Data Analytics advisor on aspects of architecture and design.
Support your customers by authoring reference architectures, how-tos, and demo applications.
Develop both technically and in the pre-sales aspect with the goal of becoming an independently operating Solutions Engineer.


What We Look For


Experience, technical customer-facing and with a background in Data Science/GenAI/ML or Data Engineering and/or Data Warehousing.
Fluent in written and spoken languages, in Danish and English
Any experience of Pre-sales or post-sales experience working with external clients
Familiarity working with clients, creating a narrative, answering customer questions, aligning the agenda with important interests, and achieving tangible outcomes.
To develop a trusted advisor skillset, the candidate must be able to independently deliver a technical proposition, identify the customer's pain points, and explain important areas for business value.
Code in a core programming language such as Python, Java, or Scala.
Knowledgeable in a core Big Data Analytics domain with some exposure to advanced proofs-of-concept and an understanding of a major public cloud platform (AWS, GCP, Azure).
Experience diving deeper into solution architecture and design.
The role requires travel to customer sites in the Nordic region. Travelling approx. 20-30% of the time
Nice to have: Databricks Certification


About Databricks

Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.

Benefits

At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Compliance

If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Specialist
Place: Herlev Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du dygtig til datamodellering, data flows, og har du en erfaring med SAP BW? Hos os får du chancen for at blive en del af et dynamisk og ambitiøst team, som arbejder målrettet mod at skabe datadrevne beslutninger i en stor organisation.







Vi tilbyder

Som BI Specialist i Lemvigh-Müller kommer du til at arbejde i Danmarks førende stål- og teknikgrossist, der stolt repræsenterer ca. 1.300 dedikerede medarbejdere landet over. Vi gør os hver dag umage for at skabe de bedste rammer for, at du kan have et værdifuldt arbejdsliv, hvor du kan udleve dit fulde potentiale – og samtidig have overskud til alt det andet vigtige i livet. Vi tilbyder fx

Overskudsdeling – gælder alle medarbejdere og fordeles efter anciennitet
Sundhedsforsikring – giver dig mulighed for hurtig og god behandling
Barselsordning – med 17 ugers betalt orlov til fædre og 28 uger til mødre
Fleksible arbejdsformer – med mulighed for hjemmearbejde
Fondsstøtte – kan søges ifm. familieforøgelse, ægteskab og børns uddannelse




Brænder du for at styrke et lille, ambitiøst team i udviklingen af datadrevne løsninger

Business Intelligence-afdelingen består af et dedikeret team på fire kolleger, der er fordelt på frontend og backend, med base på vores kontorer i Kolding og Herlev. Vi har allerede taget store skridt i at udvikle et solidt datagrundlag, men for at styrke vores indsats søger vi nu en erfaren Senior BI Specialist, der kan bidrage til at løfte vores arbejde til næste niveau.




Datadrevne løsninger og stabil drift i fokus hos en erfaren specialist

Som person er du ambitiøs, har drive og evnerne til at skabe både resultater og relationer med vedvarende værdi, samtidig med at du er en holdspiller, der gerne hjælper med at spille dine kolleger gode. Du forstår vigtigheden af at levere resultater, der kan forankres i forretningen og blive morgendagens måde at arbejde på. Det betyder, at du formår at udfordre data og antagelser, samtidig med at du er nysgerrig og ydmyg i forhold til, hvordan vi gør tingene.




Dine opgaver

I rollen som Senior BI Specialist vil du arbejde med en bred vifte af opgaver, der sikrer, at vi kan fortsætte med at levere høj kvalitet i vores dataløsninger. Du vil have ansvar for at udvikle, vedligeholde og optimere vores BI-platform, samtidig med at du samarbejder tæt med kolleger på tværs af organisationen. Eksempler på opgaver

Videreudvikling af datamodeller og datagrundlag på SAP BW on HANA-platformen
Sikre stabil drift og oppetid af vores SAP BW-system
Implementering og optimering af forretningslogikker i samarbejde med relevante kolleger og interessenter
Support af samarbejdspartnere og udfordring af eksisterende processer for løbende at forbedre vores setup




Teknisk ekspertise, der skaber værdi og indsigt for hele organisationen

Vi leder efter en erfaren profil, der ikke bare har den tekniske indsigt, men også evner at forstå, hvordan datadrevne løsninger kan skabe reel værdi for forretningen. Du vil blive en central figur, der sikrer, at vores BI-løsninger fortsat kan understøtte vores strategiske mål. Derudover tænker vi at du har:

Flere års erfaring med SAP BW-udvikling og en stærk teknisk forståelse
Erfaring med rapportering på tværs af moduler
Evne til at kommunikere komplekse tekniske emner til både tekniske og ikke-tekniske interessenter
Flydende dansk i både skrift og tale for effektivt samarbejde med teamet og resten af organisationen




Lyder det som en spændende mulighed

Vi glæder os til at hører fra dig, så send dit CV via ’Søg Stillingen’ hurtigst muligt. Vi ansætter, når vi har fundet den rette kandidat. Ønsker du at vide mere om jobbet, er du velkommen til at kontakte Head of BI, Tim Milling Nielsen, på telefon 22 23 37 59.




I Lemvigh-Müller ser vi mangfoldighed, som en styrke og arbejder aktivt med diversitet bl.a. som del af DI’s Diversitetsløftet. Vi opfordrer derfor kvalificerede, uanset baggrund, til at søge jobbet. Du behøver kun at sende os dit CV – og undlad gerne billede, oplysning om alder og lignende.

Show more

I Lemvigh-Müller ser vi mangfoldighed, som en styrke og arbejder aktivt med diversitet bl.a. som del af DI’s Diversitetsløftet. Vi opfordrer derfor kvalificerede, uanset baggrund, til at søge jobbet. Du behøver kun at sende os dit CV – og undlad gerne billede, oplysning om alder og lignende.

Title: Python Developer - LLM
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
LLM Python Developer

Experience: 3 - 6 Years

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, Overlap Required: 5 hours Pst

Total Years Of exp- 3+ years

Mandatory Skills- Python min 2+ years. Technical Writing - min 2 yrs.

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Senior Python Developers to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and who aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with different companies in the US who are looking to develop both commercial and research AI solutions.

Required Skills


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues
Use business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks or other suitable mediums
Extensive experience working with Python
Proficiency with the language's syntax and conventions
Previous experience tackling algorithmic problems
Nice to have some prior Software Quality Assurance and Test Planning experience
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Required Skills For TWA

The ideal candidates should be able to


Clearly explain their strategies for problem-solving.
Design practical solutions in code.
Develop test cases to validate their solutions.
Debug and refine their solutions for improvement.

HTML:
LLM Python Developer

Experience: 3 - 6 Years

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, Overlap Required: 5 hours Pst

Total Years Of exp- 3+ years

Mandatory Skills- Python min 2+ years. Technical Writing - min 2 yrs.

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Senior Python Developers to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and who aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with different companies in the US who are looking to develop both commercial and research AI solutions.

Required Skills

  • Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues
  • Use business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
  • Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks or other suitable mediums
  • Extensive experience working with Python
  • Proficiency with the language's syntax and conventions
  • Previous experience tackling algorithmic problems
  • Nice to have some prior Software Quality Assurance and Test Planning experience
  • Excellent spoken and written English communication skills

Required Skills For TWA

The ideal candidates should be able to

  • Clearly explain their strategies for problem-solving.
  • Design practical solutions in code.
  • Develop test cases to validate their solutions.
  • Debug and refine their solutions for improvement.
