Title: Data Engineer til tværgående ejendomsdatakontor
Place: Frederiksberg Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Har du lyst til at arbejde med datamodellering, dataanalyse og programmering? Kan du trives i en stor organisation med mange interessenter? Så kan du være den helt rette profil til vores ejendomsdatakontor.

Fremtidens ejendomsvurderinger baseres på nye og detaljerede data, som skal sikre ejendomsvurderinger – og dermed også ejendomsbeskatning – af høj kvalitet. Du og andre gode kollegaer skal være med til at styrke den samlede værdikæde fra vurderings- til beskatningsdata og levere et afgørende løft til den datamæssige modenhed i Vurderingsstyrelsen.

Hvad enten du har gjort dig erfaringer med data engineering og er på kig efter nye udfordringer, eller du er ny på arbejdsmarkedet med lyst til at specialisere dig i data engineering, så kan vi bruge dig.

Arbejde med komplekse datastrukturer og store datamængder
Du bliver en del af et nyt kontor med seks kolleger, der har ansvar for den forretningsmæssige udvikling af Skatteforvaltningens ejendomsdata lige fra kildedata til beskatning. Vi skal sammen sikre at styrelsens styringsdata er tilgængelige i den rette kvalitet, så styrelsen effektivt kan basere beslutninger og aktiviteter på data. Du kan se frem til at blive én ud af fire data engineers, som dagligt arbejder med leverancer af dataprodukter.

Du vil bidrage til datamodellering og håndtere komplekse datastrukturer og store datamængder. Det kræver tekniske og forretningsmæssige afklaringer, som du varetager professionelt, så du både forstår forretningen og de it-tekniske aspekter. Vi udvikler også mindre applikationer til eksempelvis sagsstyring. Herudover oplever vi ofte behov for ad hoc indhentning og sammensætning af data, når styrelsen hurtigt skal levere korrekte data, som grundlag for behandling af indkommende forespørgsler. Desuden skal du være med til at opbygge datafaglighed i resten af styrelsen.

God dataforståelse og lyst til tværgående samarbejde
Du kan både være nyuddannet med en relevant uddannelse fx indenfor it, samfundsøkonomi eller naturvidenskab eller have flere års relevant erfaring. Det vigtigste er, at du har god forståelse for at arbejde med data, og at du har lyst til at udvikle dig indenfor området.

For at trives i rollen kræver det, at du:


Evner at analysere og strukturere komplekse data- og forretningsmæssige problemstillinger
Har en procesorienteret tankegang, så du kan tænke hele processen fra dataindhentning, databehandling til levering af data igennem.
Er god til at formidle komplekst stof til interessenter, som ikke har samme datamæssige baggrund som dig.
Har en positiv tilgang til arbejdsopgaver og nye udfordringer. Du er grundig, ansvarsfuld og kan arbejde selvstændigt og effektivt.



Det er en fordel hvis du har arbejdet med Python, R, SQL, GIT.

Hvad kan vi tilbyde dig
Hvis du ønsker at dygtiggøre dig i at udvikle dataområdet i en stor og kompleks organisation, så er det her du skal søge. Du får mulighed for at bidrage til hvordan vi håndterer data management i Vurderingsstyrelsen og får mulighed for at påvirke, hvordan vi implementerer det. Samtidig får du erfaring med arbejdet i en politisk organisation og vil således være klædt godt på til dit det næste skridt i karrieren inden for data, digitalisering og offentlig forvaltning.

Du kan se frem til en fagligt udfordrende stilling på en spændende og samfundsvigtig arbejdsplads, hvor vi tilbyder alsidige og udfordrende arbejdsopgaver i et uhøjtideligt fællesskab.

Samtidig er du med til at opbygge et nyt kontor, hvor vi vægter den enkeltes bidrag højt og du kan dermed sætte dit præg på områdets udvikling og styrelsens måde at arbejde med data på.

Kontakt og ansættelsesvilkår
Ansøgning med CV og eksamenspapirer bedes sendt via linket ”Søg stillingen” senest den 24. oktober.

Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte kontorchef Rune Bonnerup på telefon 72 37 02 45.

Der kan indgå en logisk test og en personanalyse i ansættelsesforløbet. Der vil forud for ansættelsen blive indhentet straffeattest.

Du bliver ansat på overenskomstvilkår i henhold til den til enhver tid gældende overenskomst for akademikere i staten (AC), overenskomst for kontorfunktionærer, laboranter og it-medarbejdere (HK) eller overenskomst for fuldmægtige m.fl. (DTS) i Skatteministeriet.

Ansættelsesområdet er Skatteministeriet med tilhørende institutioner. Dit arbejdssted bliver Lindevangs Allé 8-12, Frederiksberg.

Om Vurderingsstyrelsen
’Vi sikrer, at boligejerne får en mere retvisende og gennemskuelig ejendomsvurdering’

Vurderingsstyrelsen varetager alle forhold om ejendomsvurdering og beskatning af ejendomme. Styrelsens opgave er at udarbejde mere retvisende og gennemskuelige offentlige vurderinger af grunde og ejendomme og sikre korrekt betaling af skatten på baggrund af disse. Fremtidens vurderinger bliver baseret på nye og detaljerede data. Det skal sikre, at borgere og virksomheder kan have tillid til, at de bliver beskattet på et korrekt grundlag. Vores værdier er ansvar, udsyn, faglighed og samarbejde.

Vi er en arbejdsplads med mange forskellige fagligheder. De er alle i spil i dagligdagen, hvor vi lægger vægt på et godt arbejdsmiljø og en stærk samarbejdskultur, hvor alle trives, tager ansvar og bidrager til den fælles opgave. Vi har et godt kollegaskab med en uformel omgangstone og vi tror på, at en fornuftig balance mellem arbejdsliv og privatliv giver motiverede og tilfredse medarbejdere.

Vurderingsstyrelsen har ca. 900 ansatte og er en arbejdsplads i vækst, og vi har derfor løbende brug for nye, engagerede kolleger.

Læs mere om Vurderingsstyrelsen på www.vurdst.dk.

Vurderingsstyrelsen opfordrer alle kvalificerede uanset alder, køn, seksuel orientering, religion eller etnisk tilhørsforhold til at søge stillingen.

Ansøgningsfrist
24-10-2024
Show more

Title: Senior Market Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to drive leading intelligence products serving the offshore wind sector? Join us as our new Senior Market Analyst for Europe




Are you passionate about the green energy transition and do you want to be at the forefront of delivering cutting-edge offshore wind products to clients as part of a fast-growing company?




Join Aegir Insights and get a unique opportunity to join a fast-growing company in a workplace where you can make a difference every day, whilst being part of a young, agile and fast-paced company. We are accelerating the green transition, providing products that enable our clients to make smarter decisions, faster.

 

As Senior Market Analyst for Europe, you will be responsible for our intelligence reports across the European offshore wind markets. The offshore wind markets are in transition, and you will be at the forefront to identify and analyze key trends and insights. As part of a dedicated Research team, you will work with colleagues to provide industry-leading market insights and intelligence products to our subscribing clients across the offshore wind value chain.

 

Your key tasks will be to:

·        Drive and deliver thought-leading intelligence reports for a portfolio of European offshore wind markets

·        Stay on top of market developments, policy and regulatory change, route-to-market opportunities, etc. to analyze and communicate implications for market opportunities

·        Establish a strong presence as an influential speaker and thinker focused on strengthening Aegir Insights as a premium brand as well as your own through media engagement and speaking at conferences

·        Drive and contribute to intelligence product development together with the Regional Lead for Europe

·        Ensure strong client engagement and relationships with key stakeholders in the industry.

 

We imagine that you have:

·        At least 4 years of experience in the offshore wind industry, e.g. from a developer or investor, alternatively experience from offshore wind advisory, intelligence or research

·        Comprehensive understanding of the key market drivers for offshore wind projects and early-stage opportunities such as regulation, policy, supply chain, competition, technology, etc.

·        In-depth knowledge of one or more of the following offshore wind markets is a clear advantage: Germany, Netherlands, Belgium, France and the UK

·        Strong commercial and strategic understanding of markets and the ability to translate this into opportunities for clients

·        Advanced working knowledge of the Microsoft Suite, specifically Excel and PowerPoint, and you are an experienced communicator using PowerPoint to target executives (C-suite) with effective storytelling

·        A master’s degree in finance, economics, law, engineering, or other relevant fields.

 

Your competences include:

·        Exceptional problem-solving skills - you have an analytical, innovative, and creative mindset

·        Well-developed skills of research, analysis, presentation, and attention to detail

·        Self-driven with the ability to lead deliveries in a very collaborative environment to bring together skills and insights from diverse teams

·        Engaging nature and enjoy connecting with co-workers, clients, and industry stakeholders

·        Strong communication skills in oral and written English.

 

Working at Aegir Insights

Joining Aegir Insights means joining a passionate and dedicated team that moves fast on new ideas and enjoys learning new things while having fun. We encourage innovative and lateral thinking to achieve our goals.

 

We offer a respectful, diverse, and international working environment (our company language is English). Our internal way of working is informal and collaborative, and we put emphasis on all employees having client engagement.​

 

Currently, we are a team of 30+ people, with expectations to grow significantly in size. Therefore, you will take part in our growth journey where you will actively contribute to shaping our evolving working culture.

 

We offer a competitive remuneration package:

·        Salary according to experience

·        Flexible working conditions, hybrid/office setup (2-3 weekly office days are preferred)

·        Subsidized lunch when working from the office

·        10% pension contribution and company pension scheme

·        Insurance scheme including health insurance.

 

We are located in the heart of Copenhagen at Havnegade 27 st, 1058 Copenhagen.

 

About Aegir Insights

Aegir Insights is a tech-driven company offering decision-making software, data and intelligence products for the offshore wind sector. We leverage data science and deep industry experience to help developers, investors, suppliers, financial institutions and governments make decisions. 




Would you like to help accelerate the world’s transformation to renewable energy?

We look forward to receiving your CV, a motivated cover letter (mandatory), and relevant diplomas as electronic files via email research.recruit@aegirinsights.com, please mark as ‘Senior Market Analyst’. We encourage everyone to apply, regardless of their background.




NB: Applications directly through LinkedIn's Easy Apply function will not be considered.

 

The deadline for applying is November 8th 2024 – however we will be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and will close this job advertisement as soon as we have identified a successful candidate.




If you would like to know more about the position, please contact Rikke Nørgaard, CCO, on phone number +45 51907763 between 9.30am and 1pm CET.

NB: Applications directly through LinkedIn's Easy Apply function will not be considered.

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
You get an everyday life where you, in collaboration with your agile team, are the one who examines the requirements from our customer and can see what they mean in terms of data for the system. For you, it's about being able to see data's path through the system and how data and communication ultimately reach our end customer.




It is a complex system, and you get a close collaboration with both testers, developers and product owner. In addition, you are in continuous contact with our customer as well as business analysts from both our own and our other agile teams. This is, among other things, to ensure that data is coherent across the system's functionality.




We are well on the way to incorporating the agile principles to create a common framework for our work. It's a culture change that you need to help support.




Responsibilities:

As a person, you must be good at working in detail, understanding connections and collaborating across disciplines.




At the same time, you find it exciting to participate in a change process.




You are good at getting your colleagues on board and elucidating the value of the agile setup. It also requires that you understand that your colleagues can be at different points in the process and have a listening ear and lots of zest ready




Mandatory Skills Description:

As a person, you must be good at working in detail, understanding contexts and collaborating across disciplines.

At the same time, you think it is exciting to participate in a change process.

You are good at getting your colleagues involved and highlighting the value of the agile setup. It also requires that you understand that your colleagues can be at different points in the process and have a listening ear and lots of enthusiasm ready. Finally, we imagine that you:

• have an academic background where you have worked with system development

• possibly have an IT background, e.g. as a developer, where you have built up a good business understanding and now want to work as a business analyst

• know about working in an IBM host-based environment

• speaks and writes Danish fluently.




Nice-to-Have Skills Description:

IBM Cloud




Languages:

Danish: C2 Proficient

English: B2 Upper Intermediate

As a person, you must be good at working in detail, understanding contexts and collaborating across disciplines.

At the same time, you think it is exciting to participate in a change process.

You are good at getting your colleagues involved and highlighting the value of the agile setup. It also requires that you understand that your colleagues can be at different points in the process and have a listening ear and lots of enthusiasm ready. Finally, we imagine that you:

• have an academic background where you have worked with system development

• possibly have an IT background, e.g. as a developer, where you have built up a good business understanding and now want to work as a business analyst

• know about working in an IBM host-based environment

• speaks and writes Danish fluently.


Nice-to-Have Skills Description:

IBM Cloud


Languages:

Danish: C2 Proficient

English: B2 Upper Intermediate

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
You get an everyday life where you, in collaboration with your agile team, are the one who examines the requirements from our customer and can see what they mean in terms of data for the system. For you, it's about being able to see data's path through the system and how data and communication ultimately reach our end customer.




It is a complex system, and you get a close collaboration with both testers, developers and product owner. In addition, you are in continuous contact with our customer as well as business analysts from both our own and our other agile teams. This is, among other things, to ensure that data is coherent across the system's functionality.




We are well on the way to incorporating the agile principles to create a common framework for our work. It's a culture change that you need to help support.

As a person, you must be good at working in detail, understanding connections and collaborating across disciplines.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Are you a highly motivated team player, eager to make a change in the technology sector? Do you find it interesting to participate in important strategic change projects while providing insights as our new Business Analyst?




We have an exciting opportunity for you to join as a Business Analyst in our IT Strategy & Design department.




YOUR TEAM:

Working for a pan-European logistics provider specializing in time critical logistics, you will be a part of the IT department responsible for delivering group wide technology services. Working alongside 50 colleagues you will form part of our strategy and design function, where you will work together with 2-3 other BA’s supporting the gathering of business requirements and evolution of our service in multiple technology initiatives.




YOUR JOB:

As a business analyst, your main responsibility is to analyze, drive, optimize and ensure a continuous high quality supporting the delivery of business requirements. The role involves collaboration with business stakeholders to understand their requirements, documenting processes and ensuring that initiative deliverables meet the needs of the business. You will support the process from initial analysis through documentation, working with the development team, through to supporting user testing and final deployment.

This journey gives the opportunity to be part of a private equity owned company with clear ambitions to become the leading pan-European time critical service logistics provider. The role comes with great opportunities to develop as a professional and make an impact on shaping the company´s future.




More specifically, your responsibilities include:

Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their needs and gather detailed business requirements.
Works on IT projects to bridge the gap between technical teams and business stakeholders
Develop and document business process models to illustrate current and future states.
Propose and design technical and process solutions that meet business needs and objectives.
Work with IT and other departments to implement solutions and ensure they align with business goals.
Communicate findings, recommendations, and project updates to stakeholders and executives.
Create detailed documentation of business requirements, processes, and solutions.
Participate in testing and validating new systems and processes to meet business requirements.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and contribute to ongoing optimization efforts.
Support user engagement and training.




YOUR BENEFITS:

Flexibility and Hybrid working possibilities.
Lunch arrangement
Health Insurance
Grants/subsidy for sports




YOUR PROFILE:

Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Information Technology, Computer Science or a related field.

Minimum of 1-3 years of experience as a Business Analyst or in a related role.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.

Experience with business process modeling and documentation tools.

You have an open and positive mindset. We’re looking for people who take ownership, are driven, proactive and ambitious and can work in an agile way.

You have a flair for stakeholder management and communication.

You will be located in Denmark and possess an excellent standard of written and spoken English (this role includes dealing with English speaking stakeholders from other European countries).

Working experience, knowledge or technical experience within logistics, 3PL or shipping industry would be an advantage.




WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

Please upload your application and CV including a short introduction and why you think you are the right candidate for this job via the link before 21.10.2024. We review applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to take down the ad when we find the right candidates.




If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to reach out to the contact persons below:

Head of Technology Strategy and Design, Nick Alsop, at: nick.alsop@danxcarousel.com







About us:




Our culture:

At DANX Carousel we focus on values such as caring, learning and ownership and these values serve as a good foundation for our culture. We will make sure that you get the onboarding you need to feel welcome at the company from the very beginning. Moreover, our aim is to always provide our employees with the best learning and development opportunities in order to build the necessary competencies so that you have the best conditions to succeed in the job and become a valuable employee who will contribute to the company’s growth. At DANX Carousel, you will have great opportunities to learn and get all the support and help you need. At the same time, we expect you to take ownership and responsibility and that you have the desire to be part of an ambitious team, with various nationalities.

Who is DANX Carousel Group? – A strong pan-European in-night logistics specialist

DANX is a strongly positioned in-night distributor of spare parts across the Nordics and Baltics, with a distribution network of trucks, sprinter vans and air transport in all seven countries. Founded in 1992, DANX is the partner for all types of spare parts distribution. With a strong network of warehouses and collection hubs, DANX guarantees in-night distribution in under 12 hours, with delivery before 07:00 on the following morning. With a full end-to-end IT platform integrated with customers’ workflows and processes, DANX helps its customers to optimize their supply chains by minimizing delivery and production times.

In February 2022, Axcel invested in DANX and combined DANX with Carousel. Carousel is a strongly positioned pan-European specialized logistics provider of end to-end supply chain solutions, handling spare parts for OEMs from distribution centers direct to field service engineers, dealers and end users. Carousel has especially a strong presence in the UK and operations in Ireland. Founded in 1986, Carousel uses flexible networks tailored to end clients’ requirements that are connected through a proprietary client-facing technology platform to provide a seamless and transparent mission-critical aftermarket logistics service to avoid the high cost of failure and enable high-performance service strategies.

Axcel, founded in 1994, is a Nordic private equity firm focusing on mid-market companies, with a broad base of both Nordic and international investors. Axcel has raised six funds with total committed capital of EUR 2.8 billion. These funds have made 64 platform investments, with well over 150 add-on investments and 46 exits. Axcel currently owns 18 companies.

Title: Vessel Performance Manager
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

Vessel Performance Manager/Analyst

Do you want to be part of the maritime industry’s digital transformation?

Are you an engineer, data analyst, or technical expert eager to innovate in vessel performance management? Whether you're experienced in ship hydrodynamics, passionate about maritime data analytics, or looking for your next big challenge, Vessel Performance Solutions, a subsidiary of GTT Digital, invites you to lead the future of vessel and fleet optimization.

Job Description

Why You Should Join Us


Cutting-Edge Innovation: Be at the forefront of developing the next-generation vessel performance systems. Whether you’re a seasoned professional or an ambitious newcomer, you'll work with advanced tools like VESPER, our proprietary platform for analyzing vessel data and optimizing fleet operations.
Impactful Work: Shape the future of the maritime industry by collaborating on international projects. You’ll help shipping companies improve efficiency, reduce environmental impact, and innovate for the future of fleet performance.
Diverse Learning Opportunities: Grow your career with continuous development. Whether you're mastering advanced Excel analytics or diving deep into Python, we offer the tools and mentorship to help you succeed.
Global Work Environment: Join a diverse, international team with offices in Denmark and Greece, providing flexibility and opportunities to collaborate with experts across borders.


Who We’re Looking For

We are seeking individuals from a variety of backgrounds to bring their unique expertise to our team. If you have experience in engineering, data analytics, or the maritime industry, we’d love to hear from you:


Experienced Naval Engineers:
Background: Engineering or naval architecture with expertise in ship hydrodynamics, propulsion, sea-keeping, and maneuvering.
Motivation: Drive technical improvements in vessel performance and collaborate on complex engineering challenges.
Skills: Hydrodynamics, hull & propeller maintenance, and shipping operations.
Maritime Data Analysts:
Background: Proficient in data analysis, data mining, and translating complex datasets into actionable insights.
Motivation: Leverage advanced data tools to optimize fleet performance.
Skills: Excel analytics, Python, .NET, and system identification techniques.
Technical Managers in Shipping:
Background: Experience in vessel operations and fleet performance management, with a deep understanding of ship maintenance and operational challenges.
Motivation: Lead projects that enhance fleet efficiency and influence the future of maritime technology.
Skills: Performance management, shipping operations, and team leadership.
Ambitious Graduates and Emerging Talent:
Background: Recently graduated in naval architecture, engineering, or related fields, with a keen interest in performance optimization.
Motivation: Jumpstart your career by working with cutting-edge tools and gaining experience in real-world projects.
Skills: Basic knowledge of ship performance, data analytics, and a strong desire to learn new tools like VESPER.
Innovators in Maritime Technology:
Background: Passion for software development, mathematical modeling, and transforming data into innovative solutions for the shipping industry.
Motivation: Work at the intersection of maritime operations and tech, using your skills to enhance decision-making systems for global fleets.
Skills: Programming in Python, .NET, advanced mathematical modeling, and algorithm development.

What You’ll Do


Support our clients by analyzing vessel performance data and providing insights to optimize fleet operations.
Develop and enhance the VESPER platform, transforming data into actionable decision support tools.
Participate in research and development projects like SLGreen, pushing the boundaries of maritime technology and performance modeling.
Collaborate with international partners to innovate in fleet performance, drive efficiencies, and reduce environmental impact.


What We Offer


Competitive Salary: A Danish contract with a competitive salary and the flexibility to shape your role.
Personal Growth: Continuous learning and development through a network of maritime experts and cutting-edge projects.
Collaborative Environment: Work in an informal, yet focused, environment where innovation thrives and teamwork is valued.
Global Reach: Be part of a growing company managing over 1,500 vessels worldwide, with opportunities to engage with shipping leaders across the globe.


How To Apply

Submit your application by 1st November 2024. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis, so don’t wait! Contact Jakob Buus Petersen (+45 2328 6166), Kristian Bendix Nielsen (+45 6167 0778), or Eirini Avanitaki (+30 6947175794) for more information.

Send your CV and cover letter to Marie Aw: maw@gtt.fr. We look forward to having you onboard!

Title: Business Process Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copenhagen, Denmark

About The Job

Do you have a knack for turning "meh" processes into "wow" workflows? Can you spot areas for improvement faster than a cat can spot a laser pointer? If your answer is yes, we want you on our team!

The Digital Onboarding team is based in Copenhagen and is part of our Group Commercial Organization - here we don’t just think outside the box; we ask why the box is there in the first place! We are on a mission to improve and elevate the experience of newcomers to Saxo – balancing their user experience with our platform, operational efficiency and AML/KYC compliance regulations.

Responsibilities


Perform Quantitative analysis of onboarding processes, draw optimization conclusions & identify solutions (either technical, or behavioral)
Document business requirements/user stories and work with technology and business teams to completion (launch of feature)
Prepare change risk assessment documents and mitigation actions, ensure actions are implemented and signed off with owners
Collaborate proactively with stakeholders across the organization such as Product Owners, Developers, Compliance, Legal and Non Financial Risk Officers as well as people working with manual approval of client accounts to drive process improvement changes


How Do You Succeed


You are able to drive tasks forward independently, when encountering obstacles, you find a solution with stakeholders
You thrive in coordinating between many stakeholders and will take pride in delivering a quality project
You are focused on meeting deadlines


Relevant Skills


Master degree in Data Science, IT Application Development or similar
Experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar business process improvement role
Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis tools— SQL, Excel, Power BI
Exceptional communication and documentation skills—if you can explain concepts to a room full of teenagers, you’re on the right track (bonus points for flow charts, gliffy diagrams or similar)


As a Person You Are


Naturally enthusiastic about continuous improvement (and you have a deep-seated dislike for the phrase “that’s how we’ve always done it”).
Structured, and detail oriented when necessary
A problem solver who can create a clear structure from complexities
Take ownership and responsibility for your work
Self-driven, thrive in a dynamic environment and enjoy collaborating with stakeholders across the organization
Have a sense of humor and are a team player. Everyone has something to learn and something to teach.


We get curious people invested in the world

When you work at Saxo, you become a Saxonian and part of a purpose-driven organisation, where good ideas are always taken seriously, and where you can make a true impact. We are invested in your development, and you can expect a robust career from day one when you join Saxo – no matter which role you take on.

You will join 2,500 other ambitious colleagues across 15 countries and become part of an international organisation. Working in Saxo, you will get to meet colleagues from many different cultures and backgrounds, and you should know that we value diversity and inclusion and see it as a genuine source of strength to drive growth, foster innovation and position us for long-term success.

We encourage an open feedback culture and supportive team environments enabling employees to grow and fulfil their career aspirations.

When you bring passion, curiosity, drive and team spirit, your learning journey will be dynamic and your career opportunities in Saxo will be immense.

At Saxo we don’t just offer a job – we offer an opportunity to invest in your future!

How To Apply

Click here to create an account and upload your resume and a short motivation. We look forward to getting to know you better!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Role

At Deliveroo we have an outstanding data science organisation, with a mission to enable the highest quality human and machine decision-making. We work throughout the company - in product, business and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Deliveroo.

We are looking for a Data Analyst that is passionate about metrics and telling the stories behind the data. We have several roles open across different teams (grocery, loyalty, restaurants). Data Analysts at Deliveroo report into our data science management team.

You will be a professional in insights storytelling, communication and visualisation and know how to create action from metrics. Crafting effective intelligent benchmarks, understanding performance, caring about data quality, enabling automation and creating phenomenal visualisations and stories are things that drive you.

What you'll be doing



Work closely with commercial stakeholders to create value and business impact through better data availability, visualisation and analysis
Discover, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets to perform ad-hoc analyses and deliver insights to the executive team and senior management
Understand key drivers of the business and provide data driven guidance on key levers
Identify and specify data needs and quality requirements and work closely with Analytics Engineers to ensure data is available, accurate and corresponds to the business needs
Consolidate and distribute best analytical practices from different teams and countries



Requirements



Experience identifying the root cause of problems, assessing risks/impacts and determining and implementing effective solutions.
A good understanding of querying in SQL and understanding of database structure - you'll be expected to be able to extract the data you need for your analysis.
Compelling story-telling skills, and an eye for powerful visualisations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)
Good knowledge of Excel/GSheets - depending on the task, there is a good chance that this is where some of your exploratory analysis will take place. Being comfortable with pivot tables and functions will be essential.
Developer experience with a data visualisation tool (Looker, Tableau, Periscope)



Why Deliveroo

Our mission is to transform the way you shop and eat, bringing the neighbourhood to your door by connecting consumers, restaurants, shops and riders. . We are transforming the way the world eats and shops by making access to food and products more convenient and enjoyable. We give people the opportunity to buy what they want, as they want it, when and where they want it.

We are a technology-driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world. We are still a small team, making a very large impact, looking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, value autonomy and ownership, and we are always looking for new ideas.

Workplace & Benefits

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. Benefits differ by country, but we offer many benefits in areas including healthcare, well-being, parental leave, pensions, and generous annual leave allowances, including time off to support a charitable cause of your choice. Benefits are country-specific, please ask your recruiter for more information. This role in a Hybrid position.

Diversity

At Deliveroo, we believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest-growing businesses in a rapidly growing industry.

We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in all aspects of our hiring process. We recognise that some candidates may require adjustments to apply for a position or fairly participate in the interview process. If you require any adjustments, please don't hesitate to let us know. We will make every effort to provide the necessary adjustments to ensure you have an equitable opportunity to succeed.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

The Role

At Deliveroo we have an outstanding data science organisation, with a mission to enable the highest quality human and machine decision-making. We work throughout the company - in product, business and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Deliveroo.

We are looking for a Data Analyst that is passionate about metrics and telling the stories behind the data. We have several roles open across different teams (grocery, loyalty, restaurants). Data Analysts at Deliveroo report into our data science management team.

You will be a professional in insights storytelling, communication and visualisation and know how to create action from metrics. Crafting effective intelligent benchmarks, understanding performance, caring about data quality, enabling automation and creating phenomenal visualisations and stories are things that drive you.

What you'll be doing

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Onyx Capital Group seeks a Junior Data Analyst to join its Insights Research team within the company's Advisory function. The position will support current and development work related to the Research team's report production and data processes. On the job training will be provided to get up-to-speed with both the technology and industry knowledge.

Your responsibilities would include:


Maintaining and improving scripts and backend data using DataBricks and SQL to automate Onyx Research team's publications
Participating in development projects related to new publications and data repositories as the Research team's output grows
Participating in developing new quantitative analysis projects for the Research Team and Quantitative Traders



Requirements


Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as computer science, statistics, mathematics, physics, or engineering
The candidate must possess strong coding skills in Python and have knowledge of SQL. Proficiency in Microsoft Azure (Data Factory, DevOps, Storage), Databricks, Delta Lake, and Plotly Dash Enterprise would be beneficial but is not required
Graduate or junior experience in a data science department in financial services, consultancy, or related fields is desirable but not required
Perseverance to work through frequent daily tasks demanding speed and accuracy alongside longer independent projects
Strong interpersonal skills
Detail-oriented and organised
Team-oriented but able to work autonomously as required in a fast-paced environment, prioritising and planning accordingly
Ability to meet tight deadlines with precision and rigor

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Contract

Location: London office with hybrid working

Duration: 6 Months +

Rate: £300pd - £350pd inside IR35




Role Overview:

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to address critical issues related to our client’s program. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, a solid understanding of infrastructure, database (DB), operating systems (OS) and some project management capabilities.




Key Responsibilities:

Demonstrate proficiency in understanding Operating Systems (OS) and Database (DB) logs, specifically in Windows, Linux, SQL, and Oracle environments.
Support the remediation of Operating Systems and Data Base accounts with outdated passwords, collaborating with system administrators to determine the most effective and secure methods for password management.
Assess risks associated with account misuse and develop strategies to mitigate these risks, effective from January 1st.
Evaluate the potential impact of inappropriate access on SOX (Sarbanes–Oxley Act) compliance, including the risk of unauthorized data changes or deletion of activity logs.
Conduct thorough reviews of activity logs to ensure accountability and transparency in system access.




Qualifications:

5+ years experience in data analysis, with a focus on IT compliance and security.
Strong project management skills and experience.
Proficient in analysing Operating Systems and Data Base logs for Windows, Linux, SQL, and Oracle.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Creditsafe is looking for a dynamic and forward-thinking Data Analyst to join our Identity Resolution Team. This role is more than a job - it's an opportunity to dive headfirst into a world of transformative tech and impactful analysis. We are driven by the spirit of innovation and our passion for understanding people's needs. We thrive on using cutting-edge technologies such as Machine Learning and data-driven insights to understand our customers at a granular level.




WHO ARE WE?

At Creditsafe, we weave our core values of customer-obsession, trust, respect and the courage to be different into the very fabric of our culture. With these values, we’ve fostered a culture of growth, innovation, well-being and success for the last 20 years at Creditsafe and created a legacy of successful career trajectories within our community of Creditsafers.




Powering business decisions for over 100,000 business across the world requires more than just the right tools. As a company, we don’t shy away from rolling up our sleeves to do everything possible to create a welcoming environment where every new talent is guided, supported and nurtured to grow and become a part of the culture.




With 25 offices across 14 countries, our geographically disperse community of colleagues are a testament to our inclusive and diverse culture that comes together to solve complex problems and learn from each other.




Twice featured in The Sunday Times list of ‘100 Best Companies to Work,’ our list of successful Creditsafers who’ve created long-standing, strong career trajectories out of what started out as jobs, just keeps growing. We’re proud to be a part of a culture and a company where careers are made and where talent meet its true potential.




THE TEAM

Identity resolution is one of Creditsafe’s core teams, enabling our customers to match their customer and client lists against our extensive database of companies across many different countries. Currently built on a python, hadoop / hive and AWS tech stack, the product is constantly evolving and is currently going through a very exciting phase where we seek to streamline and improve our matching capabilities across the whole business.




JOB PROFILE

As our Data Analyst, you will use state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms and sophisticated data analysis techniques to decode customer behaviours and translate them into actionable insights, along with analysing patterns in company data, cleansing and enhancing data quality, and devising new rules and methodologies for efficient data matching




KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Analyse patterns in company data across various international markets
Interpret customer data to identify optimal strategies for enhancing our matching capabilities
Identify matching patterns and rules
Identify ways to cleanse and enhance the quality of existing and received data
Collaborate with the technical team to build and implement rules
Prepare comprehensive reports on the results of data analyses using PowerBI, Tableau or similar solution
Collaborate with other teams to identify opportunities for process and policy improvements.




The responsibilities detailed above are not exhaustive and you may be requested to take on additional responsibilities deemed as reasonable by their direct line manager.




SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

A Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience in a similar role.
Proven experience with data cleansing, data analysis and data presentation
Advanced knowledge of data processing and analysis tools and software.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.




BENEFITS

Competitive Salary.
Company Laptop supplied.
Bonus Scheme.
25 Days Annual Leave (plus bank holidays).
Hybrid working model.
Healthcare & Company Pension.
Cycle to work and Wellbeing Programme.
Global Company gatherings and events.
E-learning and excellent career progression opportunities.
Plus more that can be found on the benefits section on the Careers page, https://careers.creditsafe.com/gb.




Creditsafe is an equal opportunities employer that values diversity. Please contact Creditsafe if there is any support you need with your application.

Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About the job




TEKsystems Global Services is a growing Professional Services company. We provide bespoke IT solutions across a spectrum of services to a range of market leading global clients. Our business strategy focuses on continually developing our service offering and providing the commercial support needed for this growth, this role is focused on our EMEA region. This specific role sits within our Commercial and Financial Operations department and has the opportunity to progress becoming a Commercial Business Partner role or Project Analyst role.




This is a unique opportunity with a mixture of Commercial and Finance, focusing on data, analytics and process improvements whilst playing a crucial role in driving business results. As part of this team, you’ll utilize our financial, sales and operations technology/systems to cleanse, review, analyze and ultimately transform data into insight. This role offers the opportunity to obtain an in-depth view of performance and business processes whilst providing recommendations for improvements with a “Right First Time” mindset.




This role would suit an individual seeking to be in an analytical role and is passionate about automating manual processes, in what is a fast-paced and dynamic services business. We are a people-focused organisation that takes pride in the inclusive and innovative culture that we have created. We recognise the importance of our people and invest in the training and development to offer continuous opportunity to those who earn the right.







Core Skills, Role and Responsibilities:




Developing an in-depth understanding of our business operates, internal systems and data sources to provide data insight
Develop an understanding of IFRS (International Financial Reporting Standards) to aid in the manipulation and presenting of financial data
Develop strong partnerships with Sales, Commercial, Operations and Finance to improve current and future business decisions
Gather, monitor, audit and analyse sales, finance and operations data to provide insight and drive business improvements and track KPI’s
Monitor and audit data quality, building in automated checks where necessary
Analysing trends and variances in data to drive data accuracy
Increase productivity by implementing and maintaining automated data processes.
Supporting in management reporting on financial budgeting, month end revenue and profitability analysis on the EMEA Region
Management reporting on sales performance and reward tracking
Supporting strategic priorities and transformational projects sponsored by the Senior Leadership team
Driving excellence through process improvements
Development of business cases for strategic decision making







Knowledge and skills:




BSc/BA degree or similar further education (ideally in a Business or Finance related subject)
1-3 years post graduate experience in business finance or similar
Superior communication skills, written and oral, and ability to build relationships quickly
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent attention to detail – “Right First Time”
Excellent Time Management, organisation skills and adaptable to change
Experience providing high standards of service to stakeholders
Advanced experience with Microsoft Office tools – Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Access
Experience and/ or knowledge of SQL and Tableau/Power BI (Desired)
Experience of gathering requirements and delivering insights/reporting as agreed (Desired)
Comprehensible understanding of financial, sales and operational metrics (Desired)
Good basic financial acumen (P&L, cashflow, balance sheet) and understanding of financial modelling, contract pricing and differing pricing models. (Desired)




Behaviours:




Ability to scrutinise potential challenges and provide options to deliver the desired result - Solutions-orientated approach
Building relationships and communicating with a wide range of business stakeholders
Takes initiative and responsibility to address what is required to achieve goals
High level of self-motivation and drive for self-improvement (including new skills and tools) with commitment to high quality delivery
Persistent in the face of significant challenges, with a readiness to tackle difficult tasks and devise innovative solutions.
Comfortable in assessment of risks in an ambiguous environment
Organised and able to manage time effectively
Flexible and able to execute multiple initiatives concurrently with the ability to re-prioritize as needed
Open to challenging current ways of working
Fair, open and honest demeanour
Managing upwards
Conflict resolution between stakeholders
Public speaking or presenting experience

Show more

  • Conflict resolution between stakeholders
  • Public speaking or presenting experience

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Citywire is on the lookout for a talented Data Analyst to join our team. This role offers the opportunity to work closely with business stakeholders, helping them unlock the potential of their data to drive key decisions and achieve their goals.

As a Data Analyst at Citywire, you'll be at the heart of our data-driven initiatives. You'll collaborate with various teams across the company, helping them understand their data needs and delivering the insights they require. This is an exciting role for someone who enjoys working with data, solving complex problems, and driving projects that make a real impact.

What you’ll be doing:


Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their data requirements and provide the data they need to meet their goals.
Extract data from various sources and produce clear, insightful reports that support business decisions.
Dive deep into datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that can guide strategic decision-making.
Work alongside the Data Engineering team to ensure data is properly structured for analysis and reporting and collaborate with Development teams to ensure accurate data capture at the source.
Help colleagues across the business become data champions within their own departments by providing them with the tools and knowledge they need.
Lead and contribute to engineering projects based on the company’s data needs.


What we’re looking for:


Communication Skills: Ability to clearly communicate complex data concepts to colleagues at all levels.
Analytical Approach: Strong analytical skills with the ability to work with complex datasets and build reports from raw data.
Data Visualisation: Proficiency in visualising data in a way that’s easy to understand for non-technical stakeholders.


Experience in:


Some proven experience in a Data Analyst role.
SQL: Proficient in manipulating data using SQL.
Google Big Query: Experience with Google Big Query or similar platforms.
Visualisation Tools: Familiarity with data visualisation tools such as Looker Studio or equivalent.
NoSQL Databases: Experience working with NoSQL databases.
Cloud Platforms: Experience with AWS, GCP, or similar cloud platforms.
Excel/Google Sheets: Strong skills in Excel and Google Sheets.
Power Query: Experience with Power Query is a plus.


Meet Citywire

We cover - and connect - all sides of the $100 trillion global asset management industry - through our news, events and insights.

At Citywire, we uphold a culture rooted in honesty, integrity, and fairness, where every voice is valued and heard. Our culture promotes constructive dialogue and collaboration on a global scale.

Join the team at the forefront of the global asset management industry.

Our perks:


Generous holiday entitlement: Start with 25 days per annum, increasing to 28 days after three years' service, and 30 days after five years' service, in addition to bank holidays.
Flexible working options.
£480 annual allowance for well-being activities or gym memberships, with assistance available for monthly or annual costs.
Eye-test and glasses allowance.
Competitive private pension scheme.
Critical illness cover and group life assurance from day one of employment.
Well-being support: Access to an independent Employee Assistance Programme, available 24/7.
Cycle to work scheme and annual travel card loans.
Techscheme: Purchase the latest tech through our employer scheme, spreading the cost over 12 months with National Insurance savings.
After two years of continuous service, access group income protection, private medical, and dental insurance.


Citywire is an equal opportunities employer.
Show more

  • Excel/Google Sheets: Strong skills in Excel and Google Sheets.
  • Power Query: Experience with Power Query is a plus.

Meet Citywire

We cover - and connect - all sides of the $100 trillion global asset management industry - through our news, events and insights.

At Citywire, we uphold a culture rooted in honesty, integrity, and fairness, where every voice is valued and heard. Our culture promotes constructive dialogue and collaboration on a global scale.

Join the team at the forefront of the global asset management industry.

Our perks:

  • Generous holiday entitlement: Start with 25 days per annum, increasing to 28 days after three years' service, and 30 days after five years' service, in addition to bank holidays.
  • Flexible working options.
  • £480 annual allowance for well-being activities or gym memberships, with assistance available for monthly or annual costs.
  • Eye-test and glasses allowance.
  • Competitive private pension scheme.
  • Critical illness cover and group life assurance from day one of employment.
  • Well-being support: Access to an independent Employee Assistance Programme, available 24/7.
  • Cycle to work scheme and annual travel card loans.
  • Techscheme: Purchase the latest tech through our employer scheme, spreading the cost over 12 months with National Insurance savings.
  • After two years of continuous service, access group income protection, private medical, and dental insurance.

Citywire is an equal opportunities employer.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Duration: 12 Months

Work Location: UK - Remote

Minimum Pay Rate: £45.67/hour




Summary:

the Client is seeking an analyst to contribute to large projects and leverage analytical skills to help deliver lasting impact on the products. The main function of an Analyst is to work with the Premier Partner Operations team to identify and root cause possible issues and trends across verified support queues. This is a subscription-based service available to Creators and Businesses, offering them a range of benefits ranging from Verification, Protection to Customer Support. The candidate will support the creation of post mortem and root cause analysis which will be presented to the Product and Ops leaders across the company.




Job Responsibilities:

Monitor our different dashboards to identify trends impacting our tier 1 tier 2 support queues Deepdive on trends and support cases to identify and validate assumptions on possible root causes Document and present root cause analysis to XFNs and Leaders to help get alignment on resolution paths.




Qualifications:







Previous experience in project or program management in the Customer Support industry.
Verbal and written communication skills, multi-tasking and interpersonal skills.
Experience with SQL and Data Analysis
Ability to present to leadership
Previous experience with a support facing platforms would be a nice to have

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst




Competitive Salary

Permanent Role

Kilmarnock (Hybrid Working)

Posted day 03/10/24

CVs by ASAP

Start date Oct – Dec 24







Meraki Talent’s financial services client is seeking a Data Process Analyst to join their expanding team. This role offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development and enhancement of key business processes within a dynamic organisation focused on efficiency and innovation.




As the company continues to grow, this position will play a crucial part in ensuring that operational processes are optimized, streamlined, and effectively aligned with the company’s strategic objectives. If you are an experienced professional with a passion for data-driven decision-making and process improvement, this could be the perfect role for you.







Key Responsibilities of the Junior Data Analyst




Design and enhance workflows for customer interactions, digital engagement, customer tracing, and data enrichment initiatives.
Assist in driving innovation and process efficiency across the team through ongoing improvements and optimization efforts.
Work closely with operational teams to assess business needs and provide technical solutions that meet strategic goals.
Simplify and automate manual processes to increase operational efficiency and accuracy.
Support essential, data-intensive processes such as onboarding new clients, regulatory reporting, performance tracking, and operational testing.




Skills and Experience of the Junior Data Analyst

Experience in a similar role or open to graduates from a computer science or relevant degree
Proficiency in SQL or similar programming languages, with proven experience in query optimization and managing ETL workflows.
Expertise in analysing and interpreting complex datasets
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills







Is this job for you? At Meraki, we love recruitment and love words. Is this you?







Rory wants: Data, Strategy, SQL, Python, Operations







Please see our website page headed (eg) ‘Privacy Notice’ for an explanation about how we use information we collect about you’

Title: Media Data Analyst
Description:
Job Overview




This role will be responsible for supporting the media and digital analytics team for PN Europe to deliver maximum value from media performance data to better optimise media testing and investments. This role will include working closely with Mars Media Agencies, Media Activation teams and Media Platforms, to ensure that tests and advanced media measurement is set up with statistical rigour and has results that are actionable within the business. Also, this role is responsible for supporting the team lead on investment scenario planning, utilising MMM results and scaled modelling principles.




Key Responsibilities




Support Media testing agenda and execute advanced media measurement (sales lift studies and Media Mix Modelling interpretation) with key partners.
Work closely with business teams to support analytical needs & fulfill reporting gaps.
Support on data driven investment scenario planning across Pet Nutrition Europe.
Support on Media Platform measurement discussions, partnering with our media agencies.
Support extracting and cleansing data for inputs to models and results ratification.




Key Skills




Experience in R, Python or SQL.
Must have experience in test & learn frameworks, data visualisation, media analytics and creation or utilisation of Marketing Mix Models.
Extensive in marketing analytics, Consumer Insights or customer analytics in a fast-paced environment, experience In FMCG area would be a plus.
Experience working with or at a media agency on campaign measurement.
Good collaboration and storytelling skills, which you will use daily, with external consultants, vendors and Internal stakeholders.

Title: Customer Data Analyst (Maternity Cover) - Sweaty Betty
Description:
Current employees, please apply in Workday.

We burst onto the scene as the OGs of female-first activewear back in

1998. And since then, we’ve been on a global mission to empower

women through fitness and beyond.

By uniting a global community of women – our sisterhood – together we encourage one another to embrace our bodies and everything we can do with them.

Our sisterhood treats every day like it’s made for moving, and we’re

always pushing to do better too. Like using responsibly sourced

materials, launching our first-ever FemTech collection – designed to

keep you moving through menstruation, maternity and menopause –

and supporting girls from all backgrounds to get into sport through

our Sweaty Betty Foundation.

This is an exciting opportunity to join us as a Customer Data Analyst as we continue our mission to empower women through fitness and beyond. You in?

As a Customer Data Analyst you'll turn complex data into growth opportunities, playing an instrumental role in shaping our customer strategy and tactical trading plans. By translating data into actionable insights, you'll empower our Marketing, Ecomm and Product teams to develop data-driven, customer-centric strategies.

Key Responsibilities


Partner with internal teams to identify and prioritise key customer questions, conducting comprehensive analyses that inform strategic decisions aligned with customer needs and market trends
Analyse customer behaviour, product and transactional data on a weekly and monthly basis to provide actionable insights, identify trends and uncover tactical opportunities
Own the customer segmentation model, leveraging advanced analytics to predict customer behaviours, and lead customer-focused experimentation initiatives to uncover new opportunities
Confidently communicate insights to stakeholders at all levels by employing data storytelling techniques, ensuring that complex data is transformed into clear, engaging and actionable narratives
Proactively develop and improve PBI reports ensuring that complex analyses are understandable and actionable for non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborate with the central data team to guarantee data accuracy across by conducting regular validations and deepening our understanding of data logics


Our DEI Commitment

We are working to create a culture and team that represents our mission of empowerment. We want to celebrate our diversity, embody inclusion and create an equitable business. This means doing more and working harder to make the long-lasting changes necessary. We care about our people, our community and world.

We want to stand up for what we believe in and give our people a platform to use their voice. To actively listen and learn from what they have to say. This involves focusing on learning, development, and progression across the business. Being clear on the responsibilities we hold each other and to our community. It also means being committed to equal employment opportunities. Ensuring we consider ALL applicants for jobs and working harder to make our job advertising more inclusive.

Our DEI mission is "to embed diversity, equity and inclusion at the heart of our business. To create a culture of belonging that empowers everyone to be their best authentic self. We commit to celebrating different perspectives and to continuously learning, developing and challenging ourselves and our partners."

We know we're on a journey. And far from perfect. But we want to be a part of the solution to the problem. It might not be comfortable or straightforward. But if we weren't up for doing the hard work and breaking the mould, we wouldn't be Sweaty Betty. We are committed to working across our business and with our DEI committee & DEI Collective to be champions, allies and inclusive, always. Because when we say all, we mean it.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is an Insurance company with 400 employees in the UK. They are well funded and award winning.




They are looking for a Business Data Analyst to join their growing data function. This person will report to the Head of Data and help to understand and execute business data requirements.




Responsibilities:




Translate data requirements into solutions creating
Developing data models and implementing them in the data-warehouse
Design, develop and manage data feeds from multiple operational business systems
Create, manage, monitor and tune operational ETL tasks and queries to cleanse, convert, disambiguate, de-duplicate, transform, load, and merge data into a unified data warehouse




You will have SQL and ETL experience.

They are looking for a Business Data Analyst to join their growing data function. This person will report to the Head of Data and help to understand and execute business data requirements.

  • Translate data requirements into solutions creating
  • Developing data models and implementing them in the data-warehouse
  • Design, develop and manage data feeds from multiple operational business systems
  • Create, manage, monitor and tune operational ETL tasks and queries to cleanse, convert, disambiguate, de-duplicate, transform, load, and merge data into a unified data warehouse


You will have SQL and ETL experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Birmingham

Hybrid working (x2 days per week on-site)

Salary – up to £45,000




Data Analyst required for a leading client based in Birmingham. My client is currently seeking a Data Analyst to come on board to play a pivotal role in supporting the Enterprise Transformation Programme and other strategic initiatives by delivering critical, data-driven insights that guide decision-making and enhance process efficiency. Reporting directly to the Head of Process Development and indirectly to the Director of Data and Insights, this role involves gathering, analysing, and interpreting complex data sets to generate actionable insights that align with both sector-specific needs and overarching business goals.




The ideal candidate will have a strong background in working with large data sets and a proven track record of presenting clear, data-based recommendations to stakeholders at all levels. This position is instrumental in shaping the data strategy and driving transformation efforts throughout the organisation.




Key skills,

Strong Data experience
Data analyst with a proven history of providing actionable insights through data analysis in large-scale business settings.
Skilled in working with complex data sets and possesses a deep understanding of data management, governance, and industry best practices.
Advanced proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, Power BI, Tableau), with a strong emphasis on data visualization and reporting.
Exceptional analytical skills, capable of translating complex data into actionable insights that drive decision-making.
Strong communication and presentation abilities, adept at engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Data-driven and detail-oriented, with a passion for leveraging data to address complex business challenges.
Collaborative and adaptable, skilled at working with cross-functional teams and building strong relationships with stakeholders at all levels
Maintain compliance with data governance policies and best practices in all data analysis activities, working closely with the Director of Data and Insights to ensure data integrity and security.
Actively seek opportunities to improve data collection and analysis methods, contributing to the development of a robust data analytics capability within the transformation program







Interested?! Send your up-to-date CV to Olivia Yafai at Crimson for review

Not interested?! Do you know anyone that might be? Refer a friend for this role to earn £250 worth of vouchers.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who are we?

Volvo Car Financial Services UK (VCFSUK) is a financial services joint venture business, part-owned by Volvo Cars and Santander Consumer Finance, operating across the UK Volvo retailer network, and also supporting Polestar and London Electric Vehicle Company (LEVC). Everything we do starts with people. It’s what makes us different from other companies. If you share our belief in the power of people and our passion for human-centric innovation, you will thrive together with brilliant, like-minded colleagues who are committed to making a true difference.

What’s in it for you?

People are at the heart of our business. We want you to innovate, challenge, and build a future career at VCFSUK. In return, we offer a competitive basic salary of £35,000-£40,000, and a discretionary performance-related bonus. Hybrid working allows for greater flexibility and work-life balance (currently 2 days in the office), further enabling us to reduce our environmental impact and support your personal circumstances. We offer a 35-hour flexible working week, and 27 days annual leave plus bank holidays.

You will be able to choose from a suite of flexible benefits along with Health & wellbeing initiatives, charitable giving days alongside personal growth and career development opportunities. We have a subsidised onsite restaurant plus free refreshments and snacks. You will have access to 2 cars through Volvo’s preferential employee lease car scheme along with, plenty of free onsite parking and electric car charging for your plug-in hybrid or battery electric vehicle. We also offer subsidised home chargers to support our sustainable focus, and journey to zero-emission driving.

What You’ll Do

Reporting directly to the Data & Reporting Manager, the key purpose of the role is to work on a range of data discovery & analytical tasks and data transformation projects. These will include maintaining and improving reporting content, making pro-active recommendations to drive performance and working closely with stakeholders in the business. Key responsibilities include:


Developing easy-to-maintain KPIs as a way of monitoring activity in key areas
Designing simple to understand reporting dashboards to enable effective business usage of analytical outputs
Creating and updating reports on a periodic basis
Designing and maintaining ‘best practice/core reporting content’ to support the wider organisation
Analysing data connected to digital platforms to help drive performance returns
Understanding systems integration and data migration to drive data quality
Assisting with month-end exercises
Data analysis and the testing of new reporting developments


You will aspire to our three core values:

Excellence - You are driven to produce high-quality work, and relentlessly pursue excellence. You do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals.

Bravery – You are willing to take calculated risks to achieve goals, proposing and implementing innovative solutions to problems. You speak up against unethical behaviour, standing up for beliefs, even if it goes against popular opinion.

Collaboration - Effectively communicate with colleagues, actively listening to understand others' perspectives. Resolving conflicts and maintaining positive relationships with colleagues

Do you fit the profile?

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst who is proficient in Microsoft PowerBI and SQL. You will possess a strong knowledge of Data Products and Development lifecycle and be experienced with Business Intelligence best practices and methods ideally gained within the Automotive-Finance industry.

You will be able to display strong analytical skills and be able to provide proactive insights as well as recommendations for changes. You will possess intermediate to advanced Excel knowledge (V Lookup, pivot tables, data analysis) and be able to demonstrate advanced IT Skills, with proficiency in using Microsoft Office applications.

Strong attention to detail, good time management and the ability to balance multiple tasks, and switch priority/focus as needed are important skills needed in this role. You will also need excellent written & oral communication skills, with an ability to interact with all levels of end users and technical resources.

Diversify our future:

Volvo Car Financial Services UK is an equal opportunities employer. We are a company for people who care about other people and for the world we live in. We celebrate diversity and inclusion in the workplace and are committed to equality of opportunity for all employees and employment practices, including hiring, recruiting, and promotion. It’s what you do that counts and we are always looking to expand perspectives and voices to shape our future. With us, you can truly be yourself, embrace new opportunities, thrive and a make a difference.

How to learn more and apply:

We do not accept email applications due to GDPR so we welcome your application via the link provided in this job advertisement by 18th October 2024. For more information and an informal chat, please contact Vickie Ewins; vickie.ewins@vcfsuk.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Boundless Learning we are empowering our partners to deliver exceptional experiences that expand opportunities for learners around the world. We put learner success at the heart of everything we do, empowering our partners to deliver personalized, learner-centric experiences that boost access and create economic mobility. For 30 years, we've partnered with organizations and corporations around the world to design workforce-aligned experiences. When it comes to online program management, we keep learner success at the heart of everything we do and work hard to deliver positive career outcomes. At Boundless Learning you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with passionate, diverse teams, where your ideas are valued, and your expertise is respected. Join us on this meaningful journey towards transforming education and making a lasting difference in the lives of learners worldwide.




Summary

The Data and Analytics team is a nimble and highly impactful team that provides critical guidance, insights and strategic frameworks to the senior leaders responsible for various functions and business units. As an integral part of the team, the Data Analyst will help extract meaning from large volumes of data necessary to make informed business decisions and help set business vision, strategy and roadmap, through that data analysis. The Data Analyst will focus on all things analytics, including business intelligence tools, multidimensional datasets, and partnering with business leaders to answer business questions. They are responsible for requirements gathering, report design/authoring, ad-hoc analysis, quality assurance and documenting artifacts related to the report development lifecycle. Additionally, the Data Analyst utilizes strong business and technical knowledge to ensure the highest level of service and efficiency for the customer.




General Responsibilities

Specific duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following. Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned.

Execute the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions.
Translate general reporting requests from the business into data requirements, acquire data from multiple sources, and develop reports to satisfy the immediate business need, with a strategic focus on anticipating future needs.
Work with business partners to translate data related questions into structured analyses and share findings of analyses in a concise and persuasive manner. • Develop business requirements and process documentation for ad-hoc, on demand, and standard reports.
Build dashboards to measure, track and interpret company KPIs/OKR’s, and identify deviations from objectives.
Leverage sufficient understanding of the business and strategy to provide business recommendations to business units including (but not limited to) Marketing, Business Development, Recruitment Teams, Student Support, Partnerships and Finance.
Collaborate within a team environment to develop relevant and repeatable policies and procedures for preparing business reports and departmental processes.
Define the data elements and data structure that our team should leverage to enable analytical and reporting capabilities for our business development team.
Work with engineering and data warehouse to appropriately capture and store key data points.
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.




General Qualifications.

Four (4) years of experience in designing and authoring reports/dashboards using Tableau (or similar tools like Looker, Power BI, Qlik) is required.
Four (4) years of experience writing complex queries using SQL (Preferably Google Big Query).
Experience with Salesforce is highly desired.
Any prior experience with Data Science languages like Python, and/or R is preferred.
Ability to work within a cross-functional team setting and shifting priorities.
Good communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to interact with diverse technical and non-technical groups, spanning organizational levels.
Demonstrated ability to use discretion and make sound decisions.




Supervisory Responsibilities

None.
